Description:
Company Description 
Since we first opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely – and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take a payment and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together. So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, run a busy kitchen, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. And across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow all in one place. 
Today, we’re a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex commerce operations, sellers just starting out, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers scale, so do our solutions. We all grow together. 
There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a business that is big, meaningful, and lasting. And we are helping sellers around the world do the same. 
 
 Job Description 
The Restaurants team at Square is reimagining the hospitality industry to empower today's restaurants with simple, elegant software and efficient workflows. Restaurants today operate in an increasingly dynamic landscape, and we're building a modern product ecosystem to support this by using technology to unlock new workflows, revenue streams, and means of communication. Our focus is on efficiency, automation, and reliability: themes of paramount importance in a fast-paced environment where great hospitality is key. 
As a front-end engineer on the Restaurants teams, you’ll develop elegant, intuitive, and performance solutions for restaurant owners to use in managing their business. You’ll work closely with your product manager to understand the job that’s trying to be done, consider if and how you should test your product’s success, and build it in a way that maximizes reuse and sharing. In collaboration with other engineers and designers on your team, you’ll iterate based on metrics and customer feedback, and work with other groups across the organization to create the best solutions to our customers’ needs. 
Our team started in NYC, and is now distributed across the US and Canada. We have offices in several major cities for staff who’d like to use them, and our teams operate in a fully distributed fashion. 
What you’ll learn and do: 
You'll create beautiful, unique products that empower anyone to run a restaurant 
You'll design and build products in Square Dashboard, one of the largest Ember.js applications in use anywhere 
You'll work closely and collaboratively with designers, product managers, and other engineers; very often across team boundaries 
You'll ship reliable software through continuous integration, test automation, and in-depth code reviews 
You'll find simple, elegant solutions to hard problems 
You'll grow as an engineer, and as you do you'll lift others around you 
 
 Qualifications 
What you bring to the team and to Square: 
Motivation to build beautiful, intuitive products for the food and drink hospitality industry 
Curiosity, and a desire to learn and teach 
Empathy for your customers and colleagues 
Eagerness to share your own ideas, and openness to those of others 
Experience working in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS 
Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks a benefit, but not a requirement 
Familiarity with back end technologies a bonus (we use Java, Ruby, and Go) 
Technologies we use and teach: 
ES6 JavaScript 
Ember JS 
SCSS 
Ruby on Rails 
Additional Information 
We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Square is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class. 
We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.  Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our  I+D page . 
Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis. 
Perks 
We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes: 
Healthcare coverage 
Retirement Plans 
Employee Stock Purchase Program 
Wellness perks 
Paid parental leave 
Paid time off 
Learning and Development resources 
Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD54566975, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD54566975 is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Title: Front End Developer - Houston, TX 77024 - Indeed.com
Description: Job description Not all developer jobs are equal. At Maya HealthCare systems, we believe in creating a fantastic environment for you to grow and learn how to become a top engineer. We believe in teamwork and in-person mentoring. We believe that remote work is great, but there is no replacement for getting together and pairing up when necessary. We set high standards and we raise the bar every week. We offer competitive salaries. Here you will be working at a well-funded health care startup. We are building a next generation, beautifully designed web application for home health agencies. Our team is a mix of junior developers and seasoned industry experts. You will gain experience as a full stack engineer, learning back end, front end, and deployment technologies. You will be challenged every week. You will get to work on a new product without the pressure cooker environment that is all too prevalent in tech startups. We are seeking full time developers with 1-3 years of experience. If you are fresh out of school that’s great, but you should have experience building real projects on your own or as part of an internship. You should be available to work in the Houston area. You will need to be prepared to show off your past work and answer questions about it. We support remote work, but we prefer people from the Houston area so that you can come into the office a few times a week. Any of the following skills and experiences will help move your resume to the top of the pile: PHP Javascript Modern front end web frameworks AWS deployment Docker CS degree or equivalent self-taught knowledge Code that you can show off and talk to us about Job Type: Full-time Job Type: Full-time Salary: From $57,913.00 per year Benefits: Paid time off Schedule: 8 hour shift Ability to commute/relocate: Houston, TX 77024: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred) Education: Associate (Preferred) Experience: Front-end development: 1 year (Preferred) CSS: 1 year (Preferred) Angular.js, vue.js: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location

Title: Front-End Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
[REMOTE based out of Atlanta, GA] We are looking for that unique person that can help us build the next generation front-end in React for our SaaS strategy reporting application. 
Can you get spun up quickly? Are you good at working with a team remotely? Do you understand how to write, read, and troubleshoot tests? Are you proficient at CSS? And, most importantly, do you LOVE React Hooks? If so, get in touch. I think we could be friends. 
At ClearPoint, the person who succeeds is not just person who wants to just be told what to do – we’re looking for a creative problem solver with an entrepreneurial spirit who can easily understand business requirements and turn them into code. 
For that reason, people with “nontraditional” (i.e., not CS) backgrounds often thrive here. (Although we love CS majors, too.) Given the size of our team (really small) compared to the size of our client base (growing really fast), we take this stuff very seriously. 
We’re a small team, and we’re going to stay that way, at least for the immediate future, so we’re not looking to hire 10 average people — we’re looking for the one exceptional one. Only candidates who live and work in the USA will be considered. 
Responsibilities 
Converting AngularJS services and components into React hooks and components 
Building front-end tests and ensuring test coverage 
Developing new user-facing features using React.js 
Integrating third party components with main application (Highcharts, etc.) 
Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use 
Translating designs and wireframes into high quality code 
Skills 
Mastery of React and React Hooks 
Proficiency in CSS, DOM model, aetc. 
Ability to write and troubleshoot unit tests 
Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation 
Familiarity with newer specifications of EcmaScript 
Familiarity with RESTful APIs 
Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools 
A knack for benchmarking and optimization 
Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git 
Desired Experience 
To qualify for this full-time remote position, you’ll need to have a BA or BS, have US work permission, and live in the Eastern time zone (or be ready to shift your schedule to work Eastern US hours). You'll go through an extensive interview process where we’ll ask hard questions about why you want to work here. Come ready to be challenged. 
Interested? 
To be considered, please submit a resume and cover letter highlighting your skills, experience, and interests. Tell us your thinking, strategies, and ideas to advance ClearPoint’s values, unique culture, and vision for the future. The more specific you are in your cover letter and resume, the more likely we are to get back to you. So, read this posting carefully, visit our website, learn about us and what we do, and then apply. 
We may not respond to everyone, but we will look at every application. As busy as we are, we think finding the right person is critical to our success. If we think you could be a match, get ready for a set of phone interviews and then we’ll find a way to meet you in person. We needed someone yesterday, so, if you are great, expect this process to move quickly. 
EEO Statement 
ClearPoint Strategy provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or genetics. We seek to build a diverse staff representative of the communities we serve. All qualified applicants are strongly encouraged to apply. 
 SK8LOJBAmz

Title: Front End Developer - React - Boston, MA - Indeed.com
Description:
We are a human-centered digital health company that seeks to radically improve brain health outcomes by leveraging cutting-edge technology and machine learning to unlock precision brain health for as many people as possible. While we are steadfastly focused on individuals' brain health, we believe that meaningful outcomes can only be achieved within an ecosystem of care that actively includes and engages physicians, professionals and caregivers. We are a team of 75+(and rapidly growing!) and are embarking on an exciting period of accelerated growth. We invite collaborative, self-driven and impact-oriented professionals to join our dynamic and fast-growing team. 
 
Does this sound like an innovative & disruptive start-up where you could see yourself? Do the following values resonate with you? 
 
Be Real 
 
Be Wise 
 
Be Noble 
 
Be A Team 
 
Be Masters of Our Craft 
 
Think Big and Act Bold 
 
If so, please continue reading... 
 
Please note that while we are looking to build our hubs across Boston, Toronto & San Diego, we will consider US & Canada based employees(must be in those locations when applying). Unfortunately, we are not able to provide sponsorship for any of our roles at this time. 
 
#BI-Remote 
 
What You'll Do: 
 
 Collaborate with with other coders to deliver beautiful user interfaces and interaction design in react 
 Estimate work, prioritize tasks, and execute with pace 
 Perform test driven development and code reviews 
 Coordinate with other developers to follow good design practices and insure code consistency and app architecture 
 
 About You: 
 
Must Haves: 
 
 Solid understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript fundamentals and software design best practices

 Typescscript

 Nice To Haves:

 What We Offer: 
 
 As a health and wellness company, an opportunity to have a lasting impact on the way people and communities engage with brain and mental health, and even to affect the prognosis of people's mental and brain health trajectory(pretty powerful stuff if you ask me!) 
 A mission-driven environment where all 50 (and counting) employees strive to exemplify our core values every day 
 Competitive compensation packages that include an annual discretionary target bonus incentive as well as valuable equity 
 Unlimited PTO — We know this can work both ways, however our leadership team does an excellent job at encouraging people to take PTO 
 A sincere and deep appreciation for the importance of mental health. We have recently implemented a "monthly flex day" where employees are encouraged to take time away from work to rest, recharge & reset. 
 A peer-to-peer recognition program: Celebrating our employees hard work and success is in our DNA! 
 Employee Referral Incentive program 
 A robust healthcare package that includes medical, dental & vision benefits as well as a 401(K) program where Linus will match up to 6% of employee contributions. 
 
 Linus Health is an equal opportunity employer. Title: Front-End WordPress Developer / Designer (Remote) - New Orleans, LA 70119 - Indeed.com
Description:
DESIGN YOUR NEW CAREER WITH US! 
At Southleft, our specialty is front-end design & development. We have a track record of implementing large-scale front-end architecture and design updates for high profile websites with complex and heavy content needs. The quality of our code is exceptional, our sites are lightweight and fast, and we build our sites to be scalable so that our client's investment will continue to pay off as technology changes over time. 
WHO WE NEED 
Southleft is seeking a creative problem solver who would love the challenge of building exclusive, fast, lightweight, and user-friendly websites for clients with novel and ambitious requests. Our ideal candidate for this role would have at least 3 years of experience in web development and a very sharp design sense. You should be able to manage your time well as a remote worker and be self-driven to provide excellent attention to clean coding detail, with the ability to accept feedback and implement positive changes. 
You may be ideal for this role if you: 
 
Are highly knowledgeable and well-experienced with WordPress development. 
 Have a solid grasp of design principles and methods as it relates to user experience and user interfaces. 
 Are familiar with HTML & CSS best practices and with CSS preprocessors such as Sass. 
 Have a working knowledge of Javascript. 
 Are familiar with Git. 
 Are able to:
 Sharply design and develop creative, custom web solutions for our clients’ unique content needs. 
 Engage in high-level communication with clients and coworkers via video, email, messaging, and in-person. 
 Manage time well as a remote worker and be responsible and self-driven. 
 Provide excellent attention to clean coding detail. 
 Solve problems independently. 
 Smoothly navigate among ongoing projects as timelines and resourcing needs ebb and flow. 
 Express kindness and friendliness, listen attentively and respectfully and provide excellent service to both clients and coworkers. 
 Continuously learn, contribute ideas to the team, and accept feedback on work in order to develop and grow as a web designer. 
 
 WHAT WE OFFER 
We believe employment is a two-way street where both you and the company should benefit from the relationship. For this reason, we offer: 
 
The opportunity to work from home (this is a 100% remote position that can be worked from anywhere in the US) 
 Company-paid educational & training opportunities 
 A flexible schedule 
 New computer equipment, as requested 
 A high-profile client base 
 Flexible PTO 
 401(k) retirement plan with 4% match 
 Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance 
 Room to grow & develop your job role 
 Performance bonuses based on individual and company performance 
 Client referral bonus incentive 
 Bonus points if you can remotely work from: Alabama, Arizona, Louisiana, New York, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Texas, or Wisconsin 
 
 
When applying, please include a link to your portfolio and/or public git repository account.

Title: Front-End Developer - Menlo Park, CA - Indeed.com
Description:
Front-End Developer 
 
Job Number:   3181904 
POSTING DATE: Sep 14, 2021 
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-California-Menlo Park 
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree 
JOB: Development 
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time 
JOB LEVEL: Associate 
 
DESCRIPTION 
Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.
 As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture. 
 Technology 
 Technology works as a strategic partner with Morgan Stanley business units and the world's leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global, complex, and dynamic financial markets. Morgan Stanley's sizeable investment in technology results in quantitative trading systems, cutting-edge modeling and simulation software, comprehensive risk and security systems, and robust client-relationship capabilities, plus the worldwide infrastructure that forms the backbone of these systems and tools. Our insights, our applications and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients' businesses—and to our own. 
 
 This position will be the lead developer who works with other developers, business analysts, systems analysts, quality assurance staff to architect, design and implement enhancements to custom applications used in E*TRADE systems. Positions in this function are predominantly involved in developing business solutions by creating new and modifying existing software applications. Primarily leading in designing, coding, testing, debugging, documenting and supporting all types of applications consistent with established specifications and business requirements to deliver business value.

Title: Front End Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
The marketing creative team at RoundGlass is seeking a creative and collaborative front end developer to bring our homepage, corporate web pages and various marketing landing pages to life. Through cross-functional partnerships within the marketing department to collaboration with the technology, product and development teams, the successful front end developer will produce digital content across various owned media, including emails, regular refreshes of various standing web pages, new pages, and other special projects like events and campaign funnel drivers. Reporting to the creative lead, this position will sit within the marketing group’s growing creative team of designers, copywriters and producers. 
You’ll be joining a team that is dedicated to combining technology and humanity to make wellbeing possible for all. We are on a mission to help everyone live a life of Wholistic Wellbeing and enjoy all the benefits that has to offer. We’re looking for your creative insights and passion for visual storytelling to help us perpetuate a happier, healthier, and more joyful world for all. 
 What you’ll do: 
Develop user-facing features and content containers for the RoundGlass homepage and other digital marketing channels (such as email and corporate site pages) 
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs across viewports 
Build reusable code libraries for future use that allow for extensibility of features 
Assure that all user input is validated before submitting work for back-end development 
Work to enforce brand system across various digital communications, especially email and web pages 
Perform regular and timely updates and maintenance across the corporate web site and a variety of digital marketing systems. 
Participate in scoping new assignments and building sprint schedules as required by creative project management 
Build rich blog posts in a timely manner for various story launches by the corporate marketing team 
Assist with the web production process definition, optimization and implementation 
Collaborate with project management to ensure on-time delivery of various efforts and campaigns 
 Who we’re looking for: 
A minimum of 3 years experience in web page creation and management (UX, UI, content production, SEO principles, HTML/CSS/JS, coding principles, etc.) 
Experience with complex, overlapping calendars of campaigns 
A digital-first mindset and strong understanding of the modern consumer landscape, especially email, mobile and content marketing experiences 
Experience with WordPress required (and experience with Elementor is strongly preferred) 
Experience with digital platform design collaboration tools (Figma, Xd, etc.) 
The ability to think strategically and problem solve on the fly: You possess flexibility to adjust quickly to changes and deliver on deadline 
A collaborator and colleague: You enjoy making your work as much as you enjoy working with others to make it 
A strong work ethic, a commitment to quality and efficiency, and the desire to continually bring innovation to work the work and our process 
Strong portfolio showcasing ability to code and deploy experiences, libraries, pages, emails, etc. 
Experience adapting and working effectively in an ambiguous environment 
Ability to work with global teams across time zones as needed 
Ability to travel as needed 
 Why RoundGlass: 
RoundGlass was built on the vision that wellbeing should be at the very center of our life journey. We are not only reimagining how the world experiences wellbeing, but how companies (like our own) support the wellbeing of their people. 
We’re a group of talented, socially-conscious, gritty, innovators using technology and human energy to create a vibrant wellness ecosystem. Together, we’ve built an amazing community and we are always looking for people who share our passion. To learn more, visit our Website, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn. 
RoundGlass does not discriminate against race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Front End Framework Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Traction is looking for a Front End Framework Developer to join our team based in Sunnyvale, CA. You will be part of an integrated team with one of our leading clients. In this role you will be an integral part of a team that produces high profile projects across multiple digital platforms on a global scale. 
You'll be in close collaboration with client, creative, development and cross-functional teams. You will not only be responsible for defining strategy and architecture for front-end technologies—including JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3—but for evangelizing that technology across the team and client company as a whole. 
This is a full-time remote work position. 
What you'll do: 
Develop large-scale JavaScript libraries and CSS systems that power the client's global web site 
Architect, advocate, and provide support for our libraries and systems focusing on maintainability, readability, and stability 
Demonstrate a deep understanding of JavaScript, Sass, web standards, and accessibility concerns, and you can develop robust, well-conceived, easily maintained, and systematic code 
Forge strong relationships within your team and across the organization 
Work within tight deadlines to provide solutions to critical issues 
What you'll bring: 
At least 3 years of experience working with creative teams across design and user experience (UX) disciplines, implementing and advising on fundamental visual and interactive design discipline 
1 to 2 years of professional software development experience with front-end web development (JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, and AJAX) 
Comfortability with source version control software and package managers (SVN, Git, and NPM). 
Strong JavaScript programmer who doesn't need to rely on libraries to accomplish innovative interactions 
Understanding of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, with a focus on performance 
Experience with web standards, semantic web, accessibility, SEO, and the interplay between them 
Understanding of all major browsers and the special considerations required for all various quirks 
Demonstration of a good grasp of semantic markup, templates (Handlebars), and front-end development 
Proficiency in CSS3, LESS, and Sass, and you can write mixings, partials, use source maps, and more 
Working knowledge of package managers and front-end build tools in a production environment (npm, Bower, gulp, and Grunt). You dream of working in a creative and dynamic environment 
Dimensions and Success Factors: 
Thrive in a challenging and fast-paced work environment 
Demonstrate grace under pressure – calm and logical problem solving when issues arise 
Easily develop strong client relationships 
Resourceful, adaptable, creative, and results-oriented with high energy and a positive attitude 
Adapt well to change and is flexible and nimble 
Highly detail-oriented, with a drive for perfection 
Willing to take the initiative to solve problems. 
Strong oral and written communicator with good social skills. 
Well-versed in the fundamentals of visual and interactive design, with the ability to craft solutions using web standards and semantic markup. 
Our humblebrag: 
Join an award-winning, digitally-focused, full-service, independent agency staffed by a bunch of folks who love what they do and do what they love. Still on the rise after 20 years of success, you'll enjoy a satisfying suite of benefits, as well as the chance to work on the world's most well-known brand. 
Will you accept our mission? 
Traction is dedicated to creating meaningful advertising, branding, and experiences for our clients and their consumers. In order to accomplish this we have fostered a culture rooted in autonomy, empowerment, collaboration, and—occasionally—mischief. We believe that great work is spontaneous, and the best ideas come from a diverse team of creatively-minded individuals. Our goal is to be an agency where the journey getting there is as great as the work itself, and we're looking for the right people to help us do it.

Title: Front End Developer - New York State - Indeed.com
Description:
As a front end software engineer, you will solve complex technical and user-experience challenges related to the UI. You'll work cross functionally with Product & Engineering, IT and Security teams to build and operate a secure, scalable and performant system that is foundational to our platform vision. The candidate will be result-oriented, passionate, a critical and strategic thinker, highly organized, have an ability to multitask and meet deadlines, a team-player and team-builder, work comfortably in a constantly evolving environment, and demonstrate calmness and composure in times of uncertainty and stress. 
 
Responsibilities: 
 
 Collaborate with Product Designers, Product Managers, and Engineers to deliver compelling user-facing products 
 Develop products of the highest quality through strict attention to visual and interaction details 
 Code primarily using React (ES6) / Typescript 
 Develop using responsive and adaptive web development strategies 
 Utilize and contribute to our core UI libraries

 Requirements:

 Solid understanding of implementing best-practice, highly performant, responsive interfaces for the modern web

 Experience working with product managers and designers to quickly iterate over and refine product requirements and specifications 
 Good communication skills; proven track record of working both independently and collaboratively in a dynamic engineering team 
 About Company 
 
Beyond Identity is the most secure authentication platform in the market. An innovator in passwordless, Beyond Identity's Passwordless Identity Platform uses real-time access controls to verify identities with devices, and checks granular risk signals for continuous authentication. Breaking down the barriers between cybersecurity, identity, and device management, Beyond Identity fundamentally changes the way the world logs in, enabling teams to continue to work in this new zero trust world. Enterprises and customers turn to Beyond Identity to protect their data and user privacy, and to defend against security and compliance risks. 
 
Founded by the team that brought you the commercial web browser, Tom "TJ" Jermoluk and Jim Clark are now building a passwordless identity platform to make the internet a safer place to do business, at a time where digital transformation is impacting every part of the business, and where security and privacy are more important than ever. The team has raised $105M to solve this problem, funded by leading investors, including Koch Disruptive Technologies (KDT) and New Enterprise Associates (NEA). The company has offices in NYC, Boston, Dallas, and London.

(IMG) is looking for a passionate and creative React developer who will be an indispensable member of our development team. IMG provides the transportation industry with an award-winning, #1 ranked, web application known as AscendTMS. AscendTMS has been a leader in the Transportation Management System realm for many years and we strive every day to keep it this way. We accomplish this with our outstanding development team which is the heart and soul of our organization. Here at IMG we listen to our users, share their ideas across all of our teams, design solutions based off of those ideas, and develop amazing applications for the transportation industry. Our development efforts never stop as we continue to serve our user community. IMG is a great workplace with wide open office spaces that encourage creativity and team member interaction. We consider ourselves a “cubicle free” work environment and offer all of staff the ability to work from home most days. We view everyone here as family and treat each other as such and because of this we have a very warm and friendly atmosphere. IMG as a company is profitable and we are growing year over year. Some of the benefits we offer are unlimited vacation time, healthcare, life insurance, and paid holidays. Your Future The React Front-end Developer position is a very important role where you will be responsible for building, or rebuilding, front-end applications for our entire product suite. These applications will have backend dependencies so experience in NoSQL backend development is a plus but not necessary. You will work directly with our Project Management team who will assign you your projects and you will also be a participant in our daily standup meetings. You will also interact with our Customer Service and Product Specialist teams. Everyone here has direct input on our product development and has a voice, even yourself. The right person for this role is inquisitive, a natural problem solver, technically minded, and has a great attentoin to detail. Extensive knowledge in React is most preferable, specifically experience using React UI component libraries to create highly dynamic, fluid, data-rich user experiences. You take advantage of the latest React features, such as Hooks, to extract stateful logic so that presentation components and stateful logic are both testable and reusable. The ideal person will have a background in CSS, design, layout, UI/UX, and a thirst for knowledge. Salary based on experience. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $50,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year Benefits: Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Education: High school or equivalent (Preferred) Experience: JavaScript: 1 year (Preferred) JSON: 1 year (Preferred) React: 1 year (Preferred) Document Databases: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location

Produce end-to-end wireframes from low-fi to high-fi (presentation-worthy) Independently deliver exceptional designs resulting in a superior customer experiences that drives demand from our current partners, Project manage and work with internal teammates to deliver technical services Help in evolving our internal ways of working and processes Independently ensure deliverables meet stakeholder expectations, including adherence to established timelines and budgets, and alignment with Legal promotional assets, and product creative (i.e. email, social, web, and packaging). You are an experienced team leader who will help provide guidance and actionable feedback in a clear, professional, and motivating manner. Related Work Experience 3-5 years in high-paced agency environment Experience working with a variety of technical and non-technical stakeholders Experience managing digital workflows Proven track record of working independently within cross-functional teams Critical Competencies and Skills Expert knowledge of front end languages (HTML / CSS / JS) Knowledge of project management software (JIRA, Hive, Asana, Trello or equivalent) Familiar with Adobe creative suite software (Adobe Photoshop) Ability to work independently and thrive in an environment of continual change Highly effective communication skills, including the ability to facilitate communication, build consensus among team members, and make decisions confidently Ability to partner effectively with a diverse team located in global locations and time zones Excellent project management skills, including the ability to multi-task and effectively balance short-term and long-term priorities, making appropriate calls on prioritization Exceptional attention to detail and strong organization skills: self-organizing, self-motivating attention to detail, and ability to manage many projects simultaneously Ability to respond confidently to conflicts and manage situations in a positive way, proactively escalating on-going issues to manager Adaptability and resilience to thrive amidst the frequent changes of a startup Compensation & Benefits:  Jebbit offers a competitive compensation package commensurate with anticipated duties and responsibilities. Onboarding Associates may also be offered a bonus structure based on performance relative to personal and/or team goals. Benefits include flexible vacation, 401k, medical, dental, and vision insurance, 12 weeks paid parental leave, wellness stipend, and college loan refinancing. About us:  Jebbit is all about Culture Add, not Culture Fit. We know we serve our customers better when we involve as many different perspectives in our problem solving process as we can. Our team is made stronger by what makes you unique, so we hope you’ll bring your whole self to the job. Jebbit is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity amongst our team. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Job Type: Full-time

Title: UX Engineer, Front End, Early Career - San Francisco, CA - Indeed.com
Description:
Note: This application is intended for candidates with 1-4 years of experience. If you have less than 1 year of experience, please check the student careers site for internships and university graduate opportunities. If you have more than 4 years of experience, please check our industry openings. 
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:  San Francisco, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA . 
Minimum qualifications: 
 
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Human–Computer Interaction (HCI), Design, or equivalent practical experience. 
 1 year of experience in designing and implementing user interfaces (UIs). 
 Experience with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. 
Preferred qualifications: 
 
Experience in JavaScript and frontend frameworks (Angular2+, Vue, React)
 Experience in development or prototyping. 
 Experience coding in Go, Python, C++ 
 Ability to start in 2021. 
 About the job 
At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s UX Engineers are versatile and passionate about taking on new problems to push technology forward. They’re comfortable wearing many hats and get excited about working across discipline lines to develop products used by millions of people every day. 
 
Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the attitudes, emotions, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses. 
 
As a UX Engineer, you'll work on the front end of our products in a challenging, fast-paced environment, helping to bridge UX best practices and production execution. You’ll demonstrate your creativity, analytical skills, and knowledge of user facing technologies to enable efficient, high quality execution and communications and launch innovative features to a global audience. 
User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.” 
Responsibilities 
 Work closely with UX designers, project managers, and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions to web development issues. 
 Launch, iterate, and make a difference.
 Manage your own time, and work well both independently and as part of a team. 
 Deliver innovative, engaging prototypes using the latest in front-end technologies. 
 Provide front-end coding expertise, and help make our products better for users. 
 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Title: Web Front-End Developer - Lafayette, LA 70506 - Indeed.com
Description:
Can you handle both? 
 We are looking for a few talented individuals who can design not only beautiful websites, but can also build out those designs on WordPress quickly and efficiently. 
Your mission (should you decide to accept it) will be to design the UI/UX, as well as the actual code that will produce all visual elements of our clients' websites or web applications. Your expertise will help you bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the site or application looks as well as how it works. 
Responsibilities? 
 You'll have several. You'll be responsible for designing beautiful but usable designs and interfaces for clients. You'll oversee the recommendation and implementation of WordPress plugins as well as the development of custom user-facing features. You'll create reusable code and assemble libraries for future use. You'll work with our QA team to ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs, and you'll also work with our tech team to optimize any custom applications for maximum speed and scalability. 
To pull this off, you'll need to have a good understanding of Conversion-centric design. We're not about creating designs that entertain the designer. We're about creating designs that convert visitors into customers. So, your expertise in building funnels and website conversion opportunities will be critical to the success of our clients. 
You need to be a team player who is passionate about learning, teaching, serving, and growing. This industry changes fast, so if you like change, strap on and hold tight, because we push change to its maximum every day. 
Skills And Qualifications 
 You definitely need to know your way around Photoshop and Illustrator, plus you'll need to know how to build a WordPress site with as little custom CSS as possible. The goal is to leverage the power that is built into WordPress and not build every page independently of the CMS. When it comes time to make a site or application really sing, though, you'll need to demonstrate your proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, and JavaScript. 
Ideally, you'd have a great understanding of designing using Thrive Architect, Divi, or WP Bakery. You'll also need a good understanding of SEO principles and ensure that our clients' websites will adhere to them. 
Oh, and you'll not only need to be creative, but you're going to need to be fast. We have the need for speed at Bizzuka, because our clients depend on us to help them increase revenues and decrease expenses by automating lead generation or automating manual processes. The sooner we fix their problems, the more of an impact we can have on their business and the customers they serve. 
Our clients expect and deserve the best. If that sounds like something you can get behind, then attach your resume with a link to your portfolio of work.

Title: Front End Developer - WordPress - Marin County, CA - Indeed.com
Description:
Alaniz is a fast growing digital marketing and web development agency located in Marin County. We have a tight-knit team of senior professionals and we have big plans for where we want to take our agency. 
 
Our web department is growing fast and we’re looking for a Front End Web Developer to join our team. 
 
Key Responsibilities 
 
Agile Process – Join our scrum team to deliver great work through our agile development process. Participate in daily standups, review & retro, and planning meetings. Manage work in Jira. 
 
Client Interactions – Work with members of the development team and interact with clients to understand needs, set strategy, spec projects, set expectations, ensure project success and client happiness. 
 
Strategy – Work with the team to build sites that deliver results. Make meaningful contributions to marketing strategy, UX/UI design, and technical approach. 
 
Design and Development – Develop websites using WordPress as a primary CMS. Utilize multiple development tools in our technology stack for project planning, wireframing, mockups, development, hosting, ftp, git, and more. 
 
Training – Complete all required training and certifications. Participate in ongoing professional development through active daily learning, weekly catered lunch and learns, and structured professional development tracks. 
 
Requirements 
 
Development Chops – We are looking for a competent front end developer who is a WordPress expert and is fluent in HTML and CSS. You should also have an eye for design and be able to take a website from end-to-end if needed. 
 
Technology Stack – We work in the Atlassian Suite – Jira, Bitbucket, Hipchat, Gliffy. We build websites in WordPress and host with WPengine. We’re competent in many marketing platforms and do a lot of work in Hubspot, including COS websites. Being comfortable with the tools in our stack is a big plus! 
 
Marketing Perspective – We’re building websites that connect with people and generate business results and we’re looking for someone who understands buyer behavior, user experience, inbound methodology (attract visitors, convert leads, nurture and close). 
 
Attitude – Positive, can-do attitude. Independent problem solver that can figure anything out with a few minutes and a google window. Hard working. Fun to work with and a great team member. 
 
Experience – We’re looking for someone who has a strong portfolio of work to demonstrate their experience. Ideally, they are comfortable in a customer facing role, working with a team, and have experience managing multiple simultaneous projects. Agile or agency experience is a plus. 
 
Education – Bachelor’s degree or equivalent. Committed to self improvement and self-led ongoing education with track record to show. Demonstration of ongoing education through design, development, inbound marketing, analytics, or project management certifications are highly valued. 
 
Why work for Alaniz? 
 
Here are a few reasons why we think Alaniz is a great place to work: 
 
Team – Everyone on our team is an amazing person. Everyone is highly talented and a top performer. We play as a team, collaborate, and learn from each other every day. 
 
Clients and Projects – Not only do we have great clients, but the work is interesting too, since we work across multiple industries and on a wide variety of different types of projects. 
 
Agile – We’re a full agile shop. We converted a year ago and it’s revolutionized the way we do business, providing clear process and a scalable framework. 
 
Inbound – Inbound gives us a results-oriented framework and guides our approach to marketing. We are a Hubspot Gold Partner and really helping our clients acquire more customers. 
 
Growth – We’re committed to professional growth. Our team sits down for weekly catered lunch and learns and we formally reserve time in everyone’s schedule for structured professional development tracks. 
 
Balance – We work hard, but everyone takes care of their part (we’re all adults here). And with that responsibility comes a great deal of flexibility and balance.

Title: UI Developer - Lincolnshire, IL 60069 - Indeed.com

Title: BHJOB15656_16159 - Senior Front End Developer - Chicago, IL - Indeed.com
Description:
Myticas Consulting's direct client is a well-funded, financial technology startup who has the first independent multi-issuer platform focused on an investment product known as Structured Notes. Structured Notes are a pre-defined outcome investment product offering downside protection, previously only available to the ultra-high net worth. If you're a developer who's interested in working in finance and wants to gain the type of experience that only a startup can provide, then definitely check us out. 
 
Do you want to build the front-end services that will power a financial revolution? 
Do you have the ability to scale in the face of unstoppable gjobth? 
Then read on - you are exactly who we're looking for. 
 
 How You'll Make an Impact:

The Hazelden Betty Ford Foundation (HBFF) is the largest nonprofit addiction recovery organization in the United States. It is also one of the most mission-driven places you will find. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar field

In 2015, Go Organic filled approximately 50% of our open positions with internal talent that were promoted into the role.

IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter business by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

Title: Freelance Front End Developer - Seattle, WA 98122 - Indeed.com
Description:
We’re looking for a talented, self-motivated, and innovative freelance frontend developer to join our team on a per project basis. As a freelance developer you’ll partner with our developers, program managers, designers, and broader creative team to build client deliverables. You have a knack for multi-tasking and take an organized, tenacious approach to problem solving. 
Activities
 Develop WordPress websites, leveraging HTML templates and JavaScript 
 Work with our development team and program managers to estimate and ensure timelines 
 Work with our internal design team on reviews 
 Assist with designing and implementing new features and functionality 
 
 
Skills and qualifications 
 
 Ability to function independently and still work well in a team environment 
 Strong written and verbal communication skills, with ability to relay information to individuals across a wide range of technical understandings 
 Experience doing frontend web development with an excellent understanding of HTML5, CSS3, SASS, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, AJAX, PHP, and responsive design 
 Experience building user interfaces for websites and/or web applications 
 Comfortable working with debugging tools like Firebug, Chrome inspector, etc. 
 Ability to convert comprehensive layout and wireframes into working HTML pages 
 Familiarity with RESTful APIs and formats (JSON, XML) 
 Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git 
 Experience building WordPress websites, creating custom themes, and developing WordPress Gutenberg custom blocks 
 Understanding of how to optimize web pages/applications for high traffic 
 Excellent at solving the challenges of cross browser rendering: desktop (IE, FF, Chrome, Safari) and mobile (iOS, Android) 
 Experience building single page applications using frameworks such as Angular or React 
 Knowledge of various web content management systems 
 
 
If you see yourself in our job description, apply! You’re just the freelance developer we’re looking for at 2A. At this time, we are not interested in working with placement agencies to fill the position. All candidates must apply individually. 
About 2A 
 
We’re a storytelling agency focused on B2B technology. We help marketers distill technical concepts, hatch fresh ideas, and build persuasive stories to engage customers! 
 
 We strive to create a collaborative and inclusive environment that’s both supportive and challenging—pushing team members to do their best work while providing the tools and camaraderie to make it happen. 
 
 We’re committed to anti-racism and building a diverse team by hiring individuals who bring different perspectives, but we still have a lot of work to do. The more backgrounds, skillsets, and personalities, the better. If there’s anything 2A can do to create a more comfortable application process for you, please let us know. 
2A is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Candidates from diverse backgrounds strongly encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Front End Developer - Austin, TX 78701 - Indeed.com
Description: Applications We look forward to getting to know you! Please share your interest by applying directly through the link below, and we will organize next steps with our team. Apply here: https://grnh.se/f463ec044us DevRev DevRev is ushering in the era of Developer Customer Relationship Management. The foundation of this new category is an end-to-end platform for developers to build products, support end users, and grow their businesses in a product-led era of all things code. The outcome will bring Developers closer to Revenue and increase developer productivity by humanizing software development with the use of design, data engineering, and machine intelligence (AI/ML). DevRev is a company for developers built by developers. We at DevRev believe that to efficiently connect developers to customers, we must harness the knowledge of engineers to build a knowledge-centric system, making enterprise software more product- and customer-centric. After former Nutanix CEO Dheeraj Pandey and Nutanix executive Manoj Agarwal raised one of the largest ever seed rounds in the history of Silicon Valley, they set out to create a highly engaging system of record that promises to make product development and customer service joyous. DevRev is solving a difficult AI and design problem, and the early employees are committed to the marathon of company-building and hard problem-solving. Job Description We are looking for ambitious and authentic software developers who are excited to bring fresh ideas from all areas to their work, including artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design, mobile development, large-scale system design, data storage, security, and more. As a front-end developer at DevRev, you’ll help build delightful user experiences that greatly improve the way developers work together. You’ll also help solve complex, large-scale technical challenges such as data visualization, real-time messaging, and AI/ML enriched UIs. If you’re excited to learn and own your product features, as well as work on a modern tech stack with a thriving global team, we’d love to talk! Responsibilities:  Build cutting edge user experiences and interfaces that are easy to use, performant and reliable Work closely with engineers, product managers and leadership to create a tangible product roadmap Work closely with backend developers to build highly scalable application interfaces Build reusable and responsive UI components using modern tools like TypeScript, React, GraphQL, CSS Modules, Jest, and Cypress Continuously improve the UI based on design requirements and optimize for performance, quality, and efficiency Bring a solutions-oriented mindset to every meeting and make your coworkers feel included in every interaction Minimum Qualifications:  Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience Experience in developing responsive web apps and shipping user-facing features with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and component-based frameworks like React Significant contributions to reusable component libraries with great attention to detail Familiarity with current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, security and usability Ability to write high quality, well tested code to maintain reliable user interfaces Preferred Qualifications:  Experience with real-time communication technology, such as WebSockets Experience building advanced data visualizations Experience with PWA (Progressive Web Apps) and offline applications is a bonus Culture The foundation of DevRev is its culture -- our commitment to those who are hungry, humble, honest, and who act with heart. Our vision is to help build the earth’s most customer-centric companies. Our mission is to leverage design, data engineering, and machine intelligence to empower engineers to embrace their customers. That is DevRev! Title: Front End Engineer (Remote) - New York - New York, NY - Indeed.com
Description:
At AlphaSights, we search through more than 500 million professionals working in the world today to find the small handful of experts qualified to answer our clients' needs. They use these insights to drive amazing progress within their organizations. Our mission is to provide access to dispersed, hidden, and underutilized knowledge. We’ve made terrific progress working in this new space, but we’ve only just scratched the surface on how we can apply technology to this problem. 
 
As a Front End Engineer on our Search & Discovery team, you will enable the next generation of our discovery experience by building ambitious web applications, on the edge of what is possible with today's browsers. You'll work closely with a variety of people in the business to arrive at the best solution, immediately see the impact of your work, and get feedback directly from users. We're looking for people who are interested in building software systems to an incredibly high standard, comfortable working across multiple languages, and learning new technologies as needed. 
 
You will: 
 
 Push the boundaries of modern front end engineering to build elegant, intuitive and optimized web applications 
 Work closely with our Product Team and Design Team to identify, design and build features that have a significant business impact 
 Work in small, nimble teams and form part of a highly talented guild that determines front end direction and best practices. 
 
 You might: 
 
 Build UIs to schedule multi-party communication with heavy constraints 
 Develop innovative interfaces that enable intuitive discovery and exploration of structured knowledge 
 Launch new product initiatives that delight our clients and differentiate our services 
 
 You might be a fit if you: 
 
 Have at least 3 years of industry experience 
 Are passionate about delivering high performance solutions 
 Have a solid understanding of JavaScript fundamentals and also understand the complexities of the DOM and CSS, especially how they interact 
 Know and understand the implications of the latest developments in ECMAScript 
 Navigate and write backend code where necessary 
 React experience a plus 
 
 We believe a broad spectrum of experience provides a great perspective on solving problems in new and innovative ways. If your background doesn't check all the boxes above, but you are passionate about front end engineering, we’d still love to hear from you. 
 
Who you would work with: 
 
 You would join a dynamic, multinational, and diverse team who enjoy solving interesting problems in a collaborative and distributed environment 
 We have self-taught engineers as well as graduates from top Computer Science and Engineering schools 
 Your co-workers will include motivated recent graduates as well as experienced industry leaders from companies such as Google and Amazon 
 
 About AlphaSights: 
 
AlphaSights is the global leader in knowledge on-demand. We connect investment and business leaders with a dynamic network of industry professionals whose informed perspectives help our clients make superior investment and business decisions. With 1200+ employees and nine offices across the US, Europe, Middle East, and Asia, AlphaSights regularly ranks as one of the fastest-growing companies in the world. Learn more at alphasights.com. 
 
Find even more here:  http://engineering.alphasights.com

Title: Front End Engineer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: Starting salary : $95K to $125K per year + signing bonus Location : Remote (Permanent) Reports to : VP of Technology We create software that allows our clients to fight misinformation, keep the public informed, and hold elected leaders accountable. The News Revenue Hub, a nonprofit that builds technology products and provides consulting to news organizations in service of the public good, is looking for an experienced frontend developer with a passion for mission-driven work to join our team. As an early hire on a growing team, you will help set direction with a set of design and coding principles that can help establish a scalable, maintainable framework for future engineers. In this role, you will be responsible for building the ‘client-side’ of our web applications. You’ll translate our stakeholder needs into accessible and appealing interactive applications. You will create a functional, user centered, and attractive digital environment for us, ensuring a great user experience. You are a tech-savvy professional, who is curious about new digital technologies and aspires to combine usability with visual design. If you’re interested in creating a user-friendly environment by writing code, and advancing in your career, this job is for you. There will also be opportunities to work on backend technology for those interested (Python, Django, Docker, Heroku, AWS, GCP/GKE). Key Responsibilities  Use markup languages like HTML to create user-friendly web pages Maintain and improve website Design mobile-based features Collaborate with back-end developers and web designers to improve usability Get feedback from, and build solutions for, users and customers Write functional requirement documents and guides Create quality prototypes from user stories, sometimes without full design composites Help back-end developers with coding and troubleshooting Ensure high quality graphic standards and brand consistency Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies Requirements Proven work experience as a Frontend Engineer Experience with templating languages like Django’s Jinja2, etc. Experience with modern JavaScript including ES6, CSS (Sass, SCSS), HTML Experience with frontend frameworks (React preferred) Experience with Node helpful Familiarity with browser testing and debugging In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment) Understanding of layout aesthetics Solid understanding of Git Knowledge of SEO principles Experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager Build systems (Webpack, Gulp, Babel, etc) Mobile browser testing (e.g. BrowserStack) About News Revenue Hub  We are a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization that works with news outlets to develop stronger business models and more loyal audiences. We help our clients become sustainable, allowing them to fight misinformation, keep the public informed, and hold elected leaders accountable. We provide a robust technology infrastructure specifically designed for journalism fundraising, along with customized strategies for audience and membership and donor development. We work with over 60 news organizations and have had the opportunity to work on projects with big impact. Our approach to sustainability is holistic and we work closely with editors and audience strategists as we do with membership officers and fundraisers. News Revenue Hub works with news organizations to implement fundraising models, automate time consuming processes, conduct experiments, adopt best practices, and more. Our mission is to help newsrooms achieve financial sustainability and take on the heavy lifting so our members can focus on what they do best: producing high quality journalism. Benefits of working at the Hub include:  100% remote team with post-pandemic potential travel Full health benefits (medical, dental,vision). 401k plan with 5% match Home office stipend and cell phone reimbursement Flexible work hours with a generous vacation policy Life insurance Annual performance reviews with merit-based increases and opportunities for advancement Contribute to a mission-driven organization with a diverse and inclusive team of people who are passionate about helping news organizations build financial sustainability—because the public deserves access to quality journalism. This position will remain open until December 1, 2021. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $95,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Retirement plan Vision insurance Schedule: Day shift Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Signing bonus Experience: Django: 1 year (Preferred) Google Tag Manager: 1 year (Preferred) Security: 1 year (Preferred) React: 1 year (Required) Work Location: Remote

Title: Junior Front-End Developer - Atlanta, GA - Indeed.com
Description:
This position requires candidate to be available work in person in our Atlanta office 
Insiten High-Fiver Wanted: Junior Front-End Developer 
 Insiten is a rapidly growing startup based in Atlanta. We are looking for talented, dedicated  Junior   Front-End Developer  to join our high-five team and take part in the continued growth of a dynamic young company. 
 Our focus 
 Insiten helps businesses thrive by delivering state-of-the-art mobile and web applications with an emphasis on an incredible user experience, modern UI, and actionable data and insights. Our latest app, AMP, is a membership and loyalty platform for car wash owners, featuring a slick, customizable mobile app for car wash customers and powerful back-end portal and analytics for the car wash operators.
 Why work for us? 
 Insiten has one of the most supportive cultures anywhere. Our team of lifelong learners has a thirst for knowledge and passion for technology and software. We're dedicated to building world-class solutions for our customers, and at the same time place a high value on team rewards and personal career growth. We enjoy working together to solve challenging problems, teach each other through lunch-and-learns, and celebrate victories (even the small ones) along the way.
 What are we looking for? 
 Are you the type of person who always goes the extra mile? Are you passionate about your craft and always striving to improve? Do you get so excited when your code works perfectly that you high-five the person next to you? If so, you are exactly who we are looking for. 
 What you know matters more to us than how you learned it. While a traditional CS background is fantastic, we are also open to candidates who are bootcamp graduates or self-taught. We are looking for people who love learning, teaching, solving problems, and working as a team – what we like to call "high-five developers.” 
 Here's what we expect you to know: 
 A modern front-end JavaScript framework (we use React + React Native) 
Solid JavaScript fundamentals 
Git 
Branching policies and management 
Code reviews
 Bonus points and street cred for the following: 
 TypeScript 
SDLC/Agile 
Test-driven development tools and techniques 
Data visualization tools 
Database design and query languages (either relational or non-relational) 
Node.js (we use the Nest.js framework) 
Microsoft Azure 
 The Bottom Line 
 Highly competitive salaries 
Stock options 
Unlimited PTO policy and generous holiday schedule 
401K plan with company matching 
Excellent medical, dental, and vision insurance 
Mentorship and training 
 But wait, there's more! 
 Located at Atlanta Tech Village, the 4th largest tech space in the US 
Team-building events, outings, and hackathons 
State-of-the-art workspace and hardware 
Strong focus on community service and volunteering 
Free gym, snacks, drinks, and beer/soda

Matco Tools is a manufacturer and distributor of quality, professional grade automotive equipment, tools and toolboxes. We offer more than 13,000 products, sold primarily to professional automotive technicians through a network of franchised mobile tool stores. Matco is a franchising company, a distribution company, and a leading supplier of automotive technology solutions employing approximately 600 associates in the United States, Puerto Rico and Canada. 
 Since 1979, the mission of Matco Tools has been to provide professional mechanics and auto enthusiasts with all the premium tools, storage and equipment they need to get the job done, while also offering best-in-class service and customer support. Our award winning franchise program equips the company's network of nearly 1,800 independent mobile distributors to develop and maintain trust-based relationships with its customers. Ranked among the top 50 in Entrepreneur magazine's 2020 Franchise 500®, the company continues to expand throughout the United States and Canada, adding several hundred mobile stores each year. Matco offers its franchise owners industry-leading training, on-going field support, pre-identified customers, and in-house financing. Those thriving in an innovative, supportive, energized organization where continuous learning is the norm will find themselves well rewarded. 
 WHO IS VONTIER 
 Vontier is a $3B global industrial technology company focused on smarter transportation and mobility. Our six operating companies—Gilbarco Veeder-Root, Global Traffic Technologies, Teletrac Navman, Matco Tools, Hennessy Industries, and DRB Systems—are united by a powerful purpose: mobilizing the future to create a better world. Our portfolio of trusted brands includes market-leading expertise in mobility technologies, retail and commercial fueling, fleet management, telematics, vehicle diagnostics and repair, and smart cities. Vontier’s pioneering solutions advance safety, security, efficiency, and sustainability worldwide. 
 
Energized by our shared purpose and values, we have a strong culture shaped by a deep organization-wide commitment to inclusion, diversity, and equity (ID&E) and environmental, social, and governance (ESG). Eight vibrant global employee resource groups serve as powerful focal points for connection, community, and advocacy, and we actively support community causes through Vontier Cares. We offer flexible remote and in-person, open-space work options. 
"Vontier Corporation and all Vontier Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), age, marital status, disability, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, and other characteristics protected by law."

Title: Front End Engineer, Data Foundations - New York, NY - Indeed.com
Description:
Engineering 
Web 
Every day, hundreds of millions of people all over the world use Spotify to discover and listen to music and podcasts. We seek to understand the world of audio better than anyone else so that we can make excellent recommendations to every individual and keep the world listening.
 Location 
New York or Remote Americas 
Job type 
Permanent 
We enjoy researching and developing state of the art, platformized solutions that offer the best experience possible to the Spotify developer community. We are currently building the next-generation platform for data management and discovery at Spotify. This platform will offer teams a flawless experience to enable data practitioners to create and actively manage high quality, compliant, and easily discoverable datasets. We lead a strong open source culture, chipping in to large open-source code bases, taking care to build up the community around these projects and being mindful about contributing back. 
What you'll do:
 Spearhead and contribute to Data Hub, our Backstage plugin that unifies our Data platform components and helps data engineers and teams across Spotify collaborate, discover, run, and supervise data entities. 
Work closely with our multi-functional team to understand our users as well as Data platform components features & limitations to deliver a cohesive user experience. 
Deliver scalable, testable, maintainable, and high-quality code. 
Share knowledge, evangelize standard methodologies, and collaborate with some of Spotify’s best web engineers. 
Work in an environment that supports your individual growth by providing you with exciting work, the freedom to acquire new skills on hack days, reading groups, and a variety of internal training courses. 
Who you are:
 You have at least 3+ years of experience in Web Development (User Experience thinking and skills are a plus). 
You have strong fundamentals in Javascript (React), HTML, and CSS. 
Care about software architecture across the front-end, back-end, and the APIs that glue them. 
Passionate about code quality, continuous delivery, automated testing. 
Experienced in building APIs and client libraries used by multiple engineering teams and have worked with protocols like gRPC, REST GraphQL. 
You care about the user experience; building responsive, user-friendly web applications. 
Comfortable working in an agile environment and challenging yourself and your team to improve their ways of working. 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and can communicate your ideas, especially to those not technologically proficient. 
You value team success over personal success. 
Where you'll be:
 We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them! 
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location and is within working hours. 
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration and ask that all be located that time zone. 
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. 
Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here. 
Our global benefits 
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse. 
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success. 
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents. 
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub. 
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs. 
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events. 
Learn about life at Spotify 
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens. 
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users. 
This position is not eligible to be performed in Colorado.

Title: Web Developer/Programmer - San Clemente, CA 92673 - Indeed.com
Description:

 It would be great if you can provide current or past projects (portfolio) but not required.

Title: Jr. Front-End Developer - Salt Lake City, UT - Indeed.com
Description: About You Does this sound like you? You have at least 1-2 years of your developer journey completed, and the most important thing to you about a new job is being surrounded by smart people. You’ve worked on the same project long enough that you’re disappointed with a feature you built months ago (you can build it better now). You're always looking for ways to improve the user experience with design and functionality. You think asking questions or saying, “I don’t know” is a strength, not a weakness. You’re wildly talented and can’t wait to share the knowledge you have or new tech you learned over a weekend. You know Git, or at least you know how to pull, commit, fork and branch. Collaboration is of utmost importance You dabble in WordPress theme-ing or are a WordPress Developer. You know Magento isn’t a color and aren’t afraid of XML layouts. Development is a craft you are learning and hope to perform daily with integrity. Good simply isn’t good enough. How did you know? That’s me! Fantastic. Here’s a bit more about the job. About the Job Work with various development teams across the nation - and sometimes overseas - to develop harder working websites using HTML, Sass and JS. Work with MVC Frameworks in both PHP and .NET programming languages. Use and develop for platforms like WordPress, Shopify, Kentico, nopCommerce, Magento and sometimes custom tailored CMSs. All code you write will be tracked with Git and you’ll be responsible for your part in a feature-branch workflow. For platforms like Kentico and WordPress, you will support backend teams in developing plugins or extensions to fit project requirements. You’ll use Figma and Adobe Suite to edit/modify/optimize images and break apart PSD designs into HTML/CSS/JS and integrate with aforementioned frameworks. Your day-to-day will include working on multiple client projects at a time. Some from scratch and others from existing projects that need maintenance or feature updates. You will manage your own tasks and queue of work given to you by the project management team or customer support. You’ll estimate work, brainstorming strategy, and creating proof-of-concepts for new business. GoldenComm is all for sharing knowledge. From time to time you might give a presentation on tech, code patterns or strategies to your team. About GoldenComm Our Mission Statement: We make websites work harder. Our Core Values: Hard Work Business Acumen Technical Ability Grit Service Transparency We’re a 65+ employee professional services company that builds harder working websites. Our employees are innately curious, driven to learn, and care deeply about growing our customers' bottom lines. Complete with a competitive benefits package: great health insurance, vision, dental, AD&D, and LTD; 401k with matching. In-office perks: free food (daily); freshly roasted coffee (delivered weekly); and on and off-site company events (monthly), GoldenComm is a great place to work. To Apply:  Respond to this ad with "Jr. Front-End Developer" in the subject line Attach your resume as a Word or PDF document Provide three references in the Comments box (important, don't forget to do this, please) Job Type: Full-time
