About Remote
 In person meetings? Team happy hours? Those feel like ages ago. If you’re like us, you’re feeling burnt out on video calls and telling people they’re on mute. 
Enter Two Bit Circus Remote 
While the Circus has been in quarantine, we’ve built a platform full of fun customizable games where you can interact face to face with your friends, lead conferences, team building, and have a good laugh from anywhere in the world. Reunite with your colleagues and still be competitive from the comfort of your couch. 
About Two Bit Circus 
The exact origin of Two Bit Circus is unknown, but clues abound. Some say it was put here as a social experiment by time travelers from the future. Others insist it’s been created by robots. Perhaps the most popular theory is that an inspired band of mad scientists, visual artists and storytellers somehow came together to weave multiple disciplines into the coolest entertainment venue ever with full food and beverage componets. Whatever you believe, you’ll discover an unforgettable interactive digital playground of amusements.

Enthusiast Gaming (NASDAQ:EGLX)(TSX: EGLX)(FSE: 2AV) is building the world's largest platform of communities for gamers and esports fans. As a leading global destination for the gaming community, Enthusiast Gaming's business consists of four main pillars: Media, Talent, Esports and Events. Enthusiast Gaming's digital media platform includes approximately 100 gaming related websites and 1,000 YouTube channels which collectively generate 4.2 billion views monthly. Enthusiast Gaming's esports division, Luminosity Gaming, is a leading global esports franchise that consists of 7 professional esports teams under ownership and management, including the Vancouver Titans Overwatch team and the Seattle Surge Call of Duty team. Collectively, the integrated ecosystem reaches over 300 million gaming enthusiasts on a monthly basis. 
 Enthusiast Gaming is looking for a Mid to Senior Level Front End Developer to join our team! Reporting to the Product Director, the Front End Developer will be responsible for implementing the designs for various projects. An immediate action item will be implementing the design and working with a team of developers for Project GG, a social gaming platform. 
 Responsibilities: 
 Optimize the user experience 
Implement responsive design from Figma Mockups for all device types 
Use HTML, JavaScript and CSS to bring concepts to life 
Work directly with UI/UX team and Backend developers to create an end product users can interact with 
 Education & Experience: 
 3+ years in Front End Development 
Experience with Vue.js 
3+ years of experience using various Frameworks and Libraries 
Ability to test and debug websites 
Previous experience in a leadership role is considered an asset 
 Skill & Abilities: 
 Problem solver and team player 
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines 
Strong time-management skills 
Proven communication skills, with the ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences 
 
 What We Offer: 
 We offer you the opportunity to join our highly collaborative team! We anticipate continued growth over the coming years, which will provide tremendous opportunity for you to grow with us. 
 For more information about us, please visit

Title: Front End Developer - Bellingham, WA 98225 - Indeed.com
Description:
About Social Driver 
Social Driver is a digital agency, trusted by the world's leading corporations and nonprofit organizations for social media, websites, and digital marketing. We are focused on providing strategic solutions that are based on experience working with almost 300 clients in 13 sectors, world-class expertise and capabilities in digital and social media, and a culture of long-term client partnerships — that’s why our tagline is Experience Digital With Us. 
Social Driver is headquartered in Washington, DC with additional teams in Bellingham, WA, Chicago, IL, and Kansas City, MO. Our company mantra captures our mission, culture and values: “we believe the future is bright, all progress is social, and the drivers make history.” We aim to provide our clients with digital solutions that help them meet their goals and, through that work, make an impact for a brighter future. Our vision is “to be the trusted digital agency partner with all of the strategies and creative to connect with people today.” 
In this role, you will work with a team to code and provide technical solutions that ensure our clients’ sites are engaging, secure, and up-to-date with the most recent website trends. 
Development 
Social Driver provides full-service digital agency solutions to our clients ranging across digital marketing, social media management, digital advertising, website design and development, content and video production, and other digital solutions. 
As an important part of their team, our clients expect that Social Driver provides world-class service. Developers are key members of that team. They work with multiple clients and internal teams to plan, execute, and launch websites and data visualizations. They work with a cross-functional team which includes other developers, designers, UX / digital strategists, and project managers. 
You will report directly to the Director of Web Development. 
Programming Languages and Technologies 
 
Understanding of open source and community-based technologies. 
 Experience managing WordPress websites. 
 Understanding of CSS/SASS, JavaScript, and PHP templating. 
 Experience with code management and collaboration through GitHub. 
 Comfortable navigating design mockups made in Sketch, Figma, or Invision. 
 Proficiency with CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap. 
 Experience in charting JavaScript libraries such as HighCharts, Charts.js, and D3. 
 Expert knowledge in building pages and component libraries with popular page builders like Elementor. 
 
 
Project Expectations 
 
Leads the development of a WordPress website from start to finish. 
 Works with content strategists on content migration plans and CMS content type and taxonomy setup. 
 Support content strategists to create thorough documentation for CMS trainings. 
 Themes the website to match page designs made in Sketch, Figma, or Invision and works with the design team to apply those designs across the website. 
 Provides recommendations that include SEO best practices and can include client feedback to satisfy their goal. 
 Launches the website to ensure minimal downtime and SEO impact. 
 Adheres to coding standards defined by technical management and industry standards. This includes cross-browser tests and accessibility checks. 
 
 
Communication and Teamwork 
 
Listens to others and accepts input from fellow team members. 
 Clearly articulates ideas and thoughts/recommendations verbally, and in writing. 
 Prepares well-written business correspondence that is coherent, grammatically correct, effective, and professional. 
 
 
Bonus Points 
 
Experience developing and maintaining WordPress plugins or Drupal modules. 
 Understanding of Agile/SCRUM team. 
 Experience integrating and using Algolia, EveryAction, Salesforce, MailChimp, WAVE, Google Analytics, and Google Webmaster Tools. 
 
 
Professional Qualities 
 
Passion for creating beautiful and intuitive websites and data visualizations. 
 Displays a positive attitude. 
 Demonstrates flexibility in day-to-day work. 
 Sets high standards of performance for oneself. 
 Enthusiasm working collaboratively on project teams. 
 
 
More about Social Driver and why you might want to join us: 
We take pride in our culture and offer a competitive salary with great benefits, like: unlimited PTO, 401k, continuing education, phone reimbursement, medical and dental, STD/LTD, bike-share membership, snacks, flexible work schedules, and great colleagues. 
All Drivers fall in love with new ideas, can’t stop learning, are pretty nice people on top of all of it, and enjoy working with others who feel the same. They get that even the most fun kind of work is work, consider putting in the hours an obvious necessity, and easily deal with change.

Title: Front End Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: We are seeking a Front-End Developer to support web application development for our Internal Revenue Service (IRS) client. The Front-End Developer will support development of critical citizen service enhancements at the IRS using React to both rapidly create responsive web apps to meet end users' needs and create a modularized set of front-end components that make it easier to maintain and reuse for future capabilities and applications. *As a federal contractor, Maximus is subject to Executive Order 14042 and the Safe Workforce Task Force’s COVID-19 Workplace Safety Guidance for Federal Contractors and Subcontractors. In light of these requirements, all employees will eventually need to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment and new hires/employees will be required to provide proof of vaccination. *Position is fully remote. Ideal candidates will be in DC area, but qualified candidates outside of DC will be considered. Primary Responsibilities:  Responsible for the writing of code, testing, and analyzing of software programs and applications Research, design, document and modify software specifications throughout the production life cycle Work directly, efficiently, and professionally with other developers and team members including external clients, senior developers, testers, and business analysts Write specifications for programs Resolve routine production support problems Prepare test data, run tests and evaluate results Develop test plans to verify logic of new or modified programs Create documentation in work assignments such as program code Conduct quality assurance activities such as peer reviews Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university (or additional four [4] years of related experience in lieu of degree) required At least two (2) years of related work experience required Relevant React.js development experience Preferred qualifications/experience include:   software development on IRS specific systems; ability to develop both front-end and back-end (java); web based development using Java/J2EE Technologies; creating and consuming REST APIs; event-drive architecture and service orchestration; JUnit testing, JaCoCo/Sonarqube, Jenkins; Hibernate and Spring MVC; Oracle database development activities; Maven, Bootstrap, JBoss; working on agile/scrum teams Candidates must meet requirements to obtain and maintain an IRS Minimum Background Investigation (MBI) clearance (active IRS MBI is a plus) Candidates must be a US Citizen or a Legal Permanent Resident (Green Card status) for 3 years and be Federal Tax compliant Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Work Location: Remote

Neoscape is currently looking to add a new member to our award-winning interactive development team located in our Boston, MA studio. This is a full-time, work from home position (currently). Title: Front End Developer - Fairfax, VA 22032 - Indeed.com
Description:
Location:  Springfield, VA 
Requisition No:  5.12.21 
Job Title:  Front End Developer – Power & Energy Systems 
Key Words:  Redux, React, HTML, CSS, front end 
Project Overview: 
We seek a front-end developer to join our team. The group is a team of researchers and engineers who create modeling and simulation software for fuel cells, batteries, solar arrays, and other emerging energy technologies. Customers across the DoD use our software to solve existing energy management and logistics problems and analyze novel modes of use. 
A new-hire in this position will work with the rest of our team of software developers, UI/UX designers, and engineers to expand upon a full-featured energy simulation for the US Marine Corps and US Army. The energy simulation application includes a browser-based user interface written in React and Typescript and a back-end written in Go. We are always experimenting and looking to develop new and useful pieces of software for clients. We have several software products which have been incubated and demonstrated and received funding to bring to a fully-fledged application. We focus on highly efficient back-end solutions coupled with UI/UX that is understandable and useful. 
 This position will work with a team of other software developers and engineers at US Naval Research Laboratory (NRL) and collaborating organizations. 
 Primary Responsibilities: 
Design and implement new user interface features 
Work with other team members to recommend software solutions 
Prepare and run tests 
Contribute to product documentation 
Secondary Responsibilities: 
Present work at reviews by sponsors and collaborators. 
Required Qualifications: 
Skills & Experience 
2+ years in front-end development in a small team-based environment 
2+ years with the React and Redux front-end framework 
JavaScript front-end tools such as yarn, react-scripts, and webpack. 
Front end unit and integration tests in Jest 
Git and hosted git services such as github/gitlab/bitbucket 
Ability to successfully complete the NRL security process 
B.S. degree in scientific or technical field 
Desired Qualifications: 
 Experience designing user interfaces to explain physical systems and simulations 
Typescript 
Demonstrated knowledge of advanced Git concepts 
Experience developing components in a component explorer like storybook.js or styleguidist 
Type of Position:  Full-Time 
Travel:  NOT REQUIRED 
 Excet, Inc. is a growing research services firm specializing in science and engineering. 
 Excet, Inc. offers a collaborative team culture where you can use your skills and experience to advance your career and make a difference. We’re looking for intellectual curiosity, a high level of comfort with complexity, and a desire to work in a wide range of challenging environments. We continue to attract and retain the best workforce in the field. 
The company specializes in finding the right people for any research, engineering, or project management challenge. We offer an employee benefits package and overall cost structure that attracts and retains the highest quality of employee. 
If you have talent, experience, and a desire to advance your career, come join our team. 
Excet, Inc. is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity and participates in E-Verify.

Title: Front End Developer - Omaha, NE - Indeed.com
Description:
OpsCompass is looking for its next software developer to join our team and help drive the future of Cloud Operations Management. OpsCompass helps organizations manage public cloud resources by providing in-depth insight into inventory, compliance and drift challenges that confound organizations. Our software engineering team works in modern environments using the latest tools, including a serverless architecture, cloud-native applications, based in Rails, Typescript, and other languages. As a developer at OpsCompass, you’ll help us by developing and deploying ground-breaking capability to our products. 
 Description: 
 Work with business stakeholders and technical architects to understand product & business strategy, to develop compelling solutions. 
Develop software in a Kanban team, with Rails, Node.js, Bootstrap, CSS, and other front-end languages and frameworks. 
Use instrumentation, experimentation and analysis to implement data-driven decisions for product improvement. 
Work collaboratively across a geographically distributed team, maintaining a constant connection to UX Design, Customer Success, Product Management, Engineering Leadership, and business leadership teams. 
Implement functionality to simplify and activate complex data about cloud management, and activate product behavior through intelligent, efficient designs. 
 Work in a rapid development & delivery organization, with the ability to pivot when our users and our data point in a new direction. 
 Qualifications: 
 1-3 years professional Rails experience on a commercial product is required. 
 Experience with Node.js, Bootstrap, JavaScript and Vue.js are strongly preferred. 
Experience with GitHub, GitLab or JIRA is strongly preferred. 
Experience working in professional SCRUM or Kanban teams is required.

Title: Front End Developer - Stanford, CA - Indeed.com
Description:
Business Title:  Front End Developer 
 Unit:  Learning Technologies & Spaces (LTS) 
 Stanford University has an immediate opening for a full-time Front End Developer within Learning Technologies and Spaces. Learning Technologies & Spaces facilitates exceptional teaching and learning. We design, implement, provision, operate, and support an ecosystem of platforms, tools, services, and technology-rich classrooms and learning spaces. Our aim is to provide great experiences for faculty and students in the use of instructional technology and classrooms to create engaging and accessible learning experiences for all our students. 
 Inclusion and diversity are integral to Stanford’s commitment to excellence. We are interested in candidates who have demonstrated experience engaging with diversity through activities such as fostering an inclusive environment, working with students and staff from diverse backgrounds, or incorporating diverse perspectives in their work. 
 
 Learning Technologies & Spaces is an office within the division of Student Affairs which supports a variety of student experiences inside our learning spaces and outside the classroom in our residences, community centers, student organizations, health center, and career education center. We seek candidates who can support the vision of our unit, work to help establish a new outlook, mission and values, and support Our Most Important Work. 
 In this role, you will: 
 Conceptualize design, implement, and develop solutions for complex system/programs independently. 
 Work with a variety of users to gain information, and develop intra-system tradeoffs between different users, as necessary; interact with a diverse client base and outside vendor contacts. 
 Document system builds and application configurations; maintain and update documentation as needed. 
 Provide technical analysis, design, development, conversion, and implementation work. 
 Work as a project leader, as needed, for projects of moderate complexity. 
 Serve as a technical resource for applications. 
 Compare, evaluate, and implement new features and technologies, and integrate them into the computing environment. 
 Follow team software development methodology. 
 Mentor lower level software developers. 
 
 To be successful in this role, you will bring: 
 Bachelor's degree and five years of relevant experience, or a combination of education and relevant experience. 
 Expertise in designing, developing, testing, and deploying applications. 
 Proficiency in website programming languages such as HTML5, CSS,JavaScript, TypeScript. 
 Working knowledge of JavaScript frameworks, such as Bootstrap, React or Angular, and jQuery libraries. 
 Experience with REST APIs and JSON. 
 Knowledge of MVC web application frameworks. 
 Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX. 
 Familiar with responsive web design, and web accessibility. 
 Working knowledge of Git. 
 Proficiency with application design and data modeling. 
 Ability to define and solve logical problems for highly technical applications. 
 Ability to lead activities on structured team development projects. 
 Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical clients. 
 Ability to select, adapt, and effectively use a variety of programming methods. 
 Excellent problem-solving skills, and ability to quickly learn and explore new concepts and technologies. 
 Familiar with Agile development methodologies and a great team player. 
 Excellent time management and interpersonal skills. 
 
 Working Conditions: . 
 May work extended hours, evenings and weekends. 
 COVID-19 vaccination is required. 
 
 How to Apply: 
We invite you to apply for this position, please submit your résumé and a one-page cover letter along with your online application. 
 
 Why Stanford is for You 
 Imagine a world without search engines or social platforms. Consider lives saved through first-ever organ transplants and research to cure illnesses. Stanford University has revolutionized the way we live and enrich the world. Supporting this mission is our diverse and dedicated 17,000 staff. We seek talent driven to impact the future of our legacy. Our culture and unique perks empower you with: 
 Freedom to grow.  We offer career development programs, tuition reimbursement, or audit a course. Join a TedTalk, film screening, or listen to a renowned author or global leader speak. 
 A caring culture.  We provide superb retirement plans, generous time-off, and family care resources. 
 A healthier you.  Climb our rock wall, or choose from hundreds of health or fitness classes at our world-class exercise facilities. We also provide excellent health care benefits. 
 Discovery and fun.  Stroll through historic sculptures, trails, and museums. 
 Enviable resources.  Enjoy free commuter programs, ridesharing incentives, discounts and more

Title: Front End Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: Front end developers at Hawkes Learning will focus on providing the highest quality user experience for instructors and students that is usable, stable, and reliable. We are currently updating our technology stack, and you have the expertise and desire to help guide that update’s final step. Our stack is retaining both SQL Server as our datastore and the use of HTML5 (with Bootstrap and SCSS) to create HTML5 templates. On the back end, we’re currently in the process of replacing .NET Standard MVC with ASP.NET Core Web API. On the frontend, we’re ramping up to swap from ECMAScript 5 to TypeScript, even in legacy code. That’s a no-brainer, and we’re using some cool tools to develop with it, like Snowpack. Where we want you to jump in: The final ingredient in our new tech stack is to select a modern templating library (Vue.js, React, or Angular.io). After taking some time to get familiar with our codebase, we want you to form strong opinions about which templating library is right for us and how best to use it. We want you to contribute your expertise throughout the selection process and to be central as we create and implement best practices. What you'll do Participate as a member of a Scrum Development team Advise and coordinate with Product Owners on scope, risk, and development options to complete various projects Translate user requirements to software implementations by breaking down tasks into workable solutions Independently complete complex coding tasks as part of two-week sprint cycles Maintain current knowledge of the software development landscape and be prepared to introduce new approaches to the team Collaborate with other team members to ensure the highest quality code possible is provided for the user Sustain and curate a comprehensive knowledge of coding and design Facilitate communication across the development team Requirements 4+ years of recent professional experience with a modern JavaScript templating library such as React, Angular.io, or Vue.js, used to create single-page applications (SPAs) To be an expert with HTML, CSS, and related technologies Professional experience with Bootstrap A demonstrated empathy for design and UX best practice Knowledge of architecture styles and API consumption via REST Familiarity with JSON and XML payloads along with associated parsing and processing Experience working in a source-controlled environment (Git, TFS, Subversion) Nice to Have's Significant TypeScript experience Experience using Team Foundation Server or Azure DevOps as a developer Comprehensive experience writing unit and functional tests within automated test environments to ensure JavaScript code quality, like Jasmine Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or an equivalent combination of education and experience Experience in Agile/Scrum development methodologies AngularJS experience About our Development Team We are an Agile development organization who practices Scrum with 2-week sprints. We utilize Azure DevOps to maintain work items, source control, as well as build pipelines that provide continuous integration of code with a suite of test for code quality verification. We use Git and TFS for source control, and are actively phasing out TFVC usage. We deliver new code to production every 1 to 2 months. As a Software Engineer at Hawkes Learning, you will be working with a motivated team of like-minded individuals in a friendly and open environment where your contributions, feedback, and effort are respected and valued. You will routinely collaborate with product owners, your team members, as well as many diverse teams throughout the company to ensure the delivery of high-quality application features that will provide the maximum benefit to our instructors and students. About Hawkes Learning Hawkes Learning is a leading educational software company specializing in online courseware designed for the 2- and 4-year college and university markets. Applying proven educational techniques, innovative applications, and unsurpassed customer support, Hawkes Learning delivers powerful, flexible, and easy-to-use software solutions that drive students to succeed. Hawkes Learning offers a casual work environment that encourages collaboration and teamwork, within and across departments. Our team is comprised of extremely talented and highly motivated members, who make working at Hawkes a very rewarding experience. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $90,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Flexible schedule Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Professional development assistance Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: Remote

About Listrak: 
 
We are a SaaS company that offers an integrated digital marketing platform trusted by 1,000+ leading retailers and brands for email, text message marketing, identity resolution, behavioral triggers and cross-channel orchestration. Our HQ is in Lititz, PA, but we have employees spanning over 30 states (and growing!). Listrak's Front-End Developers work closely with the team to develop new Listrak features while maintaining the stability and sustainability of the Listrak product and solutions. Through consultation with the internal team, the Front-End Developer ensures that applications are developed according to specifications in a SCRUM environment while following best practices for client-side code development.

 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or similar field, plus 3+ years of experience

 Why join Listrak?
 At Listrak, we take every voice into consideration—we invite and encourage our employees to help us solve problems and anticipate the unknown. We invest in our employees and work to grow and develop you in your career. We are highly collaborative and team oriented, and we take pride in our culture at Listrak! Want to know more? Check out more about our culture here! 
 
We also encourage our employees to have work/life balance, with benefits like generous time off, remote capabilities, and volunteer time off. We love to give back to our community (and yours!) and we take our social responsibility seriously, sponsoring and hosting local high school tech programming, volunteering our space for community organizations, and donating time and resources for non-profits like Meals on Wheels, Habitat for Humanity, and our local YWCA. 
 
Check out more about our benefits here. Come join our growing team!

Title: Zindi: Front End Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Role Description 
This role is for a full-time front-end developer responsible for prototyping, developing, implementing, and maintaining features on the zindi.africa platform. The successful candidate will join a small, growing development team at an exciting startup as the first full-time front-end developer for a user-focused platform business. It is vital that the candidate be detail-oriented, curious, driven, pragmatic and work well with changing priorities and quick responses. 
 
About Zindi 
Zindi is a start-up whose mission is to be the top-of-mind platform for data scientists to learn data science, grow their community, and build their career. Our vision is to make data science accessible to everyone, and to do that we host an entire data science ecosystem of scientists, engineers, academics, companies, NGOs, governments and institutions. 
Zindi works with companies, non-profit organizations, and government institutions to develop, curate, and prepare data-driven challenges. For data scientists, Zindi is a place to access African datasets and solve African problems. Data scientists have all the tools they need on Zindi to compete, share ideas, hone their skills, build their professional profiles, find career opportunities, and have fun. 
Zindi has recently completed a seed funding round and is now laser-focused on building out a world class community platform where future and current data professionals can learn data science, grow their community, and build their career. We have doubled our user base since July 2020, and have given away more than $300 000 USD in prizes to African data scientists through more than 100 competitions. 
 
 Role and Responsibilities 
Manage development and front-end infrastructure of an actively growing and evolving platform 
Support with the Zindi team to ensure that the zindi.africa site is working optimally at all times 
Write maintainable, well documented and clean code. 
Have an expert understanding of the zindi.africa frontend code base 
Liaise with the backend team to ensure the zindi.africa platform works well end to end 
Proactively identify bugs or areas for improvement on the site, and 
Fix bugs identified by the Zindi team in a timely manner 
Add, build, and test new, major front-end features and functionality to the site (incl. writing tests to ensure code works as expected). 
Add and test minor site design changes and functionality to the site, such as implementing filters or adding tags to content on the site 
Update site design and content, such as the FAQs, as needed 
 Core Competencies & Skills 
5+ years JavaScript experience 
3+ years frontend development experience 
3+ years of experience with modern Front End JavaScript Frameworks (React JS, Node JS) 
Experience with state management tools like Redux and the Context API highly advantageous 
UI/UX experience highly advantageous 
Experience with Figma, Creative Cloud or other web design and prototyping tools advantageous 
Experience with Google Analytics advantageous 
Experience with setting up experiments related to user navigation advantageous 
Experience with developing responsive web applications with localisation functionality. 
Able to engage productively with website owner 
Creative thinker and problem solver 
Able to get things done and meet deadlines 
Excellent attention to detail 
 Desirable Competencies & Skills 
Experience with building platforms and online communities 
Experience with public data portals 
Strong drive to improve user experience 
Technologies Used at Zindi: 
Application and Data: 
Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, ReactJS, Redux, SCSS 
DevOps: 
AWS, Amazon CloudFront, Amazon EC2, Azure, Bitbucket, Github 
Interested candidates to please contact Zindi at zindi@zindi.africa (use subject line:  Frontend Developer  and attach your CV or your Zindi profile).  If you have not received a reply within 10 working days please deem your application as unsuccessful.

Title: Mid-Level Front-End Web Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: Mid-Level Front-End Web Developer NO RECRUITERS and CONTINENTAL USA CANDIDATES ONLY REMOTE WORK POSITION We are looking for a Web Developer with at least  3 years of full-time development experience  to join our growing team. You will have the opportunity to work on a wide variety of projects and have a great team to support you in your professional growth. The majority of your days will be spent hand coding design files (Sketch/XD/Photoshop > Zeplin) into fully functional custom WordPress sites. The skillset we are looking for is weighted heavily towards interface development (SCSS/JS/HTML), but will also require some basic familiarity with PHP/MySQL. While this is a front-end development position, there is room to grow into working further with PHP/MySQL. We are a small team of developers and you would be an integral part of our team immediately. We know the common frustrations that developers face and we work to remove those roadblocks so you can focus on what you do best. As developers we like clear lists, so here are a couple that help outline whether we’d be a good fit to work together… About You You are confident in digesting complex design files and creating responsive interfaces from them. You have a strong command of SCSS and Javascript. Demonstrating that you can handle typical website Javascript needs such as slideshows, dropdowns, list filtering, pop-ups, etc is important to us. It’s expected that you could develop all these features without frameworks or plugins. The work we have is typically not served well by using pre-existing solutions. You understand what it’s like to work at a boutique firm and have some ability to interface with clients if need be (on specific technical conversations). You understand how responsive website development affects the user-interface of a site and have worked with solutions to implement. You understand the CSS box-model and how the various positioning properties are applied to build a complex layout. You have an efficient test and correct approach when troubleshooting issues. You understand PHP and MySQL at some level and have implemented some basic sites using a content management platform. About Us We believe in creating exceptional sites and enjoy pushing the limits of what is possible. We enjoy a flexible work environment with an efficient remote work setup. We are always busy (as good devs are) and we love what we do. Our clients are design agencies, school districts, universities, and other large organizations so you will gain great experience building exceptional user experiences. We love getting things done and use Basecamp to stay organized. Application instructions: 1.  Please apply via Indeed with your resume, as well as, your three best live website examples of your work. We’d request these to be hand coded examples without templates or frameworks being used. 2. Provide a cover-letter explaining why you feel you’d be a good fit for this position. 3. All candidates will be given a technical assessment as well as a trial period so DO NOT apply if you don’t meet all these criteria. NO RECRUITERS and CONTINENTAL USA CANDIDATES ONLY. Look forward to talking with you soon! Job Type: Full-time Pay is competitive based on experience. Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $50,000.00 per year Benefits: Health insurance Paid time off Retirement plan Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay COVID-19 considerations: All remote work from your home. Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: JavaScript: 3 years (Preferred) SASS: 3 years (Preferred) HTML5: 3 years (Preferred) Work Location: Fully Remote Work Remotely: Yes Work Location: Remote

Title: Email/Front End Web Developer - Chicago, IL - Indeed.com
Description:
BDO’s Core Purpose is Helping People Thrive Every Day. Our Core Values reflect how we manage our work, our relationships and ourselves. As an employee of the firm, you will live true to our Core Values of people first, being exceptional every day in every way, embracing change, feeling empowered through knowledge and choosing accountability. Our Core Values are the standards by which we conduct ourselves day in and day out, both internally and externally. 
 
BDO Digital, LLC, a subsidiary of BDO USA, LLP, provides a holistic portfolio of technology, transformation services and solutions. We are an organization that values your time, talent, and contributions. Collaborate with BDO Digital’s cross-disciplinary team who work together to solve digital needs and unearth new opportunities to drive competitive advantage. Our commitment to each other is why BDO Digital is a recognized leader for our culture, employee satisfaction and career growth. We’re looking for people with the same drive; to combine teamwork with technology to produce amazing results. 
 
In this hands-on development role, the Email/Front End Web Developer serves a critical role in bringing email and web page designs into production, bridging the design and back-end development teams. The Email/Web Developer is responsible for producing and optimizing intuitive, scalable and functional web interfaces for a variety of web-deployed marketing content in multiple marketing automation platforms such as Marketo, HubSpot, Pardot, Eloqua, and Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
 
 
The Email/Web Developer will build accessible, mobile-friendly marketing email templates; create scalable and maintainable email design systems; define best practices in email development; and contribute to email design ideation and decision making. Collaborating with a project lead, you will assist our clients determine the best course of action to meet their marketing initiatives and maintain continued communication with clients and a cross-functional team to provide status updates or request additional information when needed to meet your deliverables. 
 
As there are several cities listed within this job description, we would consider candidates nationwide and able to work remote as long as willing to travel to client site as needed. 
 
Essential Duties/Functions: 
 
 Develops responsive, mobile-friendly, cross-client/browser, and semantically accurate email and web page templates from mockups provided by the client in accordance with global accessibility, privacy, and compliance directives Builds campaign assets and user interfaces that may include dynamic content, A/B testing, scripts for social media and/or tracking, personalization through tokens or field merges, forms, and other needs that may require specific scripting solutions Runs Litmus tests for emails, checking landing pages in all browsers, running tests on campaigns/programs, data capture, etc. Develops front-end applications primarily using HTML and CSS, JavaScript/JQuery, and possibly with Angular and React Incorporates lead generation and event web forms on landing pages hosted externally (e.g., WordPress, Adobe Experience Manager, Drupal, Sitecore, etc.) or internal to the marketing automation platform (e.g., Marketo, Eloqua, HubSpot CMS, etc.) Decomposes flat or layered files from Photoshop, PDF, etc. to derive email/web page layouts, compatible images, form elements, and other components Performs quality assurance testing to ensure appropriate segments, content, and submitted data are resulting in expected cases Researches industry trends to ensure that standards and practices remain current and deliver the best email and online presence possible Develops process flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas Partners with key marketing stakeholders to analyze, test, and launch email campaigns that drive response 
 Qualifications 
 Education 
 Bachelor's degree OR six (6) or more years of experience in UX/UI design, analytics, AB testing and other digital marketing services including setting up campaigns within MA platform, required With Major in Computer Science, Marketing or Communications, preferred 
Experience: 
 Four (4) or more years’ experience with UX/UI design, analytics, A/B testing, and other digital marketing services including setting up campaigns within the MA platforms, required Three (3) or more years’ experience in hand-editing responsive HTML email templates and templates compatible with all email clients and landing pages that may include forms that are cross-browser compatible, required Some experience to test markup and code to ensure that it is valid, properly structured, meets industry standards and compatible with browsers, devices, or operating systems, required Some experience prodicing dynamic marketing campaign assets including emails, landing pages, and forms, required Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them, required Familiarity with GDPR and other privacy or compliance laws or directives as they apply to collecting and processing data online, required Working knowledge of Adobe Photoshop (and to a lesser extent Illustrator) to edit supplied graphics or PDFs and occasionally create graphic design as requested by clients, preferred Experience to translate project requirements and build appropriate solutions in marketing automation platforms, required Knowledge of lead and data management, custom data, lead scoring, and analytics concepts, preferred 
Software: 
 Three (3) or more years’ experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript/jQuery, WordPress, WordPress themes, Bootstrap, required
 Experience with EmberJS, ReactJS, or AngularJS, preferred Velocity Scripting in Marketo, preferred AMP Scripting in Salesforce Marketing Cloud, preferred 
Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent planning, time management, and organization skills Ability to work within a distributed team and foster teamwork Self-motivated to work remotely and independently on projects while maintaining active communication with clients and team members with little supervision Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy Comfortable meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment Able to create and manage process Flexible and creative in getting things done Thrive in a time-sensitive/ high-pressure environment Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to break down high-level business requirements into more detail by questioning and probing for clarification Able to synthesize many sources of information efficiently Customer service oriented Able to articulate technical requirements and obstacles Passion for excellence Fearless, driven, yet patient Understanding of progressive profiling Familiarity with webinar platforms and event management tools 
Keywords: HTML, CSS, Java Script, Word Press, Boot Strap, Ember JS, React JS, Angular JS, Velocity, Marketo, AMP, Salesforce Marketing Cloud. UI/UX, AB testing, GDPR, Adobe Photoshop 
 Multiple Locations 
 Akron, Anchorage, Atlanta, Austin, Baltimore, Boca Raton, Boston, Charlotte, Cherry Hill, Chicago, Cincinnati, Cleveland, Columbia, Columbus, Columbus (BSC), Coral Gables, Dallas, Des Plaines, Detroit, Fort Lauderdale, Fort Lauderdale 301, Fort Worth, Gardner, Grand Rapids, Grand Rapids (BSC), Greater Philadelphia, Greater Washington D.C - Potomac, Greater Washington D.C. - McLean, Greenville, Harrisburg, Houston, Indianapolis, Jacksonville, Kalamazoo, Lakeland, Laramie, Las Vegas, Las Vegas - 6100 Elton, Long Island, Los Angeles, Madison, Madison 8383, McLean, Memphis, Miami, Miami - Brickell, Milwaukee, Minneapolis, Nashville, New York, New York 600, New York 622, Norfolk, Oak Brook, Orange County, Orlando, Philadelphia, Phoenix, Pittsburgh, Raleigh, Reno, Richmond, Rosemont, Salt Lake City, San Antonio, San Diego, San Francisco, San Jose, San Ramon, Seattle, Seattle 601, Spokane, St. Louis, Stamford, Tampa Bay, Tulsa, Valhalla, Washington, DC, West Palm Beach, Wilmington, Winter Haven, Woodbridge

Title: Front End Developer - Buena Park, CA 90620 - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Details 
 Description 
 Yamaha employees are passionate about music and sound! As the world’s largest musical instrument manufacturer, we are known for our quality, stellar customer service and innovation. Are you a strategic and creative leader that wants to help shape the future of Yamaha’s marketing? If so, then check out this opportunity. 
 
Based in Buena Park, CA, Studio 60 functions as an in-house creative agency for Yamaha musical instrument and audio/visual products. The Front-End Developer will work under the direction of the Web Optimization Manager to help implement creative vision and execute website design & front end work that will elevate the brand. The Front-End Developer is responsible for ideation, translating creative direction, and transformation of those ideas into compelling user-friendly web pages. 
 
The Front-End Developer will design and develop web pages that aesthetically complement the Yamaha brand across a variety of platforms in a high-volume environment while being acutely aware of user experience, WCAG accessibility compliance, and SEO best practices. The ideal candidate can work very well both individually and in team situations, should be able to enthusiastically present to cross-functional teams, demonstrate a strong understanding of HTML and CSS including responsive design, and make a solid case for design decisions made. 
 
Here's What You’ll Do: 
 
 Work with Studio 60 staff and partners to lead and develop the overall look and feel of websites and webpages. 
 Provide front end solutions and guidance for e-commerce team, marketing teams, the creative team, and other partner representatives according to style guides, guidelines, and best practices. 
 Use HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, develop cross-browser, cross-device, responsive, and interactive web pages for landing pages, e-commerce pages, product information pages, events pages, and other types of pages. 
 In collaboration with back-end developers, optimize existing and new web pages for core web vitals and other performance factors as reported in Google Lighthouse and Page Speed tools. 
 Provide appropriate schema.org structured data in existing and new web pages. 
 Design accessible web sites and web pages with a user-centered experience approach and in compliance with WCAG. 
 Develop web pages with appropriate web libraries to create templates and API Calls for middle and back-end systems in an agile environment. 
 Troubleshoot and resolve issues and bugs in front end web applications and web pages. 
 Optimize existing web pages and web applications for SEO, WCAG accessibility, and performance. 
 Test websites for quality of user experience, ease of use, and other quality factors as necessary. 
 Stay abreast of developments in user interface and user experience design of web sites. 
 Perform other duties and participate in projects as needed. 
 
 Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table 
 
Required: 
 
 Undergraduate or graduate degree in graphic or web design or equivalent experience. 
 4+ years proven experience in user experience and user interface design for websites. 
 2+ years of experience in jQuery and Bootstrap. 
 Deep knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. 
 In depth knowledge of the application of WCAG to websites, webpages, and HTML email. 
 Solid skills in improving web page performance, including core web vitals. 
 In depth understanding of SEO factors in web site and web page design and development. 
 Experience with UI and UX development in D2C and B2C ecommerce environments. 
 Exceptional ability to analyze existing web interfaces for opportunities to optimize the user experience. 
 Knowledge and experience with Mac-based graphic and design software such as Photoshop, Illustrator, and Adobe XD. 
 
 Preferred: 
 
 6+ years proven experience as a Front-End Developer. 
 Graduate degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience. 
 Certification(s) in Front End Web Design and Development and WCAG 2.1. 
 Working knowledge of workflow project tools such as JIRA, Workfront, etc. 
 
 Here's what we'll bring to the table:
 Comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Vision, Dental, LTD, Life-Insurance and 401k with match AND automatic contributions. 
 Performance based bonus program. 
 Robust employee wellness programs including free music lessons. 
 Gym membership reimbursement program. 
 Tobacco cessation reward program. 
 Free concerts from award winning artists. 
 Discounted hotel, travel, entertainment, and other attractions. 
 Employee product purchase program. 
 Flexible work options. 
 Casual dress. 
 Vacation, sick-time and personal floating holidays. 
 Inclusive and passionate culture. 
 Opportunity to be part of something bigger; changing people's lives through music and sound. 
 
 If this role is ‘music to your ears’, please apply! 
 Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities 
 The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Description:
Hogarth Worldwide is the world's leading creative content production company. Born to make the best work brilliantly, we combine craft, insight and technology to bring creative work to life for many of the world's most famous brands. 
 
Founded 13 years ago, Hogarth has grown from a start-up to over 4,500 people, across 30 key cities and is now part of WPP. Obsessively striving for better is in our DNA, it is the reason for our existence and continues to drive us forward in all that we do, making Hogarth an exciting place to work and a great place to achieve your career ambitions. 
What does a Freelance Front End Developer do at Hogarth? 
 
This vacancy is for upcoming short-term projects that will start August/Sept onwards. The project is likely to last between 4-6 weeks in total and would require the team to work full days on-site at the office. 
 
The Front-End Developer needs to build/modify responsive web pages using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc. based on the visual briefs. The Front-End Developer will work on localization of web pages' based on the assets provided which includes updating links, images and text, in accordance to the client's coding standards. 
 
They must be enthusiastic about technology and constantly be looking at the next innovation. On top of possessing strong oral, interpersonal and organizational abilities, you must be able to work in a fast paced environment. Flexibility and tolerance is a necessity. You will be rewarded with training and mentoring from the senior development team within an excellent team atmosphere. 
 
You will: 
 
 Develop new digital assets as identified by supervisor and management 
 Modify existing code to accommodate for a locale – including changing image paths, server-side includes (SSI), file names, directories, other elements, and other development tasks 
 Develop fast and efficiently to meet tight deadlines

 Update and amend existing assets 
 Maintain client digital assets to the best of your ability using clean, accessible mark-up according to the latest web standards 
 Requirements 
 
 Self-motivated, detail-oriented and organised

 Progressive enhancement and graceful degradation 
 Experience in working with Bash shell

Hogarth is committed to diversity and inclusion, through our ideas, our people, how we behave and conduct ourselves. Creating a truly inclusive culture at all levels of the organisation that encourages different points of view, making Hogarth not only a better company and place to work but an environment where everyone experiences connection, opportunity and a sense of belonging.

Please contact us if you need the job advert or application form in a different format: careers@hogarthww.com

RolkaLoube is hiring a Junior Front-End Web Developer for our development team. This is a full time 40 hour/week position with company benefits. This job is remote, but we’d prefer you to be somewhat close to Harrisburg, PA for team events and meetings (but this is not a deal-breaker).

Title: Front End Engineer, Restaurants - New York, NY - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Description 
Since we first opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely – and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take a payment and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together. So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, run a busy kitchen, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. And across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow all in one place. 
Today, we’re a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex commerce operations, sellers just starting out, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers scale, so do our solutions. We all grow together. 
There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a business that is big, meaningful, and lasting. And we are helping sellers around the world do the same. 
 
 Job Description 
The Restaurants team at Square is reimagining the hospitality industry to empower today's restaurants with simple, elegant software and efficient workflows. Restaurants today operate in an increasingly dynamic landscape, and we're building a modern product ecosystem to support this by using technology to unlock new workflows, revenue streams, and means of communication. Our focus is on efficiency, automation, and reliability: themes of paramount importance in a fast-paced environment where great hospitality is key. 
As a front-end engineer on the Restaurants teams, you’ll develop elegant, intuitive, and performance solutions for restaurant owners to use in managing their business. You’ll work closely with your product manager to understand the job that’s trying to be done, consider if and how you should test your product’s success, and build it in a way that maximizes reuse and sharing. In collaboration with other engineers and designers on your team, you’ll iterate based on metrics and customer feedback, and work with other groups across the organization to create the best solutions to our customers’ needs. 
Our team started in NYC, and is now distributed across the US and Canada. We have offices in several major cities for staff who’d like to use them, and our teams operate in a fully distributed fashion. 
What you’ll learn and do: 
You'll create beautiful, unique products that empower anyone to run a restaurant 
You'll design and build products in Square Dashboard, one of the largest Ember.js applications in use anywhere 
You'll work closely and collaboratively with designers, product managers, and other engineers; very often across team boundaries 
You'll ship reliable software through continuous integration, test automation, and in-depth code reviews 
You'll find simple, elegant solutions to hard problems 
You'll grow as an engineer, and as you do you'll lift others around you 
 
 Qualifications 
What you bring to the team and to Square: 
Motivation to build beautiful, intuitive products for the food and drink hospitality industry 
Curiosity, and a desire to learn and teach 
Empathy for your customers and colleagues 
Eagerness to share your own ideas, and openness to those of others 
Experience working in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS 
Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks a benefit, but not a requirement 
Familiarity with back end technologies a bonus (we use Java, Ruby, and Go) 
Technologies we use and teach: 
ES6 JavaScript 
Ember JS 
SCSS 
Ruby on Rails 
Additional Information 
We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Square is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class. 
We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.  Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our  I+D page . 
Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis. 
Perks 
We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes: 
Healthcare coverage 
Retirement Plans 
Employee Stock Purchase Program 
Wellness perks 
Paid parental leave 
Paid time off 
Learning and Development resources 
Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD54566975, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD54566975 is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Strong understanding of good UI/UX design fundamentals. Self-motivated and hungry to stay up to date with the latest technology trends, and able to make sound technical decisions. Passion for improving healthcare through the advancement of diagnostic medicine, including blood testing technology and clinical laboratory science. Physically, the day-to-day functions of the role require: Standing and/or sitting for extended periods of time. A normal range of vision and hearing (inclusive of candidates using corrective measures such as glasses or hearing aids). Occasional repetitive motions. Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture. 
 Technology 
 Technology works as a strategic partner with Morgan Stanley business units and the world's leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global, complex, and dynamic financial markets. Morgan Stanley's sizeable investment in technology results in quantitative trading systems, cutting-edge modeling and simulation software, comprehensive risk and security systems, and robust client-relationship capabilities, plus the worldwide infrastructure that forms the backbone of these systems and tools. Title: Web Front-End Developer - Lafayette, LA 70506 - Indeed.com
Description:
Can you handle both? 
 We are looking for a few talented individuals who can design not only beautiful websites, but can also build out those designs on WordPress quickly and efficiently. 
Your mission (should you decide to accept it) will be to design the UI/UX, as well as the actual code that will produce all visual elements of our clients' websites or web applications. Your expertise will help you bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the site or application looks as well as how it works. 
Responsibilities? 
 You'll have several. You'll be responsible for designing beautiful but usable designs and interfaces for clients. You'll oversee the recommendation and implementation of WordPress plugins as well as the development of custom user-facing features. You'll create reusable code and assemble libraries for future use. You'll work with our QA team to ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs, and you'll also work with our tech team to optimize any custom applications for maximum speed and scalability. 
To pull this off, you'll need to have a good understanding of Conversion-centric design. We're not about creating designs that entertain the designer. We're about creating designs that convert visitors into customers. So, your expertise in building funnels and website conversion opportunities will be critical to the success of our clients. 
You need to be a team player who is passionate about learning, teaching, serving, and growing. This industry changes fast, so if you like change, strap on and hold tight, because we push change to its maximum every day. 
Skills And Qualifications 
 You definitely need to know your way around Photoshop and Illustrator, plus you'll need to know how to build a WordPress site with as little custom CSS as possible. The goal is to leverage the power that is built into WordPress and not build every page independently of the CMS. When it comes time to make a site or application really sing, though, you'll need to demonstrate your proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, and JavaScript. 
Ideally, you'd have a great understanding of designing using Thrive Architect, Divi, or WP Bakery. You'll also need a good understanding of SEO principles and ensure that our clients' websites will adhere to them. 
Oh, and you'll not only need to be creative, but you're going to need to be fast. We have the need for speed at Bizzuka, because our clients depend on us to help them increase revenues and decrease expenses by automating lead generation or automating manual processes. The sooner we fix their problems, the more of an impact we can have on their business and the customers they serve. 
Our clients expect and deserve the best. If that sounds like something you can get behind, then attach your resume with a link to your portfolio of work.

Title: Front End Developer - Stamford, CT - Indeed.com
Description:
American Institute for Foreign Study 
 
Front End Developer 
 
Full Time 
 
Stamford, CT or Remote 
 
Position Summary 
 
AIFS is looking for a front-end web developer to join their dynamic Marketing team. AIFS maintains several sites across business lines and is in process of a migration from .asp classic to WordPress working in a Mac environment. 
 
This position can be hybrid out of our Stamford, CT office with the option to be remote 2-3 days per week, or fully remote. Typical office hours are from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM. AIFS operates on a 35-hour work week Monday through Friday. 
 
The ideal candidate would be able to: 
 
 Plan, design, create, maintain and update internally built websites 
 Research, identify and implement quick-to-market solutions 
 Test sites and emails across browsers, platforms and devices for scripting and display errors 
 Identify and resolve technical problems, applying subject matter knowledge in complex, difficult or extreme time constrained situations 
 Be responsible for maintaining best practices, branding guidelines and corporate visual brand identity. 
 Work closely with members of other teams and explain technical concepts to non-technical clientele on occasion 
 Be responsible for projects and tasks assigned by management 
 
 Technical Skills: 
 
 Strong knowledge of the WordPress platform 
 Writing custom WordPress plugins, modules, templates or themes in PHP 
 Upgrades to new versions of PHP if needed 
 Comfortable using MyPHPadmin 
 Ability to write code from scratch for custom functionality 
 API calls in JS and PHP 
 Clean up and consolidate old JS and jQuery Scripts 
 Resolving script conflicts 
 Assist with custom JavaScript needed in implementing GTM 
 Expertise in using debugging tools 
 Ability to navigate and jump right into existing sites based on ASP and VB script a plus 
 Experience with wp-config and webservices files a plus 
 Experience migrating old functionalities built in ASP to WordPress platform a plus 
 
 Additional Qualifications: 
 
 Maintain well-documented, reusable and transferrable code 
 Working knowledge of Gitlab or other version control platforms 
 Understanding of DataTables utilized in ASP and WP 
 Proven skills in resolving technical problems related to code conflicts, API's, etc. 
 Experience with custom form field validation and troubleshooting issues with form submissions to CRM

 Clean up and streamline existing CSS to make it more scalable 
 Ability to write redirects utilizing WordPress plugin, http access file or web-config file

 Assist with HubSpot and WordPress integration 
 Understanding of HubSpot forms or Formidable forms in WordPress 
 Experience with ACF or PODS to create custom post types 
 Work closely with team members and vendors to collaborate on projects and communicating progress frequently 
 
 AIFS Benefits 
 
 We are proud to offer fantastic vision, dental, and medical/prescription insurance. In addition, we provide all employees and their family members free access to confidential professional counseling and support services. 
 We provide retirement savings options through Fidelity Investments with Company Match and Employer Discretionary Elective Contribution.

 We provide Full-time employees with up to twelve (12) weeks of paid parental leave after one (1) year of service. 
 We also offer Company sponsored benefits, life insurance and short- and long-term disability. 
 
 The American Institute for Foreign Study has been committed to cross-cultural exchange for over 50 years. We have been a leading organization in providing cultural exchange and educational opportunities for more than 1.5 million people. Come be a part of our vision of Bringing the World Together! 
 
We were named one of the top places to work in Connecticut in 2011, 2015, and in 2018.

Title: UX Engineer, Front End, Early Career - San Francisco, CA - Indeed.com
Description:
Note: This application is intended for candidates with 1-4 years of experience. If you have less than 1 year of experience, please check the student careers site for internships and university graduate opportunities. If you have more than 4 years of experience, please check our industry openings. 
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:  San Francisco, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA . 
Minimum qualifications: 
 
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Human–Computer Interaction (HCI), Design, or equivalent practical experience. 
 1 year of experience in designing and implementing user interfaces (UIs). 
 Experience with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. 
Preferred qualifications: 
 
Experience in JavaScript and frontend frameworks (Angular2+, Vue, React)
 Experience in development or prototyping. 
 Experience coding in Go, Python, C++ 
 Ability to start in 2021. 
 About the job 
At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s UX Engineers are versatile and passionate about taking on new problems to push technology forward. They’re comfortable wearing many hats and get excited about working across discipline lines to develop products used by millions of people every day. 
 
Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the attitudes, emotions, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses. 
 
As a UX Engineer, you'll work on the front end of our products in a challenging, fast-paced environment, helping to bridge UX best practices and production execution. You’ll demonstrate your creativity, analytical skills, and knowledge of user facing technologies to enable efficient, high quality execution and communications and launch innovative features to a global audience. 
User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.” 
Responsibilities 
 Work closely with UX designers, project managers, and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions to web development issues. 
 Launch, iterate, and make a difference.
 Manage your own time, and work well both independently and as part of a team. 
 Deliver innovative, engaging prototypes using the latest in front-end technologies. 
 Provide front-end coding expertise, and help make our products better for users. 
 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

 The Washington Post is hiring a Front End Software Engineer for our Research, Experimentation and Development technology (RED) team.  Why join Listrak?
 At Listrak, we take every voice into consideration—we invite and encourage our employees to help us solve problems and anticipate the unknown. Title: Front-end Software Developer - Denver, CO - Indeed.com
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY 
Looking to build something cool using modern technology? Do you want to work with a passionate, collaborative, and innovative team that values your contributions and lets you be yourself? At Cloudrise we have a proven entrepreneur as our leader, unparalleled experience in the data protection space, a world-class team, and a business that is rapidly expanding. 
 
If you are interested in being part of a team whose vision is to improve the quality of work-life for employees and customers by developing a platform for connecting knowledge, processes, and people to help scale and support the delivery of Cloudrise services…keep reading. 
 
As a front-end focused developer, you’ll work closely with product and business owners, and other developers to design and implement front-end functionality and user experience that directly improves your fellow employees work life. You’ll be a member of a cross functional development team creating flexible and maintainable distributed systems that help Cloudrise scale and adapt to changing business needs. 
 
Our ideal candidate is passionate about customer success, has a strong commitment to the craft and practice of software development, and can exercise their depth of technical skill and experience to solve problems and find elegant solutions. We’re a small development organization where a meaningful desire to dive in and help push is tantamount to the success of the team. 
DUTIES & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS 
  Develop new user-facing functionality. 
· Build reusable code and libraries for future use. 
· Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs. 
· Work with the rest of the development team to ensure feasibility and interoperability with API interfaces and application backend functionality. 
· Participate in stakeholder meetings, assist with documenting requirements, and research in-scope technologies if prior knowledge does not exist. 
· Work with third-party software vendors to determine how to best deploy and configure their products, understand typical usage scenarios, and determine optimal integration approaches. 
QUALIFICATIONS 
· 3+ years software development experience. 
· Strong problem-solving and communication skills. 
· Ability to learn quickly and work both independently and as part of a team. 
· A technical mindset with great attention to detail. 
· Commitment to improving your skill as a software craftsperson. 
· Professional experience implementing web application UI/UX functionality with one or more of the common Front-end frameworks. 
· Experience developing CI/CD pipelines and testing UI and front-end components. 
· Understanding of software quality assurance principles. 
This list of duties and responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties or responsibilities that management may deem necessary from time to time. 
ABOUT CLOUDRISE 
At Cloudrise, we are redefining data protection through automation. Founded by business and security entrepreneurs with experience in global markets, successful start-ups, and Fortune 500 companies, we have spent the past two decades delivering seamless and integrated data protection solutions to our customers, raising the bar for innovation, service delivery, and risk reduction. Combining our expertise with automation, Cloudrise focuses on securing data wherever it resides – We assist organizations by assessing, enabling, automating, and managing their data protection and privacy programs. Cloudrise is headquartered in Grand Junction, CO, with an office in Denver, CO.
