Description:
Sangoma Technologies is a trusted leader in value-based Unified Communications solutions for SMBs, enterprises, OEMs, carriers, and service providers. Sangoma is the primary developer and sponsor of the Asterisk and FreePBX projects and offers Voice over IP systems which enable businesses to achieve enhanced levels of collaboration, productivity, and ROI. 
 Sangoma Meet team is looking for a Frontend Developer with a can-do attitude and self-motivation for participating in the development of a geo-distributed and highly available video platform. Working closely with our UI/UX architect, this role will contribute to build easy to use features that would simply make our customer’s life easier. As a member of the team, you will be responsible for designing and developing responsive, high performance, reliable React-based web applications targeting both mobile devices and desktop clients. 
 We leverage several open-source software written in different languages for the various part of our solution, so the ideal candidate will be a generalist and polyglot that can navigate through the different stacks and address issues concerning the system as a whole. 
 We are on a mission: we hire creative, intelligent, talented people; we build great products that delight our customers; and we are doing it in a rewarding way– a way that feels good and makes us proud to be part of Sangoma. 
 The chosen individual will have abundant opportunities to contribute to product evolution, and to acquire new knowledge and skills. 
 If you want your abilities to have a tangible impact, join our team! 
 You Are Great At 
 Design and develop responsive, high performance, reliable React-based web applications targeting both mobile devices and desktop clients. 
 Participate in how our enterprise grade SaaS solutions are built, deployed, and operated in a true Agile setting supported by senior developers, testers, and product managers 
 Create wireframes, storyboards, sitemaps prototype and screen flows 
 Deliver high fidelity UI assets which can be easily translated to UI components 
 Optimize existing user interface designs based on market trends 
 Understand business goals and objectives 
 Prototype new ideas and run experiments to identify features that users love 
 Conduct an ongoing user research 
 Contribute to the design and improvement of web features and projects 
 
 What It Takes (Must haves) 
 Minimum 2 years of experience in design/development of web applications. 
 Good knowledge in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript and React. 
 Experience with version control tools, preferably git. 
 Good understanding of WebSockets and HTTPS protocol 
 Deep knowledge of the Adobe Suite and Figma 
 Ability to quickly learn new technologies and tools 
 Fluent in spoken and written English 
 
 Desired Skills & Experience (Nice to haves) 
 Experience with end-to-end release and deployment of web applications. 
 Eager; curious and passionate to learn about technology and processes. 
 Collaborative; values team success more than individual accomplishments. 
 Passion for knowledge; a desire to learn and share knowledge. 
 Problem-solver; always ready to dive in and tackle problems head on. 
 Strive to create and maintain clean code and engage in peer code reviews 
 Proven ability to translate approved UI / UX design mock-ups to feature-rich, pixel-perfect websites and web applications 
 Ability to write clean, modular, high-performance, reusable code/ UI components/libraries Experience integrating RESTful services and API 
 Exceptional eye for detail and passion for quality 
 Inquisitive; not afraid to ask questions. 
 A compelling portfolio of work that demonstrates high-quality design work that also tells a story that you are a deep design thinker. 
 
 Benefits: 
 We are proud to offer a comprehensive benefits package to eligible employees, which is designed to promote their personal well being as well as of their families. Sangoma not only offers a very competitive health benefits package including medical, dental, and vision coverage, we also offer income protection benefits including life insurance, short term disability, and long term disability. 
 About Sangoma 
 Founded in 1984, Sangoma Technologies (TSX VENTURE: STC) is a trusted leader in value-based Unified Communications (UC) and UC as a Service (UCaaS) solutions for SMBs, enterprises, OEMs, carriers, and service providers. Sangoma’s Voice over IP offerings include on-premise and cloud-based phone systems, SIP trunking services, and telephony hardware. Sangoma’s products and services are used in leading PBX, IVR, contact center, carrier networks, and data communication applications worldwide. Businesses can achieve enhanced levels of collaboration, productivity, and ROI with Sangoma. Everything Connects, Connect with Sangoma! Additional information can be found at www.sangoma.com, www.asterisk.org, and www.freepbx.org.

Title: Junior Front End Developer - Huntsville, AL - Indeed.com
Description:
Sangoma Technologies is a trusted leader in value-based Unified Communications solutions for SMBs, enterprises, OEMs, carriers, and service providers. Sangoma is the primary developer and sponsor of the Asterisk and FreePBX projects and offers Voice over IP systems which enable businesses to achieve enhanced levels of collaboration, productivity, and ROI. 
 Sangoma Meet team is looking for a Frontend Developer with a can-do attitude and self-motivation for participating in the development of a geo-distributed and highly available video platform. Working closely with our UI/UX architect, this role will contribute to build easy to use features that would simply make our customer’s life easier. As a member of the team, you will be responsible for designing and developing responsive, high performance, reliable React-based web applications targeting both mobile devices and desktop clients. 
 We leverage several open-source software written in different languages for the various part of our solution, so the ideal candidate will be a generalist and polyglot that can navigate through the different stacks and address issues concerning the system as a whole. 
 We are on a mission: we hire creative, intelligent, talented people; we build great products that delight our customers; and we are doing it in a rewarding way– a way that feels good and makes us proud to be part of Sangoma. 
 The chosen individual will have abundant opportunities to contribute to product evolution, and to acquire new knowledge and skills. 
 If you want your abilities to have a tangible impact, join our team! 
 You Are Great At 
 Design and develop responsive, high performance, reliable React-based web applications targeting both mobile devices and desktop clients. 
 Participate in how our enterprise grade SaaS solutions are built, deployed, and operated in a true Agile setting supported by senior developers, testers, and product managers 
 Create wireframes, storyboards, sitemaps prototype and screen flows 
 Deliver high fidelity UI assets which can be easily translated to UI components 
 Optimize existing user interface designs based on market trends 
 Understand business goals and objectives 
 Prototype new ideas and run experiments to identify features that users love 
 Conduct an ongoing user research 
 Contribute to the design and improvement of web features and projects 
 
 What It Takes (Must haves) 
 Minimum 2 years of experience in design/development of web applications. 
 Good knowledge in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript and React. 
 Experience with version control tools, preferably git. 
 Good understanding of WebSockets and HTTPS protocol 
 Deep knowledge of the Adobe Suite and Figma 
 Ability to quickly learn new technologies and tools 
 Fluent in spoken and written English 
 
 Desired Skills & Experience (Nice to haves) 
 Experience with end-to-end release and deployment of web applications. 
 Eager; curious and passionate to learn about technology and processes. 
 Collaborative; values team success more than individual accomplishments. 
 Passion for knowledge; a desire to learn and share knowledge. 
 Problem-solver; always ready to dive in and tackle problems head on. 
 Strive to create and maintain clean code and engage in peer code reviews 
 Proven ability to translate approved UI / UX design mock-ups to feature-rich, pixel-perfect websites and web applications 
 Ability to write clean, modular, high-performance, reusable code/ UI components/libraries Experience integrating RESTful services and API 
 Exceptional eye for detail and passion for quality 
 Inquisitive; not afraid to ask questions. 
 A compelling portfolio of work that demonstrates high-quality design work that also tells a story that you are a deep design thinker. 
 
 Benefits: 
 We are proud to offer a comprehensive benefits package to eligible employees, which is designed to promote their personal well being as well as of their families. Sangoma not only offers a very competitive health benefits package including medical, dental, and vision coverage, we also offer income protection benefits including life insurance, short term disability, and long term disability. 
 About Sangoma 
 Founded in 1984, Sangoma Technologies (TSX VENTURE: STC) is a trusted leader in value-based Unified Communications (UC) and UC as a Service (UCaaS) solutions for SMBs, enterprises, OEMs, carriers, and service providers. Sangoma’s Voice over IP offerings include on-premise and cloud-based phone systems, SIP trunking services, and telephony hardware. Sangoma’s products and services are used in leading PBX, IVR, contact center, carrier networks, and data communication applications worldwide. Businesses can achieve enhanced levels of collaboration, productivity, and ROI with Sangoma. Everything Connects, Connect with Sangoma! Additional information can be found at www.sangoma.com, www.asterisk.org, and www.freepbx.org.

Title: Sr. Front-End Software Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: About Test Innovators We are Test Innovators. We set out to help students succeed on standardized tests, and in the process, we’ve begun disrupting old-fashioned educational assessment. Isn’t it about time? We’ve built an online platform that learns about students’ performance and gives them personalized feedback to help them improve. Over 150,000 students have used our platform, and we partner with hundreds of schools and non-profit organizations, many of which help less-advantaged students. We believe that we have a good shot at disrupting a multi-billion dollar space that hasn’t changed in about 70 years. The right candidate is an enthusiastic self-starter who appreciates the importance of education and can help us innovate into the future. About the role You will be spearheading our migration from AngularJS 1.X to React. Our current tech stack is built in AngularJS, Node.js, Express.js, and mysql. You will have a lot of autonomy to make design decisions for the rest of our team to follow. You will be learning and implementing the latest and greatest as we migrate to newer technology. Your opinion and expertise will be sought and respected. Test Innovators is a successful company; in fact, we’ve bootstrapped our way to where we are today and are continuing our fast growth. We promise you will be a part of an exciting ride. You will have a large impact in a development team of seven within a close-knit company of 20 people. Everyone will know your name and you will be appreciated when you do excellent work. 7+ years of front-end javascript experience 3+ years of React Great if you have led or been part of a React Migration in the past. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $80,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Employee discount Flexible schedule Health insurance Health savings account Paid time off Parental leave Retirement plan Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Experience: Front-end development: 5 years (Preferred) Work Location: Remote

 Harvard Kennedy School’s Mission and Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging 
 
At Harvard Kennedy School, fostering a diverse and inclusive community where everyone feels they belong is a matter of basic fairness consistent with our core values as an institution. Wellness Options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation and complimentary health services.

Title: Senior Developer, Front End - Northbrook, IL - Indeed.com
Description:
We inspire purpose-filled living that brings joy to the modern home. With a team of more than 8,000 associates spanning 130 store and distribution locations across the U.S. and Canada, we achieve together, drive results and innovate to inspire. Drawn together by a shared passion for our customers and a spirit of fun, we deliver high-quality home furnishings that are expertly designed, responsibly sourced and bring beauty and function to people’s homes. From the day we opened our first store in Chicago in 1962 to the digital innovations that engage millions of customers today, our iconic brand is nearly 60 years in the making—and our story is still unfolding. 
We’re here for it. We think you should be too. We’re looking for a driven professional with an inclusive mindset to join our team as a Senior Developer, Front End... 
Do you have a passion for site speed and performance? Want to help make our website one of the fastest retail websites and take on the technical challenges and innovation to make our site both inspirational and beautiful while being speedy? Then come join our team as a Senior Front End Developer. You will join an innovative eCommerce team responsible for delivering solutions built for sustainability and performance. You will collaborate closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers to design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment. 
What you'll do... 
Develop, and implement solutions using HTML, CSS, and Javascript as your tools and ASP.NET (MVC) as your environment. 
Conceive and build responsive and adaptive solutions for website applications. 
Participate in technical design discussions with other front end and back end developers and assist in defining future forward web architecture, participate in code reviews, and apply unit testing. 
Work with the architecture and eCommerce development teams to optimize page speed performance and improve the customer experience on our sites. 
Work on an Agile team to develop, test, deploy, and maintain, while collaborating with team members on product backlog grooming, sprint planning, execution, review, and retrospective. 
Work with product team and stakeholders to understand and communicate progress. 
Update, maintain and adhere to pattern-libraries, styleguides, and site documentation. 
Be an active contributor to front-end development best practices. 
What you'll bring... 
You have been building websites using HTML/CSS/Javascript for 3+ years, and you can show it 
You can communicate to people in product management, design, user experience, and QA, and they will understand you 
You have excellent knowledge of CSS and Javascript coding best practices 
You can build responsive, cross-browser, highly-performant, and accessible applications 
You have experience working with a JavaScript framework (e.g. React, Angular, Vue.js) 
Deep understanding of modern web development techniques and how to apply new technologies to improve the architecture and boost page speed 
Experience with Twitter Bootstrap or Foundation or the like. You know about CSS preprocessors (LESS or SASS) 
Have prior knowledge or a willingness to learn modern performance monitoring tools and waterfall analysis 
We’re looking for someone who is strong technically who also demonstrates effective communication skills. Our ideal candidate should be able to identify opportunities for improvement, apply code changes including new architecture and explain new patterns to developers on the team. In addition, they should be able to explain performance metrics and improvement opportunities to business stakeholders 
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Graphic Design, or Visual Communication desired but not required 
We do not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position 
Good reading, written and verbal language skills (English) 
#Remote

Title: Front-End Developer - San Mateo, CA 94401 - Indeed.com
Description:
About Backblaze 
 Backblaze originated in a founder’s one-bedroom apartment where five people committed to helping people save their data. Backblaze provides cloud storage and backup that’s astonishingly easy to use and affordable. Our customers use our services so they can pursue dreams like curing cancer (genome mapping is data intensive), archiving the work of some of the greatest artists on the planet (learn more about how Austin City Limits uses B2), or simply sleeping well at night (anyone that’s spilled a cup of coffee on a laptop knows the relief that comes with complete, secure backups). We are entrusted with well over an exabyte of data from customers in more than 175 countries. We exited 2020 growing rapidly, and we've done it all with just $3M in total funding. 
 We’ve managed to nurture a team-oriented culture with amazingly low turnover. Our approach is guided by honesty, transparency, and a commitment to doing the right thing for our customers and coworkers. Our customers are happy, and so are our coworkers: In the most recent “Great Place to Work” survey, 99% of our team rated Backblaze as “a great place to work.” Check out what our employees are saying on Glassdoor! 
 But while there is a lot to celebrate in our past, there is almost as much opportunity ahead of us. We are seeking a  Front End Developer! 
 What you will do: 
 You will utilize HTML, ReactJS, CSS and jQuery to develop intuitive, elegant user experiences. As a member of our Front End Dev team, you will work closely with our web development, software design, UI designer and marketing teams. 
 On a day to day basis, you must be able to convert image mockups to HTML or ReactJS - There’s some production work that needs to get done. But you will also be responsible for helping build out new features, rethink old processes, and enabling third party systems to empower our marketing/sales/ and support teams. 
 We’re looking for someone that is: 
 Passionate about building friendly, easy to use Interfaces and APIs. 
 Likes to work closely with other engineers, support, and marketing to help customers. 
 Is comfortable working on their own on a mutually agreed upon prioritization queue (we don’t micromanage, we do make sure tasks are reasonably defined and scoped) 
 Diligent with quality control. Backblaze prides itself on giving our team autonomy to get work done, do the right thing for our customers, and keep a pace that is sustainable over the long run. As such, we expect everyone that checks in code that is stable. We also have a small QA team that operates as a secondary check when needed. 
 
 The Right Fit: 
 3-5+ years of experience working with HTML, CSS, Javascript (ES5), ReactJS, and WordPress 
 3-5+ years of experience with jQuery, Bootstrap 3+, 
 Understanding of ensuring cross-browser compatibility and browser security for features 
 Basic SEO skills and ensuring that applications will adhere to them 
 Engineering best practices such as unit testing, and conducting code reviews 
 Using mainstream software tests, development tools / applications (Jira, Jenkins, Git, Splunk, etc.) 
 Knowledge of HTTP and its security best practices 
 Familiarity with ES2015+, unit testing 
 React Flux, Redux, SASS, Node experience is required 
 Experience with third party libraries like Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics 
 
 Backblaze Employees Have: 
 Good attitude and willingness to do whatever it takes to get the job done 
 Strong desire to work for a small, fast paced company 
 Desire to learn and adapt to rapidly changing technologies and work environment 
 Comfort with well behaved pets in the office. 
 
 Backblaze Perks: 
 100% healthcare for family 
 Competitive compensation and 401k 
 Full-time employees receive option grants 
 Flexible vacation policy 
 MacBook Pro to use for work plus a generous stipend to personalize your workstation 
 Fully stocked micro kitchens and strong coffee 
 Childcare bonus (human children only) 
 Generous skills training policy to continue your professional development 
 Culture that supports healthy work-life balance 
 
 This position can be remote. Regular attendance in the office is expected one week per quarter. 
 At Backblaze, we value being fair and good to our customers, partners, and employees. That’s why diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the core of our values. We are committed to fostering a workforce where all employees feel a sense of belonging regardless of race, ethnicity, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, socioeconomic status, ability, veteran status, and education. We believe that our dedication to cultivating a diverse workspace not only allows us to better serve our customers in over 175 countries, but further reinforces our commitment to doing the right thing. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Front End Developer - US Remote Opportunity - Phoenix, AZ 85017 - Indeed.com
Description:
Grand Canyon Education (GCE) is an educational service company that provides an array of support services in the post-secondary education sector. Formerly part of Grand Canyon University (GCU), GCE still supports and works closely with GCU. GCE designs and develops educational programs for GCU and other traditional campus institutions, as well as online partner institutions at the undergraduate, graduate and doctoral levels.
 Grand Canyon Education is seeking a Front End Developer. This position reports to the Sr. Web Development Manager, works collaboratively with various members within the marketing department including web designers, back-end developers, digital marketing specialists, assigned marketing partners, executing front-end development throughout GCU’s web properties. The Front End Developer works on front-end development initiatives and has knowledge of front-end development best practices.
 The Front End Developer tests and executes web enhancements resulting in improved user experiences, increased rankings and overall improvements to GCU web properties. Works collaboratively with the marketing team project lead on the implementation of web marketing plans which support GCU’s total marketing strategy. Web marketing refers to marketing efforts that use GCU’s website properties, which are leveraged to promote the University’s educational services and objectives.
 Please Note:  This is a Remote position and can be worked from anywhere in the US. Must be able to work 8-5 AZ time, as needed for meetings.
 Responsibilities:
 Authors new user-facing features which enhance usability, accessibility and performance.
 Collaborates with UI/UX designers to ensure the technical feasibility of user interface and user experience designs.
 Collaborates with back-end developers to develop new and existing web services and server rendered pages.
 Collaborate efficiently with back end team to deliver integrated, solid and tested solutions.
 Builds functionality with reusable code and authors new libraries with a focus on future re-usability.
 Assists with the development of test automation used in verifying conformity of front-end code to functional requirements, web standards, and accessibility standards.
 Assists in the gathering of requirements and development of documentation surrounding web development projects.
 Assists in project planning and execution throughout the entire software development life-cycle.
 Analyzes, reviews and modifies web functionality by maintaining, documenting, testing, developing and monitoring various forms of data and functionality.
 Applies new technologies and/or best practices to the web pages to optimize and improve user experience based upon independent research and gaining approval from management to do so.
 Qualifications:
 Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline (computer science, information technology, etc.) from a regionally accredited institution and minimum of 2 years of experience building web applications.
 OR
 3 years’ of work experience building web applications with an unrelated bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution.

Title: Front End Engineer, Data Foundations - New York, NY - Indeed.com
Description:
Engineering 
Web 
Every day, hundreds of millions of people all over the world use Spotify to discover and listen to music and podcasts. We seek to understand the world of audio better than anyone else so that we can make excellent recommendations to every individual and keep the world listening.
 Location 
New York or Remote Americas 
Job type 
Permanent 
We enjoy researching and developing state of the art, platformized solutions that offer the best experience possible to the Spotify developer community. We are currently building the next-generation platform for data management and discovery at Spotify. This platform will offer teams a flawless experience to enable data practitioners to create and actively manage high quality, compliant, and easily discoverable datasets. We lead a strong open source culture, chipping in to large open-source code bases, taking care to build up the community around these projects and being mindful about contributing back. 
What you'll do:
 Spearhead and contribute to Data Hub, our Backstage plugin that unifies our Data platform components and helps data engineers and teams across Spotify collaborate, discover, run, and supervise data entities. 
Work closely with our multi-functional team to understand our users as well as Data platform components features & limitations to deliver a cohesive user experience. 
Deliver scalable, testable, maintainable, and high-quality code. 
Share knowledge, evangelize standard methodologies, and collaborate with some of Spotify’s best web engineers. 
Work in an environment that supports your individual growth by providing you with exciting work, the freedom to acquire new skills on hack days, reading groups, and a variety of internal training courses. 
Who you are:
 You have at least 3+ years of experience in Web Development (User Experience thinking and skills are a plus). 
You have strong fundamentals in Javascript (React), HTML, and CSS. 
Care about software architecture across the front-end, back-end, and the APIs that glue them. 
Passionate about code quality, continuous delivery, automated testing. 
Experienced in building APIs and client libraries used by multiple engineering teams and have worked with protocols like gRPC, REST GraphQL. 
You care about the user experience; building responsive, user-friendly web applications. 
Comfortable working in an agile environment and challenging yourself and your team to improve their ways of working. 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and can communicate your ideas, especially to those not technologically proficient. 
You value team success over personal success. 
Where you'll be:
 We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them! 
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location and is within working hours. 
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration and ask that all be located that time zone. 
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. 
Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here. 
Our global benefits 
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse. 
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success. 
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents. 
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub. 
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs. 
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events. 
Learn about life at Spotify 
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens. 
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users. 
This position is not eligible to be performed in Colorado.

Title: Email/Front End Web Developer - Chicago, IL - Indeed.com
Description:
BDO’s Core Purpose is Helping People Thrive Every Day. Our Core Values reflect how we manage our work, our relationships and ourselves. As an employee of the firm, you will live true to our Core Values of people first, being exceptional every day in every way, embracing change, feeling empowered through knowledge and choosing accountability. Our Core Values are the standards by which we conduct ourselves day in and day out, both internally and externally. 
 
BDO Digital, LLC, a subsidiary of BDO USA, LLP, provides a holistic portfolio of technology, transformation services and solutions. We are an organization that values your time, talent, and contributions. Collaborate with BDO Digital’s cross-disciplinary team who work together to solve digital needs and unearth new opportunities to drive competitive advantage. Our commitment to each other is why BDO Digital is a recognized leader for our culture, employee satisfaction and career growth. We’re looking for people with the same drive; to combine teamwork with technology to produce amazing results. 
 
In this hands-on development role, the Email/Front End Web Developer serves a critical role in bringing email and web page designs into production, bridging the design and back-end development teams. The Email/Web Developer is responsible for producing and optimizing intuitive, scalable and functional web interfaces for a variety of web-deployed marketing content in multiple marketing automation platforms such as Marketo, HubSpot, Pardot, Eloqua, and Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
 
 
The Email/Web Developer will build accessible, mobile-friendly marketing email templates; create scalable and maintainable email design systems; define best practices in email development; and contribute to email design ideation and decision making. Collaborating with a project lead, you will assist our clients determine the best course of action to meet their marketing initiatives and maintain continued communication with clients and a cross-functional team to provide status updates or request additional information when needed to meet your deliverables. 
 
As there are several cities listed within this job description, we would consider candidates nationwide and able to work remote as long as willing to travel to client site as needed. 
 
Essential Duties/Functions: 
 
 Develops responsive, mobile-friendly, cross-client/browser, and semantically accurate email and web page templates from mockups provided by the client in accordance with global accessibility, privacy, and compliance directives Builds campaign assets and user interfaces that may include dynamic content, A/B testing, scripts for social media and/or tracking, personalization through tokens or field merges, forms, and other needs that may require specific scripting solutions Runs Litmus tests for emails, checking landing pages in all browsers, running tests on campaigns/programs, data capture, etc. Develops front-end applications primarily using HTML and CSS, JavaScript/JQuery, and possibly with Angular and React Incorporates lead generation and event web forms on landing pages hosted externally (e.g., WordPress, Adobe Experience Manager, Drupal, Sitecore, etc.) or internal to the marketing automation platform (e.g., Marketo, Eloqua, HubSpot CMS, etc.) Decomposes flat or layered files from Photoshop, PDF, etc. to derive email/web page layouts, compatible images, form elements, and other components Performs quality assurance testing to ensure appropriate segments, content, and submitted data are resulting in expected cases Researches industry trends to ensure that standards and practices remain current and deliver the best email and online presence possible Develops process flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas Partners with key marketing stakeholders to analyze, test, and launch email campaigns that drive response 
 Qualifications 
 Education 
 Bachelor's degree OR six (6) or more years of experience in UX/UI design, analytics, AB testing and other digital marketing services including setting up campaigns within MA platform, required With Major in Computer Science, Marketing or Communications, preferred 
Experience:

Title: Front End Software Developer - Los Angeles, CA - Indeed.com
Description:
TWO NIL is a data science company that uses a holistic approach to create profitable go to market campaigns – at scale. We provide clients with vertically integrated, unbundled solutions across their acquisition marketing needs including strategy, planning, execution, optimization, modeling, and forecasting. Our clients represent best of breed brands across a diverse range of verticals and geographies. 
 
As a Front End Software Developer, you will be part of a growing team building our next generation data web applications and internet platform. In this role, you are constantly striving to build well-designed and secure web applications and user experiences for our customers. 
 
Responsibilities: 
 
 Build front end internet applications using JavaScript, React.js, HTML5, CSS 
 Integrate back-end web services built with Python, Node 
 Work with data sets from Postgres, Redshift, MySQL, and DynamoDB 
 Integrate third party API's such as Google Analytics, Facebook, Auth0, etc. 
 Participate in design and code reviews 
 Collaborate with product managers, UI/UX designers, and software engineers 
 Develop web applications hosted on cloud platforms like AWS, Wix 
 
 Qualifications: 
 
 3+ years building cloud-based web applications using JavaScript, React.js, HTML5, CSS 
 2+ years integrating back-end web services/API's into cloud-based web applications 
 2+ years using data from databases such as Postgres, MySQL, JSON, or similar technology 
 Experience building web applications that are deployed in Docker Containers 
 Experience working in a DevOps environment (Git, CI/CD Pipelines, Jira) 
 Experience using Agile/Scrum development methodology is a plus 
 Bachelor's degree in computer science or related technical field is preferred 
 Must be authorized to work in the U.S., the Company is currently not sponsoring visas 
 
 
As a TWO NIL employee you will enjoy: 
 
 Competitive compensation package 
 Unlimited paid time off policy 
 Flexible working hours 
 Benefits  (Health, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401k, Flexible Spending Account and more) 
 Parental Leave 
 Fitness reimbursement, Headspace 
 Volunteer Time Off 
 Charitable employer match 
 Ongoing learning and classes for employees 
 Team events and outings 
 Catered lunches and stocked kitchen with fresh fruit, snacks, premium coffee & tea, and cold brew coffee (restricted during COVID-19) 
 Work remotely or join us in our office 
 
 
About TWO NIL: 
 
Founded in 2011, TWO NIL is a leading growth consultancy with strategy, analytics, and media activation at its core, serving the top direct-to-consumer brands. TWO NIL provides clients with unbundled solutions across their acquisition marketing needs, from growth strategy to execution, media activation, optimization and forecasting. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, TWO NIL is a trusted guide to corporations across the nation, including 23andMe, Bombas, Dollar Shave Club, Experian, Glassdoor, Blue Apron, RxSense, and many others. To learn more, please visit https://www.twonil.com/.

Frontend HTML/CSS Developer 
Founded in June 1996, VS Media is an industry leader specializing in highly interactive, high-traffic, live video chat websites. Spanning the globe with over 200 million visitors per month and 80 million ads per day, we provide a platform for adults to discover new kinds of interactive content through live video and chat services. Our size and scale stretches across every continent, delivering powerful technology to enhance our clients’ online presence. From streaming live video to billing solutions to gamification development, we leverage the latest technology to provide the best digital experience possible. 
 
 About the Job 
We currently have an experienced-level position open for a Frontend Developer with a desire to learn and strong attention to detail that can help augment our existing team. The ideal candidate would be well-rounded with a variety of experience in hand coding HTML and CSS to match designs. 
This is  NOT  a Designer, JS developer nor a full-stack position. 
This is a full-time position, preferably working out of our Westlake Village office. But depending on your location in CA, we would be open to a remote position.

Works closely with designers and developers to solve problems related to user interfaces and user experience. Browser compatibility is a must across all major browsers and mobile devices. Responsible for building reusable code and libraries for future use. Responsible for optimizing applications for maximum speed and scalability. Working within older code as well as newer.

Familiar w/ frameworks 
Experience in the following is a plus, but not required Understanding of vanilla JavaScript Familiar w/ GIT Familiar w/ PHP Familiar w/ PHP Smarty 
As we are an internet-focused tech company, please note that we do manage adult-oriented content. This position does not directly involve working around such explicit material on a regular basis, but employees will likely notice content on a colleague’s screen or communicate with representatives in the adult entertainment industry. Therefore, it is imperative that the ideal candidate have no issue with this aspect of the business. See visit our website flirt 4 free for an example. VS Media understands and respects that such content is not suitable for all applicants.

Title: Software Developer (Front end) - Easthampton, MA - Indeed.com
Description: It’s an exciting time to join InFlight – we’re growing our stable of Fortune 500 customers and have millions of users on our platform. InFlight is a boutique software company with all the perks and opportunities of start-ups, plus all the advantages of being an established and profitable business. What we do:  InFlight brings the user experience of aging enterprise applications into the future. We do things with legacy enterprise software that no one thought possible, which is just what companies need during the COVID-19 pandemic and beyond. InFlight improves the digital employee experience by extending remote and mobile access, streamlining workflows, and making applications easier to use for employees; reducing operational costs and boosting organizational efficiency. Are you an experienced Software Developer with a proven ability to write clean, testable and maintainable frontend code? Are you looking for the opportunity to solve challenging problems and have your work impact millions of end-users around the globe? InFlight is hiring a USA-based Software Developer to work remotely as a member of our engineering team. So, what will you do? As InFlight Software Developer you will: · Architect and develop maintainable interfaces and applications that are used by millions of end-users. · Modernize frontend systems to enable rapid UI development and iteration. · Push technology forward, challenge established thinking and discover new ways of solving problems. · Support client implementations by implementing UI’s and system integrations. · Assist with scoping and estimating work for business development teams. To be great you need to have: · You have 3+ years of hands-on experience using: o JavaScript and TypeScript o Modern JavaScript frameworks—such as Angular, React, Vue.js, jQuery o HTTP/RESTful APIs o JavaScript unit tests (Jest, Mocha, Jasmine, Karma) o HTML5/CSS o Chrome/Firefox developer tools to debug issues and solutions o Source control (Git) · Experience with any of these is an advantage: o Node.js and npm o Popular UI libraries such as Bootstrap to build semantic and responsive web pages o Web accessibility o Docker containers · The authorization to work full-time in the U.S. without restrictions; as this position may entail work on a project involving the U.S. federal government. Want to learn more about what it’s like to work at InFlight? Visit our Careers page (www.inflightintegration.com/jobs) to learn more about our perks, culture and values. A Note on COVID-19 and Remote Work at InFlight:  InFlight has taken many precautions to ensure our employees are safe and healthy during the pandemic. We have implemented a number of workplace safety measures, such as a work from home policy and cancellation of all non-critical travel, company-wide until further notice. While we are all working 100% remotely for the foreseeable future, we are still incredibly connected – virtual water cooler chats, weekly All-Hands, online games, and virtual lunch sessions all contribute to a sense of togetherness and teamwork that spans our physical separation. Our business functions continue through our online communication, collaboration, and productivity stack. Additionally, we offer a number of physical and mental health and wellness programs, such as health benefits coverage, a one-time office credit to setup/improve a home work-space, annual wellness credit and true focus on work/life harmony for our InFlight team. Does this sound good? Apply now! If you’re ready to make an impact on how the world’s biggest brands work, we’d love to hear from you. InFlight welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. InFlight Participates in E-Verify After the successful candidate accepts the job offer and completes the Form I-9, InFlight will provide the federal government with the Form I-9 information to confirm that the employee is authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that the employee is authorized to work in the U.S., InFlight will provide information on how to begin the process to resolve the issue. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Flexible schedule Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Remotely: Yes

BDO’s Core Purpose is Helping People Thrive Every Day. Our Core Values reflect how we manage our work, our relationships and ourselves. As an employee of the firm, you will live true to our Core Values of people first, being exceptional every day in every way, embracing change, feeling empowered through knowledge and choosing accountability. Our Core Values are the standards by which we conduct ourselves day in and day out, both internally and externally. 
 
BDO Digital, LLC, a subsidiary of BDO USA, LLP, provides a holistic portfolio of technology, transformation services and solutions. We are an organization that values your time, talent, and contributions. Collaborate with BDO Digital’s cross-disciplinary team who work together to solve digital needs and unearth new opportunities to drive competitive advantage. In this hands-on development role, the Email/Front End Web Developer serves a critical role in bringing email and web page designs into production, bridging the design and back-end development teams. The Email/Web Developer is responsible for producing and optimizing intuitive, scalable and functional web interfaces for a variety of web-deployed marketing content in multiple marketing automation platforms such as Marketo, HubSpot, Pardot, Eloqua, and Salesforce Marketing Cloud.

Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent planning, time management, and organization skills Ability to work within a distributed team and foster teamwork Self-motivated to work remotely and independently on projects while maintaining active communication with clients and team members with little supervision Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy Comfortable meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment Able to create and manage process Flexible and creative in getting things done Thrive in a time-sensitive/ high-pressure environment Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to break down high-level business requirements into more detail by questioning and probing for clarification Able to synthesize many sources of information efficiently Customer service oriented Able to articulate technical requirements and obstacles Passion for excellence Fearless, driven, yet patient Understanding of progressive profiling Familiarity with webinar platforms and event management tools

Title: Software Developer (Front end) - Easthampton, MA - Indeed.com
Description: It’s an exciting time to join InFlight – we’re growing our stable of Fortune 500 customers and have millions of users on our platform. InFlight is a boutique software company with all the perks and opportunities of start-ups, plus all the advantages of being an established and profitable business. What we do:  InFlight brings the user experience of aging enterprise applications into the future. We do things with legacy enterprise software that no one thought possible, which is just what companies need during the COVID-19 pandemic and beyond. InFlight improves the digital employee experience by extending remote and mobile access, streamlining workflows, and making applications easier to use for employees; reducing operational costs and boosting organizational efficiency. Are you an experienced Software Developer with a proven ability to write clean, testable and maintainable frontend code? Are you looking for the opportunity to solve challenging problems and have your work impact millions of end-users around the globe? InFlight is hiring a USA-based Software Developer to work remotely as a member of our engineering team. So, what will you do? As InFlight Software Developer you will: · Architect and develop maintainable interfaces and applications that are used by millions of end-users. · Modernize frontend systems to enable rapid UI development and iteration. · Push technology forward, challenge established thinking and discover new ways of solving problems. · Support client implementations by implementing UI’s and system integrations. · Assist with scoping and estimating work for business development teams. To be great you need to have: · You have 3+ years of hands-on experience using: o JavaScript and TypeScript o Modern JavaScript frameworks—such as Angular, React, Vue.js, jQuery o HTTP/RESTful APIs o JavaScript unit tests (Jest, Mocha, Jasmine, Karma) o HTML5/CSS o Chrome/Firefox developer tools to debug issues and solutions o Source control (Git) · Experience with any of these is an advantage: o Node.js and npm o Popular UI libraries such as Bootstrap to build semantic and responsive web pages o Web accessibility o Docker containers · The authorization to work full-time in the U.S. without restrictions; as this position may entail work on a project involving the U.S. federal government. Want to learn more about what it’s like to work at InFlight? Visit our Careers page (www.inflightintegration.com/jobs) to learn more about our perks, culture and values. A Note on COVID-19 and Remote Work at InFlight:  InFlight has taken many precautions to ensure our employees are safe and healthy during the pandemic. We have implemented a number of workplace safety measures, such as a work from home policy and cancellation of all non-critical travel, company-wide until further notice. While we are all working 100% remotely for the foreseeable future, we are still incredibly connected – virtual water cooler chats, weekly All-Hands, online games, and virtual lunch sessions all contribute to a sense of togetherness and teamwork that spans our physical separation. Our business functions continue through our online communication, collaboration, and productivity stack. Additionally, we offer a number of physical and mental health and wellness programs, such as health benefits coverage, a one-time office credit to setup/improve a home work-space, annual wellness credit and true focus on work/life harmony for our InFlight team. Does this sound good? Apply now! If you’re ready to make an impact on how the world’s biggest brands work, we’d love to hear from you. InFlight welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. InFlight Participates in E-Verify After the successful candidate accepts the job offer and completes the Form I-9, InFlight will provide the federal government with the Form I-9 information to confirm that the employee is authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that the employee is authorized to work in the U.S., InFlight will provide information on how to begin the process to resolve the issue. Title: Front-End WordPress Developer/Designer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
DESIGN YOUR NEW CAREER WITH US! 
At Southleft, our specialty is front-end design & development. We have a track record of implementing large-scale front-end architecture and design updates for high-profile websites with complex and heavy content needs. The quality of our code is exceptional, our sites are lightweight and fast, and we build our sites to be scalable so that our client's investment will continue to pay off as technology changes over time. 
**Please note that we will only consider candidates who apply through our Hiring Portal:  https://southleft2.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=19 
 
Who We Need 
Southleft is seeking a  Front-End Web Developer  with a very sharp design sense. This person will be a creative problem solver who is up for the challenge of building exclusive, fast, lightweight, and user-friendly websites for clients with novel and ambitious requests. Our developers are expected to independently manage their time as remote workers and be self-driven to provide excellent attention to clean coding detail, with the ability to accept feedback and implement positive changes. 
 
What you’ll do: 
Sharply design and develop creative, custom web solutions for our clients’ unique content needs. 
Engage in high-level communication with clients and coworkers via video, email, messaging, and in-person. 
Smoothly navigate ongoing projects as timelines and resourcing needs ebb and flow. 
Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve performance issues at the code and UI layers 
Participate in requirements gathering, analysis, and specification, providing technical expertise and recommendations 
Follow proper source control and change management practices 
Continuously learn, contribute ideas to the team, and accept feedback on work in order to develop and grow as a web designer. 
 
Skills needed to be successful: 
Minimum of 4 years of Front-End web development experience required. 
Highly knowledgeable and well-experienced with WordPress development, Shopify, and working familiarity with Javascript and Git. 
Familiar with HTML & CSS best practices and with CSS preprocessors such as Sass. 
Solid grasp of design principles and methods as it relates to user experience and user interfaces. 
Ability to work independently and effectively manage time and projects. 
Demonstrates a high level of attention to detail and clean coding. 
Must be able to demonstrate strong communication skills and possess a customer-focused mindset when working with clients and co-workers alike. 
Bonus points if you can remotely work from:  Alabama, Arizona, Colorado, Louisiana, New York, North Carolina, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Texas, or Wisconsin 
When applying, please include a link to your portfolio and/or public git repository account. 
 
**Please note that we will only consider candidates who apply through our Hiring Portal:  https://southleft2.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=19 
 
WHAT WE OFFER:  We believe employment is a two-way street where both you and the company should benefit from the relationship. For this reason, we offer: 
The opportunity to work from home (this is a 100% remote position that can be worked from anywhere in the US). 
A flexible schedule. 
Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance. 
Flexible PTO. 
Company-paid educational & training opportunities. 
New computer equipment, as requested. 
A high-profile client base. 
401(k) retirement plan with a 4% match. 
Room to grow & develop your job role. 
Performance bonuses are based on individual and company performance. 
Client referral bonus incentive.

Title: Front End Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Meet Zartico, the world’s first Destination Operating System. 
Zartico’s mission is to empower DMOs to be better stewards of the world’s tourist destinations through improved data intelligence and decision-making. Makers of the first Destination Operating System, Zartico harnesses and streamlines complex data to provide a full-spectrum of data science, benchmarking and analytical services for use in marketing, community development and sustainability efforts. Based in Salt Lake City, Utah, Zartico has over thirty years of experience in technology, tourism, and destination, travel and tourism marketing. 
Your Role: Front End Developer 
We’re looking for a Front End Developer who wants to create wonder-inducing experiences for our partners. In this position, you'll use your skills in translating high level requests into interfaces that are simple, intuitive, and enjoyable to use. You will collaborate closely with our world-class product teams, shipping valuable features to our partners. What's special about this role? You'll get to leverage your love for UX/UI and code through working on a product that's created to transform an industry. You'll be on a small, tight-knit team, meaning you'll get to have a big impact. 
What you'll do: 
Execute all stages of front end development from sketching to wire-framing to high fidelity prototypes 
Collaborate with the product team to define high-level requirements for product development 
Design web interfaces giving users an intuitive and enjoyable experience of the Zartico Destination Operating System 
Clearly communicate design decisions and rationales to peers and stakeholders 
Conduct research and brainstorming sessions to develop user flows and compelling user experiences 
What you'll need: 
At least 3 years experience as a front end developer 
A sharp eye for visual design and a good grounding in product design from problem statement to validated product 
You have demonstrated ability to ship polished and well-thought-out experiences (portfolio) 
Experience with information architecture fundamentals 
Added bonus if you have experience designing products for consumers 
Double bonus if you're passionate about travel and education 
Why Zartico? 
We believe in a growth mindset. We are a learning organization. 
We emphasize focus because we know that to achieve big dreams, you have to execute and get the small stuff right. 
We lead with inclusion and value diversity. We believe in diversity of thought, perspective, and experience. Diversity of experience and perspectives creates a more robust product and more beautiful world. 
We dream in color and code. 
We hustle. 
We are humble and know that the sum of our parts is greater than any one of us as individuals. 
Above all else, we do the right thing. We believe in transparency, honesty and integrity. 
We believe travel and tourism is a force for good because it builds connection, understanding, and appreciation of our world’s cultures, history and natural resources. We believe data and the right metrics allow us to make better decisions because transparent data helps focus on the right issues, problems and therefore, solutions, to be better stewards of our world's most precious destinations. 
We’re building a global community—one that’s safe for people of all backgrounds. We are an equal opportunity employer where our diversity and inclusion are central pillars to our company strategy. We look for applicants who understand, embrace and thrive in a multicultural and increasingly globalized world. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. When you join our team, you join the Zartico family.

Title: Front End Developer - WordPress - Marin County, CA - Indeed.com
Description:
Alaniz is a fast growing digital marketing and web development agency located in Marin County. We have a tight-knit team of senior professionals and we have big plans for where we want to take our agency. 
 
Our web department is growing fast and we’re looking for a Front End Web Developer to join our team. 
 
Key Responsibilities 
 
Agile Process – Join our scrum team to deliver great work through our agile development process. Participate in daily standups, review & retro, and planning meetings. Manage work in Jira. 
 
Client Interactions – Work with members of the development team and interact with clients to understand needs, set strategy, spec projects, set expectations, ensure project success and client happiness. 
 
Strategy – Work with the team to build sites that deliver results. Make meaningful contributions to marketing strategy, UX/UI design, and technical approach. 
 
Design and Development – Develop websites using WordPress as a primary CMS. Utilize multiple development tools in our technology stack for project planning, wireframing, mockups, development, hosting, ftp, git, and more. 
 
Training – Complete all required training and certifications. Participate in ongoing professional development through active daily learning, weekly catered lunch and learns, and structured professional development tracks. 
 
Requirements 
 
Development Chops – We are looking for a competent front end developer who is a WordPress expert and is fluent in HTML and CSS. You should also have an eye for design and be able to take a website from end-to-end if needed. 
 
Technology Stack – We work in the Atlassian Suite – Jira, Bitbucket, Hipchat, Gliffy. We build websites in WordPress and host with WPengine. We’re competent in many marketing platforms and do a lot of work in Hubspot, including COS websites. Being comfortable with the tools in our stack is a big plus! 
 
Marketing Perspective – We’re building websites that connect with people and generate business results and we’re looking for someone who understands buyer behavior, user experience, inbound methodology (attract visitors, convert leads, nurture and close). 
 
Attitude – Positive, can-do attitude. Independent problem solver that can figure anything out with a few minutes and a google window. Hard working. Fun to work with and a great team member. 
 
Experience – We’re looking for someone who has a strong portfolio of work to demonstrate their experience. Ideally, they are comfortable in a customer facing role, working with a team, and have experience managing multiple simultaneous projects. Agile or agency experience is a plus. 
 
Education – Bachelor’s degree or equivalent. Committed to self improvement and self-led ongoing education with track record to show. Demonstration of ongoing education through design, development, inbound marketing, analytics, or project management certifications are highly valued. 
 
Why work for Alaniz? 
 
Here are a few reasons why we think Alaniz is a great place to work: 
 
Team – Everyone on our team is an amazing person. Everyone is highly talented and a top performer. We play as a team, collaborate, and learn from each other every day. 
 
Clients and Projects – Not only do we have great clients, but the work is interesting too, since we work across multiple industries and on a wide variety of different types of projects. 
 
Agile – We’re a full agile shop. We converted a year ago and it’s revolutionized the way we do business, providing clear process and a scalable framework. 
 
Inbound – Inbound gives us a results-oriented framework and guides our approach to marketing. We are a Hubspot Gold Partner and really helping our clients acquire more customers. 
 
Growth – We’re committed to professional growth. Our team sits down for weekly catered lunch and learns and we formally reserve time in everyone’s schedule for structured professional development tracks. 
 
Balance – We work hard, but everyone takes care of their part (we’re all adults here). And with that responsibility comes a great deal of flexibility and balance.

Title: Senior Front-End Developer - Portland, OR 97205 - Indeed.com
Description:
Help us take FINE to the next level! 
We specialize in the art of bringing brands to life online. Since the early days of the commercial web, we’ve created custom digital destinations that connect clients with their customers in innovative ways, always honing tools and platforms that set the pace and standard for web development. As a Senior Front-End Developer, you'll drive innovation, and collaborate with and mentor. 
Core Values 
 
At FINE, we are committed to our core values and strive to live them every day. 
BE HUMAN 
 
People here are the real deal. You bring genuine intentions, unite by your actions, stay humble in your greatness, open with your quirks, and honest in your flaws. 
BE AWESOME 
 
You’re at the top of your craft and game. Whatever your skill and role, you’re a highly engaged, positive solutioneer. A leader, a do-er, and an always improver. 
MAKE BIG HAPPEN 
 
You approach your work believing it has the power to impact our company, our clients, even our world. All that you do is strategically-motivated and aims for a world-class outcome. 
Our values manifest themselves in a small group of dynamic, creative learners who are passionate about producing inspired and effective work, who seek to improve every day, and who understand that life is too short to not enjoy yourself along the way. 
Our promise to clients is to help them evolve their brand and business to become their best selves and deepen their relationships with customers. For the “A player” (that rare and talented top 10%) looking for something special, this position is the ideal opportunity. 
 
Do you see brand and creative as a powerful business driver? 
 Do you believe the best work is done in small groups of passionate experts? 
 Do you love design that is simple, beautiful, and intuitive? 
 Do you have a high level of attention to detail? 
 Do you have a passion for supporting others? 
 Are you looking for a place to learn and challenge yourself every day? 
 Are you able to maintain calm in times of stress? 
 Do you focus on priorities to achieve set goals? 
 Do you value the people you work with as much as the work itself? 
 Do you look at work as a career rather than just a job? 
 Are you inspired by the opportunity to address and solve interesting problems? 
 
 
If you answered "yes" to these questions, we want to meet you! 
Our Company 
 
FINE is a brand agency. But for us, branding has moved far beyond slick logos, flashy sites, and clever campaigns. It’s a deep process of building value, based on values. It starts with the core reason a company exists, then permeates everything you do about it. Brand-Led Business Building™ helps us engineer companies (including our own) by aligning Vision, Operations, Expression, and Traction to create the kind of business people today truly buy into. 
Since 1994, we’ve earned hundreds of awards and worked with countless clients to help define businesses using brand as our lens. Our work and our people have been featured in Communication Arts, Graphis, HOW, Fast Co., Adweek, CMO.com, AdAge, and many others. We’re proud to have helped friends across industries, from pioneering hospitality brands to innovators and nonprofits of all shapes and sizes. 
 
 
The Role 
 
Developers at FINE are passionate, clever people who are constantly improving their skills to keep up with technology. We work on challenging projects and produce high-quality work in a collaborative, creative setting. 
 
Senior Front-End developers at FINE work directly with designers, project managers, back-end developers, technical documentalists, and others to create super-smooth responsive websites for our clients based on using our own open-source CMS that we affectionately refer to as Fae. We are looking for craftspeople who use styles, scripts, and markup as the tools of their trade. 
Responsibilities 
 
 Work with a team of project managers, designers, strategists, and developers to build brand new experiences with VueJS/Nuxt 
 Use client work to refine our tools and tech with each build 
 Collaborate with designers early in the production process to help them understand tech capabilities 
 Share learnings with our team and help mentor less experienced teammates 
 Review teammates’ code and help maintain high code quality 
 
 
Qualifications 
 
 6+ years of applied experience with ES6+ JavaScript 
 2+ years of applied experience with modern SPA frameworks (React, Vue, Nuxt, etc.) 
 Experience or a deep understanding of statically rendered websites, their benefits, and drawbacks 
 Provide confidently clean code in with HTML, CSS & JS 
 Focus on the readability & maintainability of code 
 Implement cross-browser compatible features as a baseline 
 Strategically choose solutions that support efficiency in rendering, loading, and painting of the page on the full spectrum of devices and networks without sacrificing accessibility or UX 
 Familiarity with WCAG success criteria and generalized experience in building accessible, intuitive websites 
 Balance design aesthetics with accessibility, keeping WCAG guidelines front-of-mind while seeking opportunities to push the boundaries of the web as a medium 
 Comfortable with Git 
 Take personal responsibility for deadlines, code quality, and tasks 
 Experience collaborating with and mentoring other developers 
 Communicate effectively & often 
 Adept at creating and maintaining your development environment 
 
 
Career Benefits 
We’re whole human beings here at FINE, and we’ve designed our benefits offerings to support our team in a whole range of human things. Things like: 
 
A selection of robust health plans (medical, dental, and vision) to choose from, with an option for 100% employer-paid coverage 
 Vacation, sick time, company paid holidays, and our annual holiday close 
 A 401(k) plan combined with a discretionary company contribution, driven by company performance 
 Company-paid group-term life insurance with the option to purchase additional coverage 
 Short-term disability coverage 
 Professional development to keep you growing 
 Pre-tax flexible spending accounts for dependent care as well as certain dental and vision expenses 
 Pre-tax commuter benefits 
 Flexible and remote working opportunities 
 Friendly atmosphere and culture 
 Competitive compensation package 
 Outstanding work environment 
 Working with other “A players” driven to create great client results 
 The Location 
 
This position is for our office in Portland, Oregon, with the opportunity to work remotely within the United States. Located in a newly renovated building in downtown Portland, our office is cozy, collaborative, and comfortable. Each unique space was designed with multiple uses in mind, like a strategy session on the collaboration wall, refining a design idea over a cup of coffee in the bistro, or visiting with a client in the library.  Note:  As of Q3 2021, FINE employees are working remotely during the pandemic. 
FINE Reviews 
 
“I’ve worked on multiple projects building sites for everything from wineries to private equity clients. There’s always an interesting new feature or challenge to overcome with each project, and our designers always bring fresh ideas to the table. Part of a successful build is coming up with ways to create flexible object-oriented data models without over-engineering too much complexity into it so that sites can evolve and change with the client’s needs over time.“  — Jeremy Clemans, Developer 
“FINE offers the perfect balance of a humanity-first approach to business and envelope-pushing aspirations. It’s the harmony between the two that’s continually impressed me and inspired me to want to give back not just through my work ethic but in my desire to help see the business thrive. Leadership consistently exemplifies a deep consideration and care for the team, especially in their rallying for self-advocacy and continued personal growth – which can certainly be advertised by any agency, but to actually follow through requires a real level of trust and commitment.“ —  Mehran Azma, Associate Creative Director 
Our Hiring Process 
 
Our business may be small, but we think hiring’s a big deal. So we take a very thorough approach to finding the right fit for both our company and for each human who comes to work here. Our process includes several interviews, an analysis of your career history, and in-depth reference checks. We respect your time and appreciate your participation in our mutual goal to help you find the ideal position for your skills and strengths. 
Equal Opportunity Employment 
 
We believe in this big-time. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. FINE does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. 
How to Apply 
If you feel you are up for our in-depth hiring process and feel you can contribute to a dynamic, growing company, please begin your application below. Phone calls and emails are not accepted. Please be sure to add notifications@app.bamboohr.com to your contact list to ensure delivery of all correspondence from us.

Title: Senior Developer, Front End - Northbrook, IL - Indeed.com
Description:
We inspire purpose-filled living that brings joy to the modern home. With a team of more than 8,000 associates spanning 130 store and distribution locations across the U.S. and Canada, we achieve together, drive results and innovate to inspire. Drawn together by a shared passion for our customers and a spirit of fun, we deliver high-quality home furnishings that are expertly designed, responsibly sourced and bring beauty and function to people’s homes. From the day we opened our first store in Chicago in 1962 to the digital innovations that engage millions of customers today, our iconic brand is nearly 60 years in the making—and our story is still unfolding. 
We’re here for it. We think you should be too. We’re looking for a driven professional with an inclusive mindset to join our team as a Senior Developer, Front End... 
Do you have a passion for site speed and performance? Want to help make our website one of the fastest retail websites and take on the technical challenges and innovation to make our site both inspirational and beautiful while being speedy? Then come join our team as a Senior Front End Developer. You will join an innovative eCommerce team responsible for delivering solutions built for sustainability and performance. You will collaborate closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers to design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment. 
What you'll do... 
Develop, and implement solutions using HTML, CSS, and Javascript as your tools and ASP.NET (MVC) as your environment. 
Conceive and build responsive and adaptive solutions for website applications. 
Participate in technical design discussions with other front end and back end developers and assist in defining future forward web architecture, participate in code reviews, and apply unit testing. 
Work with the architecture and eCommerce development teams to optimize page speed performance and improve the customer experience on our sites. 
Work on an Agile team to develop, test, deploy, and maintain, while collaborating with team members on product backlog grooming, sprint planning, execution, review, and retrospective. 
Work with product team and stakeholders to understand and communicate progress. 
Update, maintain and adhere to pattern-libraries, styleguides, and site documentation. 
Be an active contributor to front-end development best practices. 
What you'll bring... 
You have been building websites using HTML/CSS/Javascript for 3+ years, and you can show it 
You can communicate to people in product management, design, user experience, and QA, and they will understand you 
You have excellent knowledge of CSS and Javascript coding best practices 
You can build responsive, cross-browser, highly-performant, and accessible applications 
You have experience working with a JavaScript framework (e.g. React, Angular, Vue.js) 
Deep understanding of modern web development techniques and how to apply new technologies to improve the architecture and boost page speed 
Experience with Twitter Bootstrap or Foundation or the like. You know about CSS preprocessors (LESS or SASS) 
Have prior knowledge or a willingness to learn modern performance monitoring tools and waterfall analysis 
We’re looking for someone who is strong technically who also demonstrates effective communication skills. Our ideal candidate should be able to identify opportunities for improvement, apply code changes including new architecture and explain new patterns to developers on the team. In addition, they should be able to explain performance metrics and improvement opportunities to business stakeholders 
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Graphic Design, or Visual Communication desired but not required 
We do not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position 
Good reading, written and verbal language skills (English) 
#Remote

Title: Front End Developer - Mendota Heights, MN 55120 - Indeed.com
Description:
About Powerplay Retail:
 Powerplay Retail connects the right brands with the right retailers—doing whatever it takes to slash time-to-market, expand sales channels, and accelerate brand growth. At Powerplay Retail we have a combined 250 years of experience connecting the most innovative brands with the most important online and in-store retailers to launch and grow the world’s best brands. Our broad capabilities and Flexible Service Offerings are focused on our partner’s needs and ensure they always get the right expertise and just the right time. 
 We’re real people who love what we do and take pride in our work. We don’t believe in gimmicks or crazy stunts—just in doing whatever it takes to slash time-to-market, expand sales channels, and accelerate brand growth. 
 Powerplay Retail. Where Brands and Retailers Achieve. 
 About the Job: 
 As a front-end developer, you will be responsible for evaluating and optimizing new and existing client ecommerce direct to consumer (DTC) websites, applying your knowledge of primary ecommerce platforms and best practices to ensure top site performance and user experience to drive on-site conversions. You will need to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders across the business to execute digital audits, site optimization, landing page creation and other tasks as needed for owned brand and client DTC ecommerce sites. 
 Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 
 Communicate effectively with internal and external customers to achieve business goals associated with website development and optimization 
 Strategically contribute to design, user experience, build and optimization across a variety of ecommerce platforms, specifically WooCommerce, Shopify, Big Commerce, Magento and others. 
 Develop and or work with strategic partners to develop fully responsive CSS/HTML workflows, templates, and website configurations. 
 Audit technical requirements and user experience through the lens of a consumer and align recommendations to DTC ecommerce best practices 
 Analyze existing web experience to ensure optimization across devices and platforms 
 Execute creation of DTC sites, landing pages and client customizations. 
 Stay on top of new ecommerce trends and emerging ecommerce platforms. 
 Suggest optimizations to support the goals of our clients and Powerplay. 
 Assist in managing the project timelines for DTC sites. 
 
 About you: 
 You are a go-getter and driven by results. 
 You are organized and detail oriented. 
 You strive to make an impact in a growing company. 
 You want to work somewhere that gets sh*t done! 
 You succeed in a flexible, fast paced, and independent work environment. 
 
 Qualifications: 
 Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or equivalent experience in a business-related technical field. 
 Minimum 5 years’ experience in similar technical role. 
 Experience in the retail industry preferred. 
 Experience with Shopify, WooCommerce, Big Commerce, Magneto and emerging best-in-class ecommerce platforms required. 
 Experience building responsive ecommerce websites, with a base knowledge of Google Analytics, Merchant Center and other Google products to aid in analytics infrastructure. 
 Experience with front end coding such as HTML and CSS. 
 Must be able to commute to our office in Mendota Heights, MN. 
 
 About Us: 
 We are non-traditional, no sterile office vibes here. We also don’t let job titles define us, everyone has great ideas, no matter their title or department. We call ourselves a 14-year-old start up. Our business was built by riding the winds of change, adapting to the demands of the industry and our clients’ needs. We aren’t afraid of a new challenge. What sets us apart is we don’t just talk. We DO. We work hard and have the partnerships, relationships, and results to show for it. 
 We provide competitive salaries and benefits to make sure you and your families are taken care of. This includes a non-elective 3% 401K contribution, 75% of monthly insurance premiums paid for by Powerplay, flexible work environment, frequent food trucks, stocked refrigerators, happy hours, company outings, volunteer events and more!

Title: Front End Developer - California - Indeed.com
