At Droit we seek candidates who are curious, driven and willing to bring their unique skills and perspectives to our work. We offer the opportunity for employees with a range of experience to develop their skills while shaping our platform and making meaningful contributions to the firm. 
 
 
What our Software Engineers do: 
 
Software engineers take holistic and collaborative approaches to solving the firm's core business problems. They don’t just write and review code - engineers are responsible for architecting and designing the infrastructure involved with any given project/deliverable and are also responsible for communicating these decisions effectively and clearly. 
 
Here are just some of the projects we're working on: 
 
 Business logic and APIs for our core decision engine 
 Functional-reactive web applications and UIs 
 Domain-specific languages and compilers 
 Parsing laws from heterogeneous sources 
 Collaborating with our Knowledge Engineering team to research and design new product lines 
 
 What we're looking for: 
 
 A high degree of curiosity with the ability to ask thoughtful questions and solve challenging problems

 A collaborative mind-set that enjoys working with others and knowledge sharing to achieve the best results

 Experience and/or interest in building web UI applications

 Any of the following would be an added benefit: 
 
 Experience with ClojureScript using re-frame for UI development 
 Experience Building React applications and RESTful APIs 
 Experience with CSS frameworks, such as Bootstrap 
 Experience using a RDBMS such as Postgres 
 
 
A little more about Droit: 
 
Our award-winning platform, Adept, has been in live production since March 2014. A series-A funding in late 2016, led by Goldman Sachs, has further boosted growth. Droit is based out of New York and London. 
 
Droit is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to an innovative, fast-paced and diverse workforce that represents a variety of backgrounds, experiences, perspectives and skills.

Title: Principal Engineer (Front End) - Santa Monica, CA 90401 - Indeed.com
Description:
GoodRx is America’s healthcare marketplace. Each month, millions people visit goodrx.com to find reliable health information and discounts for their healthcare — and we’ve helped people save $30 billion since 2011. We provide prescription discounts that are accepted at more than 70,000 pharmacies in the U.S., as well as telehealth services including doctor visits and lab tests. Our services have been positively reviewed by Good Morning America, The New York Times, NBC News, AARP, and many others. 
Our goal is to help Americans find convenient and affordable healthcare. We offer solutions for consumers, employers, health plans, and anyone else who shares our desire to provide affordable prescriptions to all Americans. 
We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company and industry. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has a seat at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunities to excel. 
With that said, research shows that women and other underrepresented groups apply only if they meet 100% of the criteria. GoodRx is committed to leveling the playing field, and we encourage women, people of color, those in the LGBTQ+ communities, and Veterans to apply for positions even if they don’t necessarily check every box outlined in the job description. Please still get in touch - we’d love to connect and see if you could be good for the role! 
About The Team / Role 
GoodRx is looking for a strong principal engineer to join its Prescription Management team. The Prescription Management group has been tasked to help personalize the experience between a user and their prescriptions throughout the GoodRx ecosystem. The team visualizes data and information in ways that both engage and inform. 
As part of the Prescription Management team, the ideal candidate will have a specialist’s knowledge of web-based, front end development. Along with a deep and thorough technical acumen, the candidate should have an equally strong ability to lift up team members and work strongly with others while striving to reach the team’s goals. 
 Responsibilities: 
Write clean, fast, well-designed, well-tested, readable, and maintainable code 
Work with teams across the organization, including product, design, legal, and business development to think beyond the technical implications of your design decisions 
Engage in code reviews to ensure code quality as well as share and distribute knowledge 
Continuously push to raise the team’s, and organization’s, standard of engineering excellence by implementing, or enhancing, best practices for coding, testing, and the developer experience 
Lead projects from idea to positive execution 
Actively mentor other engineers by leading and collaborating in all engineering discussions, evangelizing engineering best practices 
Own, create, or review technical design proposals and proof of concepts 
 Skills & Qualifications: 
7+ years of software development experience 
Substantial experience in technical leadership over responsive isomorphic applications in high-scale and high-reliability cloud deployments 
Detail-oriented, critical thinker, self-motivated, enthusiastic, resourceful, personable, customer-focused, and interested in mentorship and well being of other team members 
Ability to convey complex technical information to a variety of levels within the organization 
Demonstrated experience with React, TypeScript, NodeJS, ES6, and consuming GraphQL 
Enthusiasm for software architecture across the front-end, back-end, and the APIs that glue them 
Passionate about code quality, continuous delivery, and automated testing 
Comfortable challenging yourself, and your team, to improve ways of working 
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related quantitative degree 
 Nice to Have: 
Extensive knowledge of Feature Management tools like Optimizely or LaunchDarkly 
Experience with Content Management Systems like Contentful or ContentStack 
Previously integrated a Customer Data Platform like Segment 
Experience with Content Relation Management tools like Iterable or Braze 
Leveraged, and enhanced, an internal Design System 
 GoodRx is America's healthcare marketplace. The company offers the most comprehensive and accurate resource for affordable prescription medications in the U.S., gathering pricing information from thousands of pharmacies coast to coast, as well as a telehealth marketplace for online doctor visits and lab tests. Since 2011, Americans with and without health insurance have saved $30 billion using GoodRx and million consumers visit goodrx.com each month to find discounts and information related to their healthcare. GoodRx is the #1 most downloaded medical app on the iOS and Android app stores. For more information, visit www.goodrx.com.

Title: Front-End Developer - California - Indeed.com
Description:
Join our Mission to Promote Dialogue between Companies and their Customers 
 Help us build a beautiful and delightful cross-platform application that our users will love. Thousands of customers use Avochato every day to engage in real-time conversations, sharing messages and photos and more across SMS, Live Chat, and WhatsApp. You will help us expand and simplify the Avochato app, and deliver exciting new features for our users. 
 
Avochato is an enterprise mobile messaging company, based in San Francisco, that gives teams the tools needed to have lasting, ongoing, two-way messaging conversations with customers. Consumers today prefer to communicate with messaging applications, but enterprises are still built on email and phone systems. Avochato bridges this gap by upgrading teams to messaging. We believe real-time, two-way messaging provides the best customer experience while helping companies to scale efficiently. Avochato enables communication via text messaging, live chat, WhatsApp, and integrates with Salesforce Sales and Service Cloud. 
 
Recently named a category leader and Top 50 Product on G2 Crowd for 2020, Avochato handles millions of messages per month across hundreds of happy customers. The company grew 15x in 15 months and raised a $5M Series A at the end of 2018. 
 
 Why You'll Love Avochato: 
 We're committed to making a positive impact above all else– as leaders we lead people to a better place, whether it's a teammate, a customer, an investor, an advisor, a family member, or a friend 
 Avochato believes in personal growth, transparency, and a high degree of autonomy 
 Sales cycles are fast at Avochato, new features ship weekly, and we celebrate every win on a daily basis across all teams 
 Avochato is a remote-first team that is flexible on location 
 Avochato teammates use the Avochato platform - your teammates are your customers, and there is a tight feedback loop on developing products and getting feedback 
 This Role: 
 
We're looking for sharp, analytical engineers to help us continue to move quickly and scale engineering operations. Ideal candidates have strong startup experience and have a breadth of knowledge throughout multiple parts of the software ecosystem. 
 
Responsibilities : 
 
 Collaborate with other engineers and product teammates to make new features come to life from design to deployment 
 Build on top of our existing fully-featured enterprise messaging apps on desktop and mobile using React, Redux, TypeScript, HTML 5 and CSS3 
 Develop and maintain our user interface based on our product requirements and designs JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, and TypeScript 
 Compartmentalize code updates to feature branches for review and deployment using Git 
 Engage in code reviews with other engineers for pull requests 
 Participate in weekly stand-up meetings and report progress on assignments 
 Participate in testing and quality assurance on stage environments before weekly releases 
 
 Requirements : 
 
 5+ years production   experience  developing user-facing web applications using using HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript 
 4+ years production experience  developing and maintaining web applications in production using React and Redux 
 Great communicator, detail-oriented 
 Excels working in a remote environment 
 Collaborative, self-motivated and driven 
 Figma experieince a plus 
 
 A bit of our stack: 
 
 Mobile-first Front-end Web development in HTML5, TypeScript, CSS3, React & Redux 
 Native Mobile applications compiled from React Native 
 Cloud SMS APIs including Twilio and MessageBird 
 Mixpanel for analytics / dashboarding 
 Figma for design collaboration, GitHub for reviewing and merging pull requests 
 REST integrations with Salesforce, Stripe, Hubspot, Slack, Okta, Zapier and more 
 Internal communication via Slack, Monday, and Zoom

Title: FRONT END WEB DEVELOPER - Chesapeake, VA 23320 - Indeed.com
Description:
The Front End Developer will take their passion for digital usability, design and web development to create world class experiences for Dollar Tree’s customers who interact with the brand via various digital means. The Front End Developer’s main role is to work with various internal and external stakeholders to capture business requirements, visions, and insights and then to transform them into scalable dynamic digital experiences The Front End Developer will collaborate with both company management as well as with external vendor partners to design and develop these digital and web applications. The Front End Developer will also play a role in developing the knowledge, understanding and underlying skill sets of any Interface Designers/Web Developers working in the Digital Division (Dollar Tree Direct) of Dollar Tree, Inc.
 Provide technical Leadership for all aspects of Dollar Tree’s Ecommerce sites, Non-Ecommerce sites, Local Store Websites, Call Center application. Serve as Primary technical contact for partners and vendors in terms of integrations, configurations, maintenance, enhancements, launches and fixes. Play lead role in capturing requirements, issues, and enhancement requests from within the Digital division and from without (EX; HR, Finance, Merch) to then come up with recommended technical solutions based on those requests. Play one of two high profile roles (Project Manager or Technical Lead) for all medium to large projects (size based on scope and complexity) which Division is charged with implementing Accountable for making sound recommendations on the navigation, functionality, organizational structure, page-to-page flow and design of ecommerce and non ecommerce web sites. Translate strategy, business requirements, consumer research findings and usability/design best practices into site design solutions that balance the best user experience while delivering on business goals. Work closely with graphic designers to create, schedule and launch various on-site and off-site promotional campaigns (i.e. Content Pages, Banner Ads, and Emails). Work closely and collaboratively with the company’s IS department to ensure all company standards, policies and process requirements are met and maintained. Work closely with Dollar Tree Direct Upper Management to ensure auditable systems are in place and maintained to ensure compliance from both a legal and an auditing perspective. Play the Leader’s role in the monitoring, tracking, fixing and testing of enhancements and bug fixes. Serve as a liaison between e-commerce group and Site hosting partner Oracle. Working with Oracle on a day to day and week by week basis both in terms of making recommendations to their OMS and OCP platforms as well as their MCOM Reporting Suite, but also from a budget management standpoint. Assist in managing relationships with various technical partners & vendors as needed. Monitor site performance across a variety of metrics (i.e. load time, up-time, performance across browsers, click through pathing, conversion, abandonment, etc.). Perform expert reviews on concepts and wire frames and integrate this into the design process on an iterative basis by presenting the findings and suggesting changes where necessary. Support Call Center efforts, looking for process flow improvements made possible by improving Interfaces and Work Flows. Facilitate user sessions, present recommendations and negotiate win/win solutions with project team members. Prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and produce quality work in a fast-paced environment. Pin-point important issues that may require further discovery research. Create requirements documentation for issue resolution, including gathering business requirements and detailing possible solutions. Design user interaction solutions/schematics based on sound usability principles, research and technical feasibility. Express these solutions through design documents. These documents may include architecture-maps, system process flows and thumbnail flows.
 Minimum Requirements/Qualifications
 Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (EX:  BS – Information Technology) plus a minimum of 8 years of interface design including site development and adaptation for established, consumer facing web sites. A minimum of 8 years of experience in each of the following technologies: HTML/CSS/JavaScript A minimum of 5 years of Web programming/Computer logic experience A minimum of 1-3 years of experience in XML A minimum of 1-3 years of Server configuration experience. A minimum of 1-3 years of front-end technologies (Web Developer Suite) to include Dreamweaver and PhotoShop A minimum if 3 years of experience and proven success in implementing usability testing practices and then implementing deliverables based of those outputs A thorough and deep intellectual understanding of common web and interface conventions, as well as dynamic, data-driven web sites. Strong understanding of various Web browser platforms (Firefox, Chrome, Safari, Internet Explorer), and the impact/variations they can have on such things as usability, load times, and renderings A proven track record of Project Management is necessary as is the ability to play roles in multiple projects in a fast paced environment with a focus on delivery world class outputs/deliverables Must be able to translate business strategies into conceptual diagrams, task flows, and site maps A strong working knowledge SEO best practices as well as experience in SEO analytics Knowledge and understanding of the importance of marketing and online branding Detail oriented with excellent organization, analytical, technical writing and problem-solving skills. Must be fully vaccinated from COVID-19, as defined by the CDC, by the date of hire. Proof of vaccination required. Request for medical or religious accommodation must be made prior to the start date
 Desired Qualifications Sans Secure Coding Training and Certification Strong understanding and track record of coding to WAG and ADA Accessibility standards

Title: Front End Developer - New York, NY 10001 - Indeed.com
Description:
Who we are: 
 
Droit is a technology company at the forefront of merging finance and computational law. We build software that digitizes regulations and makes intelligent decisions in real-time transactional systems. Our award-winning platform is providing mission-critical, low-latency services for the world’s most prominent and complex financial institutions. 
 
At Droit we seek candidates who are curious, driven and willing to bring their unique skills and perspectives to our work. We offer the opportunity for employees with a range of experience to develop their skills while shaping our platform and making meaningful contributions to the firm. 
 
 
What our Software Engineers do: 
 
Software engineers take holistic and collaborative approaches to solving the firm's core business problems. They don’t just write and review code - engineers are responsible for architecting and designing the infrastructure involved with any given project/deliverable and are also responsible for communicating these decisions effectively and clearly. 
 
Here are just some of the projects we're working on: 
 
 Business logic and APIs for our core decision engine 
 Functional-reactive web applications and UIs 
 Domain-specific languages and compilers 
 Parsing laws from heterogeneous sources 
 Collaborating with our Knowledge Engineering team to research and design new product lines 
 
 What we're looking for: 
 
 A high degree of curiosity with the ability to ask thoughtful questions and solve challenging problems 
 The capacity to envision a variety of solutions and to clearly articulate them and explain the trade-offs 
 The ability to use functional programming to design simple and elegant solutions 
 A collaborative mind-set that enjoys working with others and knowledge sharing to achieve the best results 
 An eagerness to give and receive feedback in an open team atmosphere to better the overall result 
 Experience and/or interest in building web UI applications 
 React or Angular web stack experience and/or practical experience with (or interest in transitioning to) a functional language such as Clojure/ClojureScript 
 
 Any of the following would be an added benefit: 
 
 Experience with ClojureScript using re-frame for UI development 
 Experience Building React applications and RESTful APIs 
 Experience with CSS frameworks, such as Bootstrap 
 Experience using a RDBMS such as Postgres 
 
 
A little more about Droit: 
 
Our award-winning platform, Adept, has been in live production since March 2014. A series-A funding in late 2016, led by Goldman Sachs, has further boosted growth. Droit is based out of New York and London. 
 
Droit is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to an innovative, fast-paced and diverse workforce that represents a variety of backgrounds, experiences, perspectives and skills.

Title: Principal Engineer (Front End) - Santa Monica, CA 90401 - Indeed.com
Description:
GoodRx is America’s healthcare marketplace. Each month, millions people visit goodrx.com to find reliable health information and discounts for their healthcare — and we’ve helped people save $30 billion since 2011. We provide prescription discounts that are accepted at more than 70,000 pharmacies in the U.S., as well as telehealth services including doctor visits and lab tests. Our services have been positively reviewed by Good Morning America, The New York Times, NBC News, AARP, and many others. 
Our goal is to help Americans find convenient and affordable healthcare. We offer solutions for consumers, employers, health plans, and anyone else who shares our desire to provide affordable prescriptions to all Americans. 
We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company and industry. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has a seat at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunities to excel. 
With that said, research shows that women and other underrepresented groups apply only if they meet 100% of the criteria. GoodRx is committed to leveling the playing field, and we encourage women, people of color, those in the LGBTQ+ communities, and Veterans to apply for positions even if they don’t necessarily check every box outlined in the job description. Please still get in touch - we’d love to connect and see if you could be good for the role! 
About The Team / Role 
GoodRx is looking for a strong principal engineer to join its Prescription Management team. The Prescription Management group has been tasked to help personalize the experience between a user and their prescriptions throughout the GoodRx ecosystem. The team visualizes data and information in ways that both engage and inform. 
As part of the Prescription Management team, the ideal candidate will have a specialist’s knowledge of web-based, front end development. Along with a deep and thorough technical acumen, the candidate should have an equally strong ability to lift up team members and work strongly with others while striving to reach the team’s goals. 
 Responsibilities: 
Write clean, fast, well-designed, well-tested, readable, and maintainable code 
Work with teams across the organization, including product, design, legal, and business development to think beyond the technical implications of your design decisions 
Engage in code reviews to ensure code quality as well as share and distribute knowledge 
Continuously push to raise the team’s, and organization’s, standard of engineering excellence by implementing, or enhancing, best practices for coding, testing, and the developer experience 
Lead projects from idea to positive execution 
Actively mentor other engineers by leading and collaborating in all engineering discussions, evangelizing engineering best practices 
Own, create, or review technical design proposals and proof of concepts 
 Skills & Qualifications: 
7+ years of software development experience 
Substantial experience in technical leadership over responsive isomorphic applications in high-scale and high-reliability cloud deployments 
Detail-oriented, critical thinker, self-motivated, enthusiastic, resourceful, personable, customer-focused, and interested in mentorship and well being of other team members 
Ability to convey complex technical information to a variety of levels within the organization 
Demonstrated experience with React, TypeScript, NodeJS, ES6, and consuming GraphQL 
Enthusiasm for software architecture across the front-end, back-end, and the APIs that glue them 
Passionate about code quality, continuous delivery, and automated testing 
Comfortable challenging yourself, and your team, to improve ways of working 
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related quantitative degree 
 Nice to Have: 
Extensive knowledge of Feature Management tools like Optimizely or LaunchDarkly 
Experience with Content Management Systems like Contentful or ContentStack 
Previously integrated a Customer Data Platform like Segment 
Experience with Content Relation Management tools like Iterable or Braze 
Leveraged, and enhanced, an internal Design System 
 GoodRx is America's healthcare marketplace. The company offers the most comprehensive and accurate resource for affordable prescription medications in the U.S., gathering pricing information from thousands of pharmacies coast to coast, as well as a telehealth marketplace for online doctor visits and lab tests. Since 2011, Americans with and without health insurance have saved $30 billion using GoodRx and million consumers visit goodrx.com each month to find discounts and information related to their healthcare. GoodRx is the #1 most downloaded medical app on the iOS and Android app stores. For more information, visit www.goodrx.com.

Title: Front-End Developer - California - Indeed.com
Description:
Join our Mission to Promote Dialogue between Companies and their Customers 
 Help us build a beautiful and delightful cross-platform application that our users will love. Thousands of customers use Avochato every day to engage in real-time conversations, sharing messages and photos and more across SMS, Live Chat, and WhatsApp. You will help us expand and simplify the Avochato app, and deliver exciting new features for our users. 
 
Avochato is an enterprise mobile messaging company, based in San Francisco, that gives teams the tools needed to have lasting, ongoing, two-way messaging conversations with customers. Consumers today prefer to communicate with messaging applications, but enterprises are still built on email and phone systems. Avochato bridges this gap by upgrading teams to messaging. We believe real-time, two-way messaging provides the best customer experience while helping companies to scale efficiently. Avochato enables communication via text messaging, live chat, WhatsApp, and integrates with Salesforce Sales and Service Cloud. 
 
Recently named a category leader and Top 50 Product on G2 Crowd for 2020, Avochato handles millions of messages per month across hundreds of happy customers. The company grew 15x in 15 months and raised a $5M Series A at the end of 2018. 
 
 Why You'll Love Avochato: 
 We're committed to making a positive impact above all else– as leaders we lead people to a better place, whether it's a teammate, a customer, an investor, an advisor, a family member, or a friend 
 Avochato believes in personal growth, transparency, and a high degree of autonomy 
 Sales cycles are fast at Avochato, new features ship weekly, and we celebrate every win on a daily basis across all teams 
 Avochato is a remote-first team that is flexible on location 
 Avochato teammates use the Avochato platform - your teammates are your customers, and there is a tight feedback loop on developing products and getting feedback 
 This Role: 
 
We're looking for sharp, analytical engineers to help us continue to move quickly and scale engineering operations. Ideal candidates have strong startup experience and have a breadth of knowledge throughout multiple parts of the software ecosystem. 
 
Responsibilities : 
 
 Collaborate with other engineers and product teammates to make new features come to life from design to deployment 
 Build on top of our existing fully-featured enterprise messaging apps on desktop and mobile using React, Redux, TypeScript, HTML 5 and CSS3 
 Develop and maintain our user interface based on our product requirements and designs JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, and TypeScript 
 Compartmentalize code updates to feature branches for review and deployment using Git 
 Engage in code reviews with other engineers for pull requests 
 Participate in weekly stand-up meetings and report progress on assignments 
 Participate in testing and quality assurance on stage environments before weekly releases 
 
 Requirements : 
 
 5+ years production   experience  developing user-facing web applications using using HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript 
 4+ years production experience  developing and maintaining web applications in production using React and Redux 
 Great communicator, detail-oriented 
 Excels working in a remote environment 
 Collaborative, self-motivated and driven 
 Figma experieince a plus 
 
 A bit of our stack: 
 
 Mobile-first Front-end Web development in HTML5, TypeScript, CSS3, React & Redux 
 Native Mobile applications compiled from React Native 
 Cloud SMS APIs including Twilio and MessageBird 
 Mixpanel for analytics / dashboarding 
 Figma for design collaboration, GitHub for reviewing and merging pull requests 
 REST integrations with Salesforce, Stripe, Hubspot, Slack, Okta, Zapier and more 
 Internal communication via Slack, Monday, and Zoom

Title: FRONT END WEB DEVELOPER - Chesapeake, VA 23320 - Indeed.com
Description:
The Front End Developer will take their passion for digital usability, design and web development to create world class experiences for Dollar Tree’s customers who interact with the brand via various digital means. The Front End Developer’s main role is to work with various internal and external stakeholders to capture business requirements, visions, and insights and then to transform them into scalable dynamic digital experiences The Front End Developer will collaborate with both company management as well as with external vendor partners to design and develop these digital and web applications. The Front End Developer will also play a role in developing the knowledge, understanding and underlying skill sets of any Interface Designers/Web Developers working in the Digital Division (Dollar Tree Direct) of Dollar Tree, Inc.
 Provide technical Leadership for all aspects of Dollar Tree’s Ecommerce sites, Non-Ecommerce sites, Local Store Websites, Call Center application. Serve as Primary technical contact for partners and vendors in terms of integrations, configurations, maintenance, enhancements, launches and fixes. Play lead role in capturing requirements, issues, and enhancement requests from within the Digital division and from without (EX; HR, Finance, Merch) to then come up with recommended technical solutions based on those requests. Play one of two high profile roles (Project Manager or Technical Lead) for all medium to large projects (size based on scope and complexity) which Division is charged with implementing Accountable for making sound recommendations on the navigation, functionality, organizational structure, page-to-page flow and design of ecommerce and non ecommerce web sites. Translate strategy, business requirements, consumer research findings and usability/design best practices into site design solutions that balance the best user experience while delivering on business goals. Work closely with graphic designers to create, schedule and launch various on-site and off-site promotional campaigns (i.e. Content Pages, Banner Ads, and Emails). Work closely and collaboratively with the company’s IS department to ensure all company standards, policies and process requirements are met and maintained. Work closely with Dollar Tree Direct Upper Management to ensure auditable systems are in place and maintained to ensure compliance from both a legal and an auditing perspective. Play the Leader’s role in the monitoring, tracking, fixing and testing of enhancements and bug fixes. Serve as a liaison between e-commerce group and Site hosting partner Oracle. Working with Oracle on a day to day and week by week basis both in terms of making recommendations to their OMS and OCP platforms as well as their MCOM Reporting Suite, but also from a budget management standpoint. Assist in managing relationships with various technical partners & vendors as needed. Monitor site performance across a variety of metrics (i.e. load time, up-time, performance across browsers, click through pathing, conversion, abandonment, etc.). Perform expert reviews on concepts and wire frames and integrate this into the design process on an iterative basis by presenting the findings and suggesting changes where necessary. Support Call Center efforts, looking for process flow improvements made possible by improving Interfaces and Work Flows. Facilitate user sessions, present recommendations and negotiate win/win solutions with project team members. Prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and produce quality work in a fast-paced environment. Pin-point important issues that may require further discovery research. Create requirements documentation for issue resolution, including gathering business requirements and detailing possible solutions. Design user interaction solutions/schematics based on sound usability principles, research and technical feasibility. Express these solutions through design documents. These documents may include architecture-maps, system process flows and thumbnail flows.
 Minimum Requirements/Qualifications
 Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (EX:  BS – Information Technology) plus a minimum of 8 years of interface design including site development and adaptation for established, consumer facing web sites. A minimum of 8 years of experience in each of the following technologies: HTML/CSS/JavaScript A minimum of 5 years of Web programming/Computer logic experience A minimum of 1-3 years of experience in XML A minimum of 1-3 years of Server configuration experience. A minimum of 1-3 years of front-end technologies (Web Developer Suite) to include Dreamweaver and PhotoShop A minimum if 3 years of experience and proven success in implementing usability testing practices and then implementing deliverables based of those outputs A thorough and deep intellectual understanding of common web and interface conventions, as well as dynamic, data-driven web sites. Strong understanding of various Web browser platforms (Firefox, Chrome, Safari, Internet Explorer), and the impact/variations they can have on such things as usability, load times, and renderings A proven track record of Project Management is necessary as is the ability to play roles in multiple projects in a fast paced environment with a focus on delivery world class outputs/deliverables Must be able to translate business strategies into conceptual diagrams, task flows, and site maps A strong working knowledge SEO best practices as well as experience in SEO analytics Knowledge and understanding of the importance of marketing and online branding Detail oriented with excellent organization, analytical, technical writing and problem-solving skills. Must be fully vaccinated from COVID-19, as defined by the CDC, by the date of hire. Proof of vaccination required. Request for medical or religious accommodation must be made prior to the start date
 Desired Qualifications Sans Secure Coding Training and Certification Strong understanding and track record of coding to WAG and ADA Accessibility standards

Title: Front-End Developer (Project Based) - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Superfly is an experience company obsessed with activating and amplifying communities around common passions and unforgettable moments. We're helping brands connect meaningfully to culture & creating the future of live entertainment. We support our partners in identifying and amplifying their unique slant within culture in ways that drive business objectives and create resonance. 
From producing some of the world’s most iconic festivals, to media-driven joint ventures and location based entertainment, Superfly has been defining the creative edge of live entertainment for over 20 years. 
Job Summary: 
We're looking for a Front End Developer to join our Superfly X Division on a project basis. The Front End Developer will work with the Marketing and Retail teams to build experience (event) and eCommerce websites. 
Duties and Responsibilities: 
Work with the development team to build and update cross-browser and mobile-first responsive websites & apps for Superfly projects, writing clean and maintainable HTML/CSS/JS code. 
Provide coding and technical assistance to help the eCommerce team launch new Shopify sites and products. 
Collaborate with remote teams to facilitate the front-end coding and delivery of new features, functionality & platform enhancements. 
Identify and help implement front end code changes to improve browser compatibility and optimize site performance. 
Assist the eCommerce and development teams to QA, detect, troubleshoot, fix, and prevent layout or content issues affecting production sites. 
Research and provide technical assessment of new technology, trends to add interactive and engaging site content for our customers. 
Build fast interactive usability prototypes to support new development and innovation opportunities. 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 
At least 2+ years of experience building modern websites & apps 
Experience building Shopify websites (pre-built themes or custom) 
Strong experience writing clean & maintainable HTML/JS/CSS code 
Intermediate level experience with a modern JS Framework such as React or Vue is preferred 
Design eye - passionate about building engaging web/UI experiences 
Skill Set: HTML, CSS/SCSS, JavaScript & Shopify 
Bonus: React/Vue, XD, Sketch, Webpack 
Proven ability to multi-task and handle a diverse workload 
Demonstrate a strong sense of urgency 
Extremely organized and have excellent time-management skills 
Why Work at Superfly 
We are idea evolvers, people lovers, music nerds and passionate humans who are constantly striving to enhance our industry leading-work. We have fun taking work seriously. 
We offer a comprehensive benefits package including generous company contribution towards employee medical benefits, 100% company paid dental, vision, and long-term disability plans, flexible spending account, voluntary life insurance, commuter benefits, retirement plan, flexible time off policy and a strong, collaborative, positive company culture which we expect you will contribute to. Title: Senior Front End Developer - New York, NY - Indeed.com
Description:
About Beacon Platform: Beacon was founded in 2014 by Kirat Singh and Mark Higgins, industry leaders in building and designing enterprise-scale trading, analytics, and risk management platforms. Beacon Platform enables financial institutions of all sizes to operationalize front-office development at enterprise scale on the cloud. The Platform consists of Beacon Front Office Suite for cross-asset management of trades, positions and risk, and Beacon Core, an integrated development and operating platform that enables quants and software engineers to collaboratively develop and continuously deploy business solutions. Beacon's open architecture and transparent source-code model empower clients to achieve their business goals while maintaining unparalleled ownership of the full technology stack. Beacon is a collaborative and innovative team with over 120 employees headquartered in New York, London, Berlin and Tokyo. Flexible working hours and location are supported. 
Purpose of Job 
 
The UI team is responsible for developing, supporting and maintaining Beacon Platform's custom UI framework, Glint, which abstracts away HTML, CSS and Javascript, enabling non-frontend engineers to write rich, component-based, full-stack web applications exclusively using Python. React and Redux underpin the frontend of the framework, typically binding to our proprietary dependency graph implementation for data modeling on the backend. 
 
The successful candidate will help Glint continue to grow, exercising an eye for detail across all aspects of the development lifecycle while maintaining organization and good code hygiene. This engineer should be able to effectively communicate both with Beacon's internal teams and with clients. 
 
Key Responsibilities 
 
 Design, implement and maintain components and frameworks that add to Glint's toolset. 
 Collaborate with internal and external clients to understand their application development needs 
 Research new technologies to implement within the Glint environment, seek out inefficiencies and match relevant technology solutions to resolve them 
 Participate in code reviews and provide technical feedback to the team 
 Provide technical guidance and vision for Glint's front-end ecosystem. 
 Provide technical leadership and mentorship to the team. 
 
 Successful Candidates possess these qualities 
 
 Self-starter who is passionate about technology 
 Keen eye for automation and improving efficiency 
 Comfortable with fast-paced and strongly collaborative environments 
 Able to take on ideas and feedback from both technical experts and business thought-leaders 
 Takes ownership for their work and has exceptional attention to detail 
 Actively seek to improve the product and take ownership of progressing the framework 
 
 Required skills and experience 
 
 8+ years experience developing frontend applications using Javascript, HTML, CSS, etc. 
 Expert in ReactJS 
 Experience working with frontend state management using Redux 
 Experience writing frontend unit & end-to-end tests e.g. Jest, Jasmine, Mocha and Puppeteer or Selenium 
 Demonstrated ability of building high-performing data-heavy web applications 
 Experienced in optimising project, component and rendering performance issues using modern tooling. 
 Open to extending full-stack experience & learning Python as part of the role. 
 Good communication skills 
 Ability to work in agile-based project management structure 
 Familiarity with Git 
 Attention to good UI/UX design 
 
 Preferred skills and experience 
 
 Familiarity with Python 
About Us: We are smart, curious people who want to work in an environment that respects all of our lives and interests. This means we all care about and respect the boundaries of work-life balance - but when we work, we work hard and with great attention to detail. 
 
Beacon does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Beacon encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants. 
 
Beacon Platform participates in eVerify

You’re a front-end specialist and a natural leader. You’re just as comfortable debating technical decisions with engineers as you are talking pixels and UX flows with designers. Title: Front-end Engineer - New York, NY - Indeed.com
Description:
We are seeking a Front-End Engineer to help bring out the visual element of the SparkAI product. You will be responsible for translating UI designs, working in concert with our product and design teams, and taking an active role in defining the visual definition and experience. If you have experience with a modern React-based stack and are excited about developing complex browser-based visual software, we'd love to connect with you. 
 About us 
 At SparkAI, we are on a mission to accelerate the proliferation of automation and robotics. We've started by addressing the most expensive and pervasive barrier to scale – AI edge cases – with an API-based service that resolves machine learning exceptions live, in production. Our customers are some of the largest and most interesting robotics applications in the world. 
 We're led by veterans of the autonomous vehicle industry (Zoox, Uber ATG, Apple, Otto) and changing how companies are solving problems on the path to commercialization, empowering the most ambitious teams to deliver groundbreaking automation products faster than ever before. If you believe revolutionary automation and robotics products shouldn't have to wait for the next AI breakthrough, join us on this journey. Our leadership team has deep ties into industry and knows a team is greater than the sum of its parts. We look forward to meeting you! 
 What you'll do here 
 Working with our product and design teams, bring our visual designs to life in a web-based environment 
Build quality, featured, rich and reusable React components 
Support our future mobile efforts 
Participate in the development of new UI features to support our customer 
 What we're looking for 
 Experience building single-page applications, using React and similar technologies 
Knowledge of modern JavaScript (ES6+) / Typescript and build tools (Webpack etc) 
Knowledge of CSS, including implementing maintainable CSS architecture 
Experience in implementing light animation 
 You'll love this job if you 
 Have a passion for creating beautiful, rich components 
Care about making pixel-perfect designs and have an eye for the aesthetic 
Like getting in the weeds with CSS! 
Are excited about robotics, and the future of automation 
Are a self-starter with infection enthusiasm, energy and problem-solving abilities 
 Hiring process 
 Send us your resume and (optionally!) a personalized cover letter 
If we think there is a great fit, we'll set up an introductory phone call with you. This is an opportunity to get to know more about us, our culture, and our vision for robotics 
From there, we'll set up a remote interview with our team. We understand your time is valuable and will work around your schedule 
From the interview, you'll hear from us within a week about an offer or next steps 
Even if you don't think you're a fit or the timing is right, we'd love to hear from you! Apply below 
 Our culture 
 At SparkAI, we're committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer 
We strive to create a high-energy, collaborative and supportive place to work 
We believe in a high-trust environment, where every member of the team has a high degree of autonomy 
We are fully remote with a flexible workplace 
All employees have access to our top-tier benefits package

Title: Front End Developer - New York, NY 10001 - Indeed.com
Description:
Who we are: 
 
Droit is a technology company at the forefront of merging finance and computational law. We build software that digitizes regulations and makes intelligent decisions in real-time transactional systems. Our award-winning platform is providing mission-critical, low-latency services for the world’s most prominent and complex financial institutions. 
 
At Droit we seek candidates who are curious, driven and willing to bring their unique skills and perspectives to our work. We offer the opportunity for employees with a range of experience to develop their skills while shaping our platform and making meaningful contributions to the firm. 
 
 
What our Software Engineers do: 
 
Software engineers take holistic and collaborative approaches to solving the firm's core business problems. They don’t just write and review code - engineers are responsible for architecting and designing the infrastructure involved with any given project/deliverable and are also responsible for communicating these decisions effectively and clearly. 
 
Here are just some of the projects we're working on: 
 
 Business logic and APIs for our core decision engine 
 Functional-reactive web applications and UIs 
 Domain-specific languages and compilers 
 Parsing laws from heterogeneous sources 
 Collaborating with our Knowledge Engineering team to research and design new product lines 
 
 What we're looking for: 
 
 A high degree of curiosity with the ability to ask thoughtful questions and solve challenging problems 
 The capacity to envision a variety of solutions and to clearly articulate them and explain the trade-offs 
 The ability to use functional programming to design simple and elegant solutions 
 A collaborative mind-set that enjoys working with others and knowledge sharing to achieve the best results 
 An eagerness to give and receive feedback in an open team atmosphere to better the overall result 
 Experience and/or interest in building web UI applications 
 React or Angular web stack experience and/or practical experience with (or interest in transitioning to) a functional language such as Clojure/ClojureScript 
 
 Any of the following would be an added benefit: 
 
 Experience with ClojureScript using re-frame for UI development 
 Experience Building React applications and RESTful APIs 
 Experience with CSS frameworks, such as Bootstrap 
 Experience using a RDBMS such as Postgres 
 
 
A little more about Droit: 
 
Our award-winning platform, Adept, has been in live production since March 2014. A series-A funding in late 2016, led by Goldman Sachs, has further boosted growth. Droit is based out of New York and London. 
 
Droit is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to an innovative, fast-paced and diverse workforce that represents a variety of backgrounds, experiences, perspectives and skills.

Title: Sr Software Engineer - Front End - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Kochava provides a unified platform with solutions for mobile advertising and marketing technology clients. We serve the world’s top digital brands; set industry standards for secure, real-time data solutions; and help people-based marketers establish identity, measure, and optimize their marketing across connected devices. 
We enable the visibility into and management of billions of data points, millions of users, and hundreds of millions of dollars in lifetime value (LTV) and promotional ad spend. Our Marketers Operating System (m/OS) empowers our customers to see and manage their data and unleash the power of their connected audiences; Globally, Kochava is trusted by the largest brands across a wide spectrum of verticals, including mobile gaming, commerce, news and media, to perform high-end mobile analytics. 
 
 We're looking for a Software Engineer to function as a central member of Kochava's front-end development team. The mobile user tracking and attribution market is challenging, dynamic, fun, and provides almost unlimited opportunities for personal and professional growth. 
What you can expect in a FE Developer role at Kochava: 
You'll help improve the overall experience of our product through improving the quality of the Frontend features 
You’ll help identify areas of improvements in the code base and help contribute to make it better 
You’ll learn, collaborate and teach other FE Developers. Everyone can contribute something new to the team regardless of how long they’ve been in the industry. 
You’ll fix prioritized issues typically assigned to you by the Director of FE. These are typically bugs listed in an Asana task with an attached priority label. 
You'll write high quality code to complete tasks assigned to you. 
You’ll contribute to and follow our workflow process, alongside the rest of the FE Developer team. 
**Role can be located in Sandpoint, Idaho (HQ); or remote from a company approved U.S. State. 
 Job Responsibilities 
Develop and deliver front end-design assets using clean, easy-to-read, semantic HTML/JS/CSS/SCSS 
Review specifications & provide time estimates on the development of projects & features 
 
 
Experience/Skills Required
 Have prior experience building Frontend web applications 
Have a strong understanding in core web and browser concepts (eg. how does JavaScript handle asynchronous code) 
Have a strong understanding of CSS/SASS, semantic HTML and core JavaScript concepts. 
Have working knowledge writing CSS in the SASS/LESS extension languages 
Have experience working with modern frontend frameworks (eg. Vue, React, Angular, etc.) 
Bonus: Strong understanding of Vue 3, Vue Router, Vuex, Vuetify & JWT
 Have a working knowledge of TDD, BDD, and end to end testing procedures 
Have experience optimizing code and look for ways to resolve performance issues 
Are proactive in taking ownership of tasks and take them to completion 
Desire to learn and continually give and receive feedback effectively 
Proactive in taking ownership of tasks and take them to completion 
 Our Start 
Kochava began in 2011 when a team of mobile and gaming professionals saw the need to better understand the feedback loop of user acquisition, engagement, and LTV for mobile applications. Through the process of creating apps for customers from a wide range of industries, we were repeatedly asked if we could shed some light on what media advertising efforts were converting and the effectiveness of their mobile ad spend by partner. Realizing a solution to these questions wasn’t readily available, we started designing and building a mobile measurement platform that would become Kochava. 
Our HQ Location 
We live and work in the wonderful ski resort town of Sandpoint, Idaho. Kochava has sales and agency representation in major markets worldwide, but we choose to grow our development and engineering infrastructure around Sandpoint, as it allows us to stay focused on cutting code while taking advantage of the community and quality of life the town offers to our team. 
Kochava is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.

Title: Sitecore Front-End Developer - Austin, TX 78749 - Indeed.com
Description:
About Engagency 
 
Engagency has over a decade of experience specializing in enterprise digital transformation projects. This is no brochure site/Wordpress shop. We’re helping $500M - $10B companies deploy, enhance, and support Sitecore, the most sophisticated and highly rated .NET web content management and digital marketing platform in the industry. 
 
The Opportunity: 
 
We’re looking for a Sitecore Front-End Developer. This position is 75% front-end development with 25% back-end development. If this sounds like you, let’s talk! 
 
Remote work options are available for this position and applicants outside of the Austin, TX, proximity are encouraged to apply. 
 
Key Activities: 
 Build the front-end of Sitecore implementations based on appealing visual design built on enterprise content management system platforms. 
Collaborate closely with back-end developers to link data from the backend with responsive front-end. 
Work independently with the support of a highly collaborative delivery team throughout the lifecycle of projects with high visibility for brands with a global reach 
Create responsive applications using high-end frameworks such as React or Angular 
Write useful documentation, and provide world-class support 
Depending on your interests and abilities, you’ll also have an opportunity to contribute to technical architecture, training, consulting, sales, and blogging. 
 
Qualifications & Requirements: 
 
Minimum of 2 years professional experience building front-end of websites using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern responsive frameworks 
Minimum of 3 years experience using responsive UI frameworks and C# to make the web a better place. We integrate HTML, CSS, JavaScript, C#, MVC, Enterprise IT, and Cloud applications with Sitecore. We help create automated, personalized digital marketing and commerce experiences that are so responsive, helpful, and relevant, that buying always feels like a joy. 
Minimum of 1 year of experience working with ASP.NET MVC 
Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, jQuery) 
Knowledge of SASS 
 
Skills & Abilities: 
 
Ability to create pixel-perfect front-ends using modern responsive frameworks 
Great attention to detail and knack for visual design and utility 
Familiarity with with C# Razor engine 
Familiarity with with Visual Studio 2019 or higher 
Knowledge of React or Angular (React preferred) 
Familiarity with Azure, Gulp, Bitbucket, and Git Bash 
Ability to work in a dynamic environment, self-direct, and take ownership for features and tasks of a project with a strong desire to go the extra mile 
Serious BONUS POINTS for familiarity with Web Content Management systems, particularly Sitecore and Optimizely/Episerver
 We’re dedicated to your personal and professional growth 
 
Engagency is much more than a place to work, it’s a place to learn, to lead, and to grow. We’ve created a place where you’re encouraged to explore and develop your skills and interests, both personally and professionally. 
 
You’ll work independently with the support of a highly collaborative team on projects with high visibility for brands with a global reach. You’ll learn to write useful documentation, and provide world-class support. 
 
Depending on your interests and abilities, you’ll also have an opportunity to contribute to technical architecture, training, consulting, sales, and blogging. 
 
 Good Character = Good Culture 
 
At Engagency, culture is the natural result of attracting good people. We believe that a good company culture depends as much on what you give, as what you get. It’s the character of each individual that defines us. It’s our values and motivations that bind us. It’s something that each member of our team has the privilege and the responsibility to help define, nurture and protect. 
 
 Engagency  has over a decade of experience specializing in enterprise digital transformation projects. This is no brochure site/Wordpress shop. We’re helping $500M - $10B companies deploy, enhance, and support Sitecore, the most sophisticated and highly rated .NET web content management and digital marketing platform in the industry. 
 
At Engagency, we use responsive UI frameworks and C# to make the web a better place. We integrate HTML, CSS, JavaScript, C#, MVC, Enterprise IT, and Cloud applications with Sitecore. We help create automated, personalized digital marketing and commerce experiences that are so responsive, helpful, and relevant, that buying always feels like a joy.
 The Opportunity:
 We’re building an elite team of web developers, fit to serve the world's leading companies. Call us idealists, but we don’t think it’s too much to ask...we’re looking for a hardworking  Full Stack Web Developer with a curious mind and servant's heart . This position is 75% front-end development with 25% back-end development. If this sounds like you, let’s talk! 
 
Remote work options are available for this position and applicants outside of the Austin, TX, proximity are encouraged to apply. 
 
Key Activities: 
 Build the front-end of applications through appealing visual design built on enterprise content management system platforms. 
Collaborate closely with back-end developers to link data from the backend with responsive front-end. 
Work independently with the support of a highly collaborative delivery team throughout the lifecycle of projects with high visibility for brands with a global reach 
Create responsive applications using high-end frameworks such as React or Angular 
Write useful documentation, and provide world-class support 
Depending on your interests and abilities, you’ll also have an opportunity to contribute to technical architecture, training, consulting, sales, and blogging. 
 
Qualifications & Requirements: 
 
Minimum of 2 years professional experience building front-end of websites using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern responsive frameworks 
Minimum of 1 year of experience with advanced framework such as React or Angular (React preferred) 
 
Skills & Abilities: 
 
Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, jQuery) 
Ability to create pixel-perfect front-ends using modern responsive frameworks 
Knowledge of at least one back-end language (e.g. C#, Java, .NET) 
Great attention to detail and knack for visual design and utility 
Comprehensive knowledge of responsive UI and other design patterns skills 
Knowledge of React or Angular (React preferred) 
Ability to work in a dynamic environment, self-direct, and take ownership for features and tasks of a project with a strong desire to go the extra mile 
Serious BONUS POINTS for familiarity with Web Content Management systems, particularly Sitecore and Optimizely/Episerver
 More about Engagency: 
 
At Engagency,  character = culture.  We believe that creating a good company culture is more about what you give, than what you get. We’ve created a culture that is friendly, collaborative, and down to earth. We’ve created an environment where doing excellent work, intrinsic motivation, and going above and beyond is the norm– but we still don’t take ourselves too seriously. We’re honored to have been named one of Austin Business Journal’s 2020 Best Places to Work.
 WORK VISA SPONSORSHIP 
We are unable to provide H1B sponsorship at this time.

Title: Junior Front-End Software Development Engineer - New Orleans, LA 70130 - Indeed.com
Description:
If you read the below description and feel this position excites you,  but your experience does not add up 100%, we encourage you to still apply and tell us why!  We look forward to learning what makes you passionate and purposeful. 
Are you fanatical about great customer experiences? Do you love digging into a customer’s pains, industry trends, market conditions, and more, all to evaluate the information, chew it up, and deliver a solution? 
Join us as a Junior Front-End Software Development Engineer  in the New Orleans office, and be instrumental in helping achieve our vision to change behavior and revolutionize payment in the gigantic and increasingly tech-savvy construction industry. 
As a front-end software developer, you'll be responsible for the coding of our innovative designs and layouts of our website and products. Front-end development responsibilities include taking mock-ups or graphic designs to building fully functioning features with HTML/CSS/JS for our products and integrating with back-end systems; fashioning and engineering application functionality. 
Responsibilities and Duties 
Develop and maintain responsive and cross-browser compatible front-end user interface code. 
Create website layouts and user interface by using standard HTML/CSS practices from designs/mockups. 
Integrate with PHP backend components. 
Stay plugged into emerging UI/UX technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities. 
Cooperate with web designers to match visual design intent. 
Qualifications and Skills 
1-4 years of front-end development experience. 
Strong, demonstrable understanding of asynchronous programming concepts. 
In-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS and Javascript. 
Experience with responsive design, and mobile-first approach as well as a good knowledge of previous browsers’ limitations. 
Experience and hands-on skills in JS and one or many modern web frameworks such as Angular.js, Backbone.js. 
Experience with source code version control systems such as Git 
Ability to write modular, scalable, and clean code. 
Strong organizational skills to juggle multiple tasks within the constraints of deadlines. 
Must have strong problem-solving abilities, self-starter, sound team player. 
Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse web technologies and techniques. 
Takes pride in quality architecture and well structured extensible code 
About Levelset 
Levelset has been named one of the "Best Places to Work" by New Orleans CityBusiness four years in a row for our mission-driven culture and commitment to internal and external growth. We are growing rapidly and looking for new exciting team members to add their unique talents to our mission. We empower contractors to always get what they earn, and our software platform makes lien rights, payment paperwork, and compliance in the construction industry simple and stress-free, so contractors and suppliers can get paid faster, have easier access to capital, and less surprises. 
With the recent $500 Million acquisition by Procore, a leading provider of construction management software, Levelset will continue to empower people in construction to get payment under control, facilitating smooth payments and successful projects. Together both companies will deliver on our joint missions to improve the lives of everyone in construction even faster! 
With offices in Austin, Texas, Cairo, Egypt and headquartered in New Orleans, Louisiana Levelset team is 350+ people and growing. 
Why Levelset 
We’re a rapidly growing team working on  interesting and worthwhile problems 
With a newly distributed workforce, we make  engagement and employee wellness  even more of a priority. We want you to love your job! 
We believe  professional growth  (i.e. building your skills) is essential. Working here provides the opportunity for increased responsibility, continuous learning, and more. 
We have a very  welcoming culture  that starts at the top with our CEO. 
Nothing is a secret here, we think  honesty and transparency  create a productive workplace. 
Recognition  for hard work and demonstrating our core values is important to us. 
Benefits 
Competitive health benefits,  including mental, emotional, and behavioral health benefits and an easy to use Employee Assistance Program. 
Flexible sick & personal leave policy  needed for health, family, and parenting during this tough time. 
Open vacation policy  without a cap on the number of days-off. We do require employees to take a minimum of 5 days off in a row each year. 
Subsidized International Travel:  We subsidize international travel starting at 6 months, and increasing each year 
Equity , per company’s general stock grant plan 
401k account  through Betterment which allows you to seamlessly save money for retirement directly from your paycheck 
Learning and Development Opportunities:  In the spirit of our core value to Learn Enough, we offer a book reimbursement program. If you share what you learned from a book with the team, we'll reimburse you for it. We also provide ample room for learning and development opportunities through Coursera online courses, outside speakers, and opportunities to learn skills from your colleagues. 
Levelset is committed to providing an environment where any and all people feel welcome, respected, and free to be their authentic selves. We welcome applicants of all gender identities, sexual orientation, educational background, religion, ethnicities, veteran status, and citizenships.

Title: Front End Engineer - III - Boston, MA 02210 - Indeed.com
Description:
Who are we? 
 
Glad you asked! Zipcar is the world’s leading car-sharing network, found in urban areas and university campuses in more than 500 cities and towns. Our team is smart, creative and fun, and we’re driven by a mission – to enable simple and responsible urban living. 
 
Zipcar is looking for a passionate Front End Engineer with great ideas to join the Zipcar family. If you’re results-oriented, dedicated, and ready to contribute to state-of-the-art technology and an unparalleled member experience then you should apply! 
 
What you’ll do : 
 
 Be part of a team which builds world class web applications that provides an awesome experience to our members. 
 Work collaboratively with product designers, product managers and quality engineers to deliver innovative new solutions and applications for a market leader in the mobility space 
 Strive for continuous improvement of the Zipcar member experience 
 As a senior engineer coach and mentor other engineers and provide technical leadership. 
 
 What You’ll love about being a Zipster 
 
 Building a great brand, that you can see on the street and that’s changing the world. 
 Collaborating with a team of helpful, passionate and technically strong software developers. 
 Being part of a company that is big enough that we can achieve big things together, but small enough that you can make your mark. 
 Our entrepreneurial spirit and a dynamic, fun and flexible work environment. 
 
 What drives success for this role: 
 
 Experience and skill in technologies including React, HTML, CSS, Typescript/Javascript, Angular or similar technologies 
 Passionate software engineer who enjoys building applications of high scale and solving complex software challenges. 
 Own changes to be made from definition to support in production 
 Have a deep understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and approaches 
 Experience with responsive and adaptive design 
 Shipped robust, high-performance, high-scalability applications to production 
 Experience with a 24/7 production environment 
 Clear verbal and written communication; demonstrated ability to collaborate cross-functionally and with peers from a variety of disciplines 
 Committed to Zipcar’s ideals of sustainable resource sharing and urban mobility 
 
 What tops off the tank: 
 
 Competitive Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability Insurance and other voluntary benefits through our parent company, Avis Budget Group 
 Generous paid time off, including holidays, vacation, personal, sick, volunteer and Parental Leave options 
 Tax-free benefit for public transportation or parking expenses 
 Bicycle Reimbursement program 
 401(k) Retirement Plan with company matched contributions 
 Free Zipcar Membership and other employee discounts, including discounts on renting and buying Avis/Budget cars 
 Community involvement opportunities 
 
 Being a Zipcar member gives you easy access to a car nearby without all the cost and hassle of owning one. Founded in 2000, Zipcar disrupted – or innovated – the traditional model of car ownership and independent studies show that Zipcar’s model of car sharing is proven to reduce vehicle ownership, freeing up more city space for people. Zipcar provides members with socially responsible, sustainable mobility options that support the global environment, their communities and city livability. 
 
Zipcar is a subsidiary of Avis Budget Group, Inc. (Nasdaq: CAR), a leading global provider of mobility solutions. For more information, visit: www.zipcar.com.

Title: Front-End Developer - Denver, CO 80206 - Indeed.com
Description:
Communications Strategy Group (CSG®), a strategic communications and marketing agency based in Denver, Colorado, is seeking candidates to support the agency’s website development projects. At CSG, we believe asking the right questions is the quickest path to uncover the right solutions. We’re not interested in work for the sake of work, but we are keenly interested in helping our clients solve their business challenges through better communications. 
This position will be a front-end development role situated within our internal creative team, the Studio. As the in-house web subject matter expert, the front-end developer will also support project management and budgeting for websites and work closely with the creative and account teams to support internal and external development projects. 
Roles and Responsibilities 
Developers at CSG are enthusiastic collaborators who operate with a solution mindset. They act as the web expert on assigned client projects and lend insights to everything from budgeting to plug-in selection (and quite a lot in between). As members of our creative Studio, developers work side-by-side with our writers and designers to bring projects to life. This role also works closely with our Strategy and digital Innovation teams. Successful candidates will prioritize project management and team communication at every stage of a project. This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced developer who wants the ability to have a voice in the agency’s web philosophy and approach. 
To be successful, you’ll need to thrive in a fast-paced environment and face each day with a willingness to jump feet first into whatever comes across your path. Whether you’re helping the business development team members develop a pitch, working with clients to understand their needs, brainstorming with the team, or building impactful websites, you’ll be a critical part of our commitment to purposeful solutions that solve our clients’ business problems. 
Front-End Developers: 
Act as the development expert in the room, confidently making recommendations to help the team deliver the best proposals and solutions to our clients 
Lead the charge on the agency’s website projects, acting as the go-to developer on WordPress projects and supporting business development 
Identify vendor and freelancer support and manage those relationships as needed, including development support for projects on other platforms or outside of in-house capacity 
Support project management with input on scope/budget, timeline and resources 
Support CSG web initiatives and in-house projects 
Qualifications: 
2+ years front-end development experience 
Demonstrated Wordpress expertise and familiarity with other platforms, eg: Wix, SquareSpace, Adobe Experience Manager, etc. 
Experience balancing mobile and desktop versions and implementing solutions to related challenges 
Strong creative problem solving and critical thinking skills and a willingness to embrace a creative mindset to solve development challenges in support of client needs and requirements 
Experience working within a project management system, such as Asana, Airtable, Basecamp, Monday, etc. 
Ability to support project scope, timeline and requirements development 
Experience implementing technical SEO recommendations and a clear understanding of SEO relative to website development 
Working knowledge of Core Web Vitals and ability to help clients and teammates find solutions to related challenges 
Exceptional communication skills and willingness to help others on the team learn and feel confident with website projects 
Agency experience a plus 
Salary and benefits are competitive and commensurate with experience. CSG provides a generous benefits package that includes: unlimited vacation, 401(k) match, paid and subsidized insurance, including medical, dental, and vision, recognition and rewards programs, subsidized gym membership, business casual environment, central Cherry Creek office location, monthly team lunches, and more. 
To apply, please submit your resume, portfolio and a cover letter detailing why you are interested in joining the CSG team and what excites you about development work. If using the quick apply form, you will need to add your cover letter afterwards in order to be considered for the position. 
About CSG 
Communications Strategy Group (CSG®) is a strategic communications firm that solves organizational problems and activates opportunities for its clients. We blend the tenets of public relations and content marketing to deliver purpose-built solutions that connect and engage consumers at every step of the buyer’s journey. Headquartered in Denver, Colorado, CSG is home to passionate strategists and creators from a wide variety of technical disciplines and industry backgrounds. 
With a deep bench of thoughtful, passionate team members, we pride ourselves on being true partners to our clients and coworkers, and we’re dedicated to crafting an inclusive and collaborative working environment that makes people look forward to Mondays. 
A certified Great Place to Work, we offer extensive benefits to our full-time employees, as well as competitive salaries and hourly rates. CSG provides a competitive benefits package that includes great vacation benefits, 401(k) match, paid and subsidized insurance, including medical, dental, and vision, recognition and rewards programs, subsidized gym membership, business casual environment with remote and flexible work arrangements available, central Cherry Creek office location, monthly team lunches, and more. 
To learn more about CSG, its philosophy, culture and work, visit wearecsg.com. 
At CSG, we are committed to creating a diverse environment, maintaining an inclusive culture, prioritizing cross functional collaboration, and emphasizing team member engagement. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
