Title: Senior Full-Stack Web Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: Position Summary Are you looking to bring your creativity to Tech and Real Estate? To join a company who cares about its people? Then join us at TestFit Inc. on our mission to democratize intelligent building design of commodity buildings. Core to our democratic mission is the development of a web environment for TestFit. If this sounds right up your alley, come join TestFit as a Senior Web Developer! We are looking for a detail-oriented, highly motivated, and tenacious individual that is excited to lead our product into the cloud. We’ve built a high powered desktop tool, and now it’s time to make it collaborative. Who we are TestFit is a well-funded 4-year old startup disrupting the feasibility stage of real estate development. Our building configurator helps developers, architects, urban planners, and more to solve site plans for multifamily, hotels, parking, and industrial buildings in seconds. We’re a small but growing team who is both tenacious and humble enough to keep learning. TestFit takes an old-school stance on software development. We hope to restore the magic of computing each time an entire site is laid out in less than 50 milliseconds. By using stable and proven tools instead of chasing fad-driven development, our team tackles hard problems with laser-like focus. Who you are You’re a motivated senior web developer seeking a new challenge. You’re a self-starter, have the vision to build our cloud architecture from its infancy, and aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty being the first developer on this program. You have 3+ years of software development experience, and you’re not the type to jump on the latest software fad - you know how to build something that lasts. You’ve lived with your own code long enough to understand what makes a platform stable and maintainable for years to come! You also have enough experience that you can provide feedback to help improve our team’s development process to make us as scalable as possible in future. Successful candidates in this role may have the opportunity to grow the web team underneath them if they demonstrate enough knowledge and leadership. You’re a quick learner and self-motivated to work independently - no one’s holding your hand here! You’re results-oriented, and openly share your ideas for improvements to workflows and methods to get even better results, faster. Duties and Responsibilities The Senior Web Developer will; Design, develop and maintain TestFit’s new cloud services, mostly back-end. Extend our current account portal, written in PHP Own all tasks involved in the web development life cycle from start to finish Communicate internally across teams to ensure the best possible product Eventually grow a team underneath them as our product and services scale Required Skills & experience Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science Minimum 3 years in web development Proven track record of building a solid product Motivated self-starter Detail-oriented Excellent communication skills Benefits A friendly team of smart colleagues working on a common mission: to democratize intelligent building design ROWE (Results-Only Work Environment) - no one will be leaning over your shoulder or chaining you to your (virtual) desk Vacation is based on ROWE Health benefits include medical, dental, vision, & basic life insurance US Holidays off 401K (match 5%) You can check out our website here: https://testfit.io/ Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $85,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday COVID-19 considerations: Remote Working Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: web development: 3 years (Required) Work Location: Remote

Title: Web Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
About Multiplier: 
 Multiplier enables companies to employ anyone, anywhere in a few clicks. Our SaaS platform combines the multi-local complexities of hiring & paying employees anywhere in the world, and automates everything. We are passionate about creating a world where people can get a job they love, without having to leave the people they love. We are looking for smart and talented people who will add on to our collective energy and share the same excitement. We are headquartered in Singapore, but our team is remote. 
 The Role: 
 We are looking for a web developer who can join our team and help us build and maintain our websites. With your knowledge in modern web development and your coding skills, you will to create a great user interfaces and a clean website layout that are responsive, robust and optimised. Your contribution will fasten our online presence which matters for our organization and drives customers and clients towards our organization. Projects may range in complexity from smaller tasks to bigger projects. Your ability to communicate and collaborate effectively and efficiently within a team is imperative. 
 What will I be doing? 
 Be the technical owner of website. You will be responsible for developing and delivering all needs related to web development at Multiplier. To do so you will write maintainable and reusable code. 
Collaborate closely with marketing, designers and tech team to ensure you building the best of quality web pages that are of high quality and very well performing. 
Participate actively in brainstorming sessions to drive development of powerful conceptual solutions; develop and present creative ideas based on input from creative, social and marketing teams. 
Provide advice to the marketing team on website optimization opportunities and supporting implementation. 
Improve usability by collaborating with back-end developers and web designers to improve usability. 
Test and optimize websites, code, and assets for maximum speed and scalability over multiple devices and browsers 
Working on multiple web development projects to deliver the business needs as aligned with your stakeholders, on time and up to standard. 
 What do I need? 
 You have a current online Portfolio - which shows your grasp of web development skills and exposure to modern web development. 
4+ years of professional experience in modern web development. 
Very strong knowledge and understanding of HTML5, CSS3, Javascript and and the use of them in the context of website development. 
Experience in building websites on modern CMS, preferably experience and understanding of Webflow. 
Good knowledge and understanding of web technologies and how the internet works. 
Deep knowledge of responsive UI design standards, UX methodologies, and web design production techniques. 
Shown experience originating new concepts and innovative design approaches for web which have significant impact on marketing efforts. 
 Feel free to apply even if you feel unsure about whether you meet every single requirement in this posting. As long as you're a quick learner, and are excited about changing the status quo for tech recruitment, we're happy to support you as you come up to speed with our tech stack. 
 Perks 
 Flexible vacation. 
Flexible work times. 
Work from anywhere. 
Health Insurance 
 Equal employment opportunity Multiplier is an equal opportunity employer: we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Front End Web Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
The Jackson Laboratory is recruiting for a remote, US based Front End Web Developer on our Strategic Communications team. Be a part of the success at JAX and play a key role in our digital design process! 
This position is responsible for translating digital designs into production-ready web assets that work across all use cases, devices and browsers. Reporting to the Senior Web Architect and working closely with the User Experience Designer III, Strategic Communications, the Front End Developer uses a deep knowledge of CSS, HTML and Javascript to produce technically sustainable and functional digital components that integrate with existing technical infrastructure to maintain a consistent brand experience across The Jackson Laboratory’s (JAX’s) digital properties. 
This position is a critical link in building a scalable system to translate business requirements into functional, production-quality digital components. As JAX continues to expand and diversify our business and research areas, the web will grow in importance as the front door for anyone who wants to interact with the Laboratory’s people, data, products or services. A system to quickly and accurately design, build and deploy digital components is required infrastructure for JAX’s growth goals. 
Key aspects of this role include: 
Production of high-quality web components using well-formed and clearly structured code 
Interface with UX Designer and internal clients to define technical needs 
Assists Senior Web Architect in maintaining web development operations systems to ensure clean, error free deployments 
Analyze metrics to evaluate success of new features and improve, manage testing systems 
Optimize existing pages, perform web maintenance 
Desired experience and education includes: 
Five years developing HTML5, CSS, JavaScript in a high-volume production environment 
Bachelor’s Degree required. 
Sitecore Certified Front End Developer (preferred) 
Experience as part of an Agile development team with Azure DevOps environment 
Proven ability to interact with clients and produce well-formed code under tight deadlines 
Deep familiarity with responsive design and current trends in digital development 
Additional preferred experience: Gulp, Sass, Git/Gitflow, React/Angular 
Please submit examples of work, portfolio or link to work as well as a resume and cover letter! 
#LI-LP1 
About JAX: 
The Jackson Laboratory (JAX) is an independent, nonprofit biomedical research institution with more than 2,400 employees. Headquartered in Bar Harbor, Maine, it has a National Cancer Institute-designated Cancer Center in Augusta, Maine, a genomic medicine institute in Farmington, Connecticut, and facilities in Ellsworth, Maine, Sacramento, California, and Shanghai, China. Its mission is to discover precise genomic solutions for disease and empower the global biomedical community in the shared quest to improve human health. 
JAX employees work in a collaborative, value-driven, and team-based environment where the focus is on advancing science and improving patients’ lives. Researchers apply genetics to increase the understanding of human disease and advance treatments and cures for cancer, neurological and immune disorders, diabetes, aging, and heart disease. JAX was voted among the top 15 “Best Places to Work in Academia” in the United States in a poll conducted by The Scientist magazine! 
EEO Statement: 
The Jackson Laboratory provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, age, mental disability, physical disability, medical condition, gender, sexual orientation, genetic information, ancestry, marital status, national origin, veteran status, and other classifications protected by applicable state and local non-discrimination laws.

Comit Developers looking for a skilled Web Designer/Developer who will be responsible for developing and/or designing websites for our company. You will be working alongside a team of other talented developers in creating, maintaining, and updating our websites. 
 
For you to succeed in this role, you will need to be proficient in PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript / JQuery, and WordPress with solid knowledge of responsive design and SEO best practices. Experience working with Divi a plus but not required.

Title: Search Engineer - Front End - Oregon - Indeed.com
Description:
Search Engineer - Frontend 
 
Brave Search is looking for talent to make search.brave.com better. Your work will impact the future of search to be used by millions of people. Brave search engine is fully autonomous and independent with its own ranking, crawling and indexes, aiming to offer a true alternative to Microsoft and Google. Plenty of challenges, if that triggers you and feel you can contribute, do not hesitate to apply. 
 
Location 
 
Anywhere, but European timezones preferred (or at least a significant overlap with European timezones). 
 
Job Description: 
 
As a Frontend Engineer you will be part of our search team and work very closely with our Design, Product, Business Development and Marketing teams. 
 
Search is a very performance-sensitive application and you will be responsible for front-end, and some back-end, development. You will own, build, and develop new and existing capabilities into the search page. 
 
You should be very familiar with HTML, CSS, Python, Javascript and have strong design principles. We currently use a mixture of tools but are primarily using Fastapi and Svelte. If you obsess over fast, performant, and beautiful web applications then you should apply. 
 
Requirements: 
 
 Deep understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript. 
 Advanced knowledge of Python. 
 Experience working with a design team to implement a front-end design system. 
 Experience developing API Gateways. 
 Experience working with a front-end framework/library such as React, Vue, Angular, or Svelte. 
 Experience building a responsive website across various screen sizes 
 Understanding of security issues surrounding all aspects of the front-end 
 Ability to work fast and under tight deadlines 
 
 Nice-to-have 
 
 Remote work experience 
 Experience with Svelte. 
 Understanding CDN systems, cache purging 
 Experience deploying and managing AWS services and web apps 
 
 Responsibilities 
 
 Communicate with Design, Product to determine requirements and assets for functionality on the Brave Search web application. 
 Maintain existing components and features on Brave Search. 
 Effectively translate designs into performant and fully responsive pages or apps. This occasionally involves offering design suggestions in order to better accommodate various screen sizes. 
 Ensuring high-performance and availability. 
 Keeping us to a high security standard 
 Work collaboratively with geographically-distributed team members to help identify and fix bugs

Title: Software Engineer Front End, The Wildest - San Francisco, CA 94118 - Indeed.com
Description:
WHO WE ARE 
 
Kinship is here to help everyone pet parent like a pro. Why? Because our pets make us better humans, and we owe them the best possible care. As the premier partner to a new generation of pet parents, we use our data, products, and services to help people be the best pet parents they can be. And we unite changemakers in pet care to break down barriers, open new doors, share insights, and advance our collective knowledge. All so we can reimagine the pet parenting experience, up people's confidence, and help the world find better ways to care. 
 
Kinship is a coalition that includes: 
 
 Adopt-a-Pet, the destination for finding homes for homeless pets; we help animal shelters, humane societies, SPCAs, pet rescue groups, and pet adoption agencies connect their homeless pets to millions of adopters a month 
 Our world-leading Wisdom Panel™ genetic health screening and DNA testing for dogs 
 The award-winning Whistle™ GPS dog tracker and health monitor 
 Pet Insight Project, our ground-breaking science team that uses AI to turn billions of data points into actionable insights 
 Vet Insight our expert-driven, on-demand pet health platform 
 The Wildest, the destination that helps pet parents keep their cool in the wild world of pet parenting 
 GoodFriend, our recently-launched marketplace for all your pet's people 
 PetStory, our platform that curates top services for pet parents in Russia 
 FluffyGo, the mobile-first platform is a one-stop solution for science-minded pet parents in China 
 LEAP VENTURE STUDIO, our accelerator that supports innovators and start-ups, allowing Kinship to bring new solutions to pet parents 
 
 Together, these teams and more work to set new standards in pet care. And, as a part of Mars Petcare, they work to create a better world for pets. Learn more at www.kinship.co. 
 
 OUR TEAM 
 
 We are the department that creates user experiences and tools to improve the lives of Pets. Our teams consist of engineers focusing on front-end, back-end, and QA. Creating the best possible products using data-driven decision making, to essentially be a window into the Kinship ecosystem, working lockstep with our other departments including Product, Data & Analytics, Growth, & Marketing. 
 
 HOW YOU'LL HELP EVERYONE PET PARENT LIKE A PRO 
 
 As a Front-End Engineer of this Kinship Engineering team, you'll collaborate with a team engineers, including offshore and in-house to create the best customer experience possible. This role is a key position to accomplish functions such as: 
 Maintain high quality in both code and customer experience 
 Integrations with other Kinship technologies 
 Assisting engineers, and representation of the front-end status 
 Stay up to date with the latest web libraries and frameworks 
 Working with the product team and aligning on schedules and roadmap 
 Working closely with the QA team to assure comprehensive testing 
 Work with the Data & Analytics team as well as within OneKinship team to make sure we're as data-driven as possible 
 THE PRO WE'RE LOOKING FOR 
 
 As Kinship people, we have three pillars that set out how we aim to be-in our everyday work, and in how we approach each other. We call these our Cultural Pillars. In all of the roles that we hire for, we look for people who are Optimistic, Purposefully Inquisitive, and Open to All. 
 And for this role, you'll need these skills to knock it out of the dog park: 
 
 LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES: 
 You Have Courage:  a willingness to bring forth a new idea, engaging others across Kinship to support you, and taking risks and action will full accountability 
 You Learn at Pace:  a consistent and fast work ethic to meet growth goals, and the ability to evolve and pivot quickly from what you've learned 
 You Value Difference:  a genuine belief in inclusion and diversity is in your DNA, and it shows up in your work, and how you work. 
 TECHNICAL SKILLS: 
 3+ years of experience as a software engineer, with web apps/sites and other web technologies comprising of at least the last 2 years or more. Strong knowledge of Javascript, React, CSS, HTML 
 Experience with Gatsby 
 Experience working with CMS systems 
 Experience with Google Analytics and other relevant web / mobile analytics tools 
 Functional knowledge or hands-on design experience with REST 
 Must have a strong understanding of UI, cross-browser compatibility, general web functions and standards. 
 
 JOIN OUR PROS! 
 
 Unique opportunities for a customizable career within pet care 
 A super collaborative, flat work environment with direct access to our senior leadership team 
 Work from the hottest cities across the world 
 Dog-friendly workplaces 
 Medical, dental, vision, 401k match, and pet benefits for you and your family 
 Unlimited paid time off 
 Flexible work opportunities 
 Parental leave for the birth or adoption of your new human child (and fur baby) 
 Discounts on pet products, services, nutrition and veterinary wellness plans 
 Welcome kits with pet merch & Kinship swag 
 An extensive onboarding program with a chance to meet all of our leaders across Kinship

Description:
Front End Developer 
 
Job Number: 210587 
 
Primary Location: US-IL-Bloomington 
 
Other Locations: US-GA-Alpharetta 
COUNTRY Financial is seeking a  Software Developer  to join our Agency & Marketing Systems Application Development team. As part of the team, you will focus on designing, developing, implementing new applications or enhancements to existing software solutions used by Agency & Marketing at COUNTRY Financial. 
 This position offers a hybrid work schedule and can be based out of our corporate offices in Bloomington, IL or Alpharetta, GA. 
 How does a Software Developer make an impact? 
 Designs solutions after gathering business and technical requirements. 
 Develops software solutions that are high performing and meet technical standards. 
 Supports testing and problem solving/debugging of solutions. 
 Implements software solutions following best practices. 
 
 Do you have what we're looking for? 
 Experience with the full stack development using technologies such as Java, PHP, Angular, Spring Boot, Ionic etc.. 
 PHP development experience including CURL, RESTful calls & understanding of CSRF and CSP processes in page construction. 
 Experience with Bootstrap and JQuery Javascript frameworks. 
 Responsive web page development experience using fluxbox and/or bootstrap grid understanding. 
 Angular experience using Ionic framework a plus. 
 Typically requires bachelor’s degree and at least 5 years of information technology experience (or equivalent, such as 7 years of expierence or master's degree and 3 years of experience). 
 
 This position is part of a job family. Placement will be determined by skills and qualifications of the candidate. 
 Why work with us? 
 Our employees and representatives serve nearly one million households with our diverse range of personal and business insurance products as well as retirement and investment services. We build relationships and work together to create a stronger, more secure future for our clients and our communities. We’re a big company, yet small enough you can make an impact and won’t get lost in the shuffle. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow throughout your career, either within this role or by exploring other areas of our business.
 You’ll be able to take advantage of our benefits package, which includes insurance benefits (medical, dental, vision, disability, and life), 401(k) with company match, parental leave, paid time off, paid company holidays and time off to volunteer in your community.  COUNTRY Financial is committed to providing equal opportunity in all areas of employment, and in providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, national origin, disability, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations. 
 Come join our team at COUNTRY today!

Title: Frontend Developer - Massachusetts - Indeed.com

Who We Are 
 
Nacelle was built for technology-forward merchants drawn to the benefits of a headless architecture but dissatisfied with the costs and complexity associated with adoption. Leaders at FTD.com, Boll & Branch, and Thinx use Nacelle to eliminate the typical maintenance costs and infrastructure complexities related to going headless while accelerating their time-to-market. Unlike traditional commerce solutions, our product is built on event-driven and elastic core technology optimized for flexibility, performance, and customization. 
 
Nacelle is an early stage, venture-backed, fully remote company. Recently closing our Series B round for $50m, our institutional investors include Tiger Global, Index Ventures, Inovia and more. We also have raised from notable industry angels including leaders from Shopify Plus, Attentive, and Klaviyo. 
 
 
The Role

This role is responsible for ensuring the alignment of design and UX requirements, optimizing the application for usability, performance, and maintainability.  Benefits & Perks:

 Unlimited PTO 
 An extremely enthusiastic team that appreciates collaboration

Title: Senior Front-End Engineer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
JOB TITLE:  Sr Front-End Engineer 
LEVEL:  Senior 
LOCATION:   Remote 
REPORTS TO:  Head of Engineering 
About Catch&Release 
We are a VC-backed technology company creating a marketplace that, for the first time, connects the advertising industry to the entire internet as a source of content that can be licensed for commercial campaigns. As we scale, our platform will be the backbone of a new economy that empowers millions of people across the internet to get paid and recognized for the content they create every day. 
Our customers include Google, Verizon, P&G, Instagram, Jeep, Budweiser, and many more, and they have used our platform to produce advertising campaigns that have been seen by hundreds of millions of people, including many Super Bowl spots. 
We are a virtual-first company with team members concentrated in California and New York, and others distributed across the country. 
About the Role 
Catch&Release Engineering is building the platforms, experiences, and tools necessary to power our mission to License the Internet, and we are hiring our first team of dedicated Front-End Engineers! Reporting to the Head of Engineering, this role will partner with designers, creative technologists, and backend engineers to develop, improve, and deliver experiences that delight our users. 
What You’ll Do 
Utilize React.js, HTML, CSS and Javascript to develop and deliver user-facing products and features 
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders to deliver experiences that delight our users 
Partnering with other engineering teams to refine requirements and scoping to iteratively deliver product predictably and with speed 
What You Bring 
3+ years of experience with UCD design and front-end engineering 
A relentless obsession and a deep sense of curiosity about our users and a drive to provide them with an exceptional experience 
Ability to thrive in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment by embracing an experiment-driven, fail-fast culture 
What Will Make You Stand Out 
Experience with design systems like Figma, Zeplin, and Storybook 
Mobile development experience 
Familiarity with modern Jamstack development techniques 
GraphQL expertise 
Experience with backend development languages and frameworks. 
Who We Are 
At Catch&Release we like to build, not maintain; create, not just operate. We're a unique collection of agency experts, engineers, product designers, filmmakers, artists, marketers and licensing experts; pioneers who are building a platform that will change the content industry. As the first company to build technology that curates and licenses content from the internet, innovation has been part of our DNA since day one. 
Our Values 
Trust is the core of who we are... 
Collaboration 
We believe anything is achievable by rowing in the same direction toward team goals. This requires radical presence, a spirit of “YES, And”, and embracing healthy conflict. 
Courage 
We pursue uncharted waters as we change an industry. Our vision demands we learn through discomfort, remain open to the unexpected, and believe in where we’re going. 
Empathy 
We promote understanding and vulnerability among our team members, customers and contributors. By listening to perspectives and creating context, we build clarity and focus in every interaction. 
Balance 
We seek equilibrium to grow and thrive, maintaining healthy minds and bodies to do our best work. Being intentional and flexible with our time creates a sustainable environment where we can achieve & exceed our highest goals. 
Integrity 
We seek truth even if it challenges our thoughts. We do the right thing unflinchingly, and we create an environment where everyone can be their authentic selves. 
Some of the Perks 
Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability insurance 
24/7 Telemedicine medical services including mental health 
Pet Insurance 
Flexible PTO policy 
Stock option grant 
Funding support from well respected VCs 
Flexible, virtual-first culture 
Home office stipend 
Employee referral bonuses 
Get In Touch 
Ready to make a sizable impact and redefine the advertising production industry? Apply now! 
For more information, please visit www.catchandrelease.com or on social @catchandrelease. 
Catch&Release, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. 
 f0qjNIgyzg

Title: Entry Level Web Developer - South Plainfield, NJ 07080 - Indeed.com
Description:
Overview: 
Since its founding in 1992, Edgewood Properties has established itself as a leading real estate development and property management company. With corporate headquarters in New Jersey, the company is on a course of growth leading to activities across the nation. Given ongoing construction and development plans, our current apartment portfolio of 5,000 plus units is expected to double in the next couple of years and rise to over 10,000 units in the next five years.
 Given our rapid portfolio growth, coupled with ownership's desire to develop and hold rather than sell, the timing is ideal for qualified candidates to come on-board.
 
 
We're currently seeking a  Entry Level Web Developer  to work at our South Plainfiend, NJ office 
This is an on-site position, not remote. 
Position Description 
This is an on-site position, not remote. Please provide a link to your portfolio showcasing websites/projects you've worked on in the past. 
Position Description 
The  Entry Level Web Developer  will be expected to work directly under the senior website developer using best practices while developing and designing websites.
 Assisting in development of new web pages, development of Wordpress page templates/custom themes, creating/deploying PPC landing pages and updating existing websites. 
 
Responsibilities:
 Assist in designing and developing new websites 
Update and maintain existing internal and public facing websites / PPC Landing Pages 
Configure latest tracking codes in Google Analytics / Setup Goals / Google Tag Manager / Facebook Pixel 
Occasionally write HTML for Eblast templates 
Optimize websites for SEO and page load speed 
Qualifications:
 
The successful candidate will offer 2-3 years of experience in frontend website design and development.
 You are someone that pays strong attention to detail and has the ability to complete projects on time. 
Minimum of 2+ years of experience in web development and design. 
Experience working with JavaScript, PHP, and Wordpress. 
Experience with Linux CLI / LAMP stack. 
Experience with front-end design and development (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, etc.). 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
Please provide a link to your portfolio showcasing websites/projects you've worked on in the past. 
For immediate consideration, please apply online at  www.edgewoodproperties.com/careers. 
In return, we offer competitive compensation, along with comprehensive benefits, including medical and dental and vision benefits, life insurance,
 a 401(k) with company match and a corporate team environment with opportunity of advancement. Also includes on-site company fitness gym, discounts on housing and home appliances. 
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.
